Reviews.Title: “wonderful location!!!! but rooms just ok”
Reviews.Author: beachmomma44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Catamaran May 2011 for a long weekend getaway, and our first trip to San Diego. We loved the location of this hotel and found it was so convenient to both Pacific Beach as well as the lovely Bay area. We did not use the Spa, but enjoyed the outdoor patio restaraunt as well as the hot tub area. The grounds are lovely, with tropical fish, parrots, and beautiful plants and palms. We rented bikes for a reasonalble rate just down the street, but you can rent right from the hotel. We really enjoyed biking around the beach boardwalk both on the pacific side as well as around the bay. The hotel is kind of far from downtown, we took a cab for one day, but decided to spend most of our time closer to the hotel and enjoy the area there. Close to some good restaraunts along Pacific Beach where you can dine watching the sun set. Other than the dated older rooms this hotel is really nice. Who spends time in their rooms when you go to San Diego anyway???

Reviews.Title: “lovely setting on mission bay”
Reviews.Author: calkid
Reviews.Content: attended a conference at the catamaran in march. luscious grounds, stayed in the tower for a very nice price. room had double bed and small kitchen with full refrig and coffee maker. did not use the pool or hot tub but did get a stone massage in their spa which has a wonderful steam room and sauna. food was good, service also good. walking distance to grocery store and restaurants. would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: janelitamirta
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminds me that you can't compare apples with pears. You can't compare a 5 star hotel like the Ritz Carlton at Kapalua with the Catamaran resort. Not the same category. But a 3 star category hotel can be very good. The location is very nice, and my room has a lovely view of the bay. It just happened that the conference my daughter is attending is being held at this hotel. I'd rather be in a 5 start, deluxe hotel but you choose the conference, not the hotel. The prices for a 3 star hotel should be right for the location and the season. Unfortunately, it is spring break, so the prices are not that low and there is too much noise for my liking, but that's not the hotel's fault. In short, I'd rather be at the Del, but the Catamaran is a nice hotel for its class.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility and Location”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: The facilities were excellent. Very quiet rooms. Exceptionally clean, especially the rugs! Self parking lot (room key required for enterance AND exit helped with security) was very convenient and close to the elevators. It was fantastic having a refrigerator, microwave, sink and OVEN in the room. Made our 5 day stay super flexible for meals. Excellent hotel food while also having many close by restaurants within 5-10 minute walk or drive. The grounds as spotless and having the facility right on misson bay was great as well a a five minute walk across the street to the ocean. The family would certainly come back to this facility. Bob M

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Kathy K
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful.. People very friendly.. we loved this place and would highly recommend.. Although a bit pricey.. The rooms could use some updating..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Surroundings and great location”
Reviews.Author: nerual
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful with a tropical feel. The location is amazing, next to the inlet and across from the beach. The rooms are not 100% updated but nice. The staff is friendly and accomodating. I do feel it is a little pricey...Rooms aren't that nice and you have to pay for parking. Pros- free wifi great location pretty friendly staff Cons- A little expensive parking fees

Reviews.Title: “Next Best Thing to Polynesia”
Reviews.Author: TomFromTucson
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the "Cat" over a ten-year period. Perhaps the best feature is the location, with Mission Bay behind and Pacific Beach across the street. We opted for a pool-view room and enjoyed the convenience it offered. The atmosphere was so pleasant on the wide upper deck I preferred spending time there instead of the room. The rooms are a bit dated but comfortable and clean, nicely decorated and reasonably roomy. I love the Cat for it's authentic south-Pacific feel and everything that goes with it. The Friday luau is a great time, watercraft and bicycle rentals are conveniently close and the steamboat ride is fun (especially the fireworks tour). When I enter the lobby with it's lush waterfall I can feel the stress of everyday life wash away. It is now a familiar home away from home. One improvement I'd like would be a quick-food option for convenience and budget. However, the restaurant is a great upscale option if time and money are no concern. Parking is an exercise in patience at times but maybe inevitable given the location and popularity with visitors and conferees. People who aren't particularly enthralled with a Polynesian environment might not appreciate the Cat and prefer a more modern premium resort instead. But for me and family, it's always a refreshing pleasure to look forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the catamaran”
Reviews.Author: Debby P
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days in the tower on the 10th floor. What a great view, very nice room. Loved the floor to ceiling windows, excellent staff, wonderful tropical grounds, great food in the restaurant... but what ruined our vacation was the morning of our check out, we were late for our flight so we were in a hurry. Caught our plane, upon landing at Sea/Tac airport that's when I realized I forgot to empty out the top 2 drawers in our room. I Called housekeeping at about 6 pm, and told about the items I left behind. She said her staff of 2 found some clothing and a camera. What wasn't recovered was a wood grained cigar box full of all my jewelry worth over $2000. I am totally devastated and sick about this! I sure learned a hard lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach/bay but hotel is dated”
Reviews.Author: Alikatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights from Friday to Tuesday. It's off season but hotel seemed full at this time. Location's a plus on Mission Bay. We liked the garden-like tropical setting but everything looked dated. Didn't see anyone swimming or going in the water in the bay though. Granted it's winter but locals told us it's not a swimming bay but just for water sports like kayaking, sailing, etc. Dated rooms and carpeting on the 1st floor. I don't know about the other areas. Also we were charged $13 per day to park our car in their parking area. It's not prohibitive but guests should have complimentary parking I think. Pool area's clean and is surrounded by lush gardens, a plus but there's no food or drinks service. I was told it's the season but nonetheless it's almost full with many guests enjoying the sun so why isn't there any service provided for us? No one greeted us for over 10 minutes when we sat down for breakfast on Monday morning at the restaurant so we just helped ourselves at the buffet offering. I had to approach someone for coffee service. It's not out first choice but worth a try anyway.

Reviews.Title: “nice spot in great location (for twenty something)”
Reviews.Author: u114193
Reviews.Content: this is a nice spot on a good location on Mission Bay. It is a couple blocks from the ocean and right on the bay. We had a great room on the 8th floor of the tower that had view of the bay, the ocean, downtown and the bridge to coronado. Two things that we didn't like: 1) We went to the cocktail lounge on both Feb. 18th and 19th and had to wait for about 10 minutes before being greeted and another 10 minutes to get our drinks. We thought maybe the first evening was a fluke, but it was repeated on Sunday evening as well. The restaurant did have a good breakfast, but a bit pricey. 2) We had neighbors across the hall from us, all 10 twenty somethings in a room meant for 4 people that were partying all day and night on Sunday the 19th. We saw quite a few younger loud people at the resort. Maybe that is what we should expect on Mission Bay. Next time we will stay in La Jolla. If you are part of the younger party crowd, probably a good place for you. If you are nearing 50 and looking for a relaxing place....look again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToniMatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catamaran for a conference. The conference rooms and support were great. The view out to Mission Bay is wonderful and the grounds/gardens are amazing. Great location in Pacific Beach, too. We took the short bay excursion boat (included in the room rate) to the Bahia Resort one evening and had a great time on that, too. My only quibble was the shower water temp in our room--likely related to a toilet flushing somewhere else in the system or something. It would fluctuate from very hot to very cold now and then, usually just as I lathered up with shampoo. Oh, well.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: JP G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the "bed and breakfast" special for an overnight stay. The Catamaran exceeded our expectations. The room and balcony were large. The hotel grounds are like a private park with ducks, fish and a few talking exotic birds. The pool is large and clean. The Atoll restaurant is pricier than most family restaurants but the food is very good and the view is wonderful. The "American" breakfast included with the bed and breakfast special included eggs, bacon, hashed browns, decent coffee and real freshly squeezed juice served, all served by a real waiter. My wife does not eat eggs and they substituted fresh fruit without charge. This hotel is not close to the airport or Sea World but the location was perfect for us. There are beaches on both sides of the resort. Highly recommended for those who want to pamper themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: kss123
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great area! I loved the fun little shops in the area. But more than that, what a wonderful tropical feel to this special resort. The beach is clean and well maintained. The interior grounds feel like you are in a rain forest. The parrots "speaking" to you as you walk by is unique and fun for all. The staff are friendly and attentive. The food was terrific! This is truly just a nice place to stay if you are in the San Diego area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: travelpanthers
Reviews.Content: Hard to find places like this, perfect resort for a family getaway. Stayed here over new years 2011 and was great. The location is perfect, there is tons of stuff to do, food is close and has a beach on both sides of the resort. We love this place because it really feels like you have left for a tropical escape. Only bad thing that we got was a terrible Mojito from the bar but I think the bar tender was just confused for a min, otherwise stay was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: dgnancy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay on Mission Bay. We spent our first 4 nights in downtown San Diego, then moved to this beautiful, tropical resort. The grounds are lovely (coy ponds and waterfalls), the personnel are very friendly and helpful, and our second floor suite was huge with a balcony overlooking the bay. My son enjoyed the water sports and we both enjoyed the delicious Sunday brunch. The short, one block walk to Pacific Beach was fun and we spent a lot of time watching the surfers and walking along the shore. I will definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to anyone I know who wants to stay on Mission Bay while in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Dean R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 20th Wedding Anniversary weekend at the Catamaran Resort Hotel (3 days) - We had a ground floor water front room and we couldn't ask for anything more for the price. Being that this was the "off" season when we went, you would never be able to tell the difference. The friendly staff from check-in, to the bell desk, the bar, to the restaurants were all top notch. We will always try to make the Catamaran our "go-to" destination while decided our next vacations, and will also recommend to our friends and families ... Dean Rohan

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous week in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: rramjam
Reviews.Content: Beautiful oasis on Mission Blvd. A wonderful calm bay, boardwalk and sun rise just outside the back doors. On the otherside across the street, the fantastic Pacific, powerful waves and unbelieveable sun sets! At the resort, great service and happy hour prices at Morays lounge, Hi Bill! At the Atoll, great food, friendly services. Entire staff friendly and helpful. Don't miss going to The Del Coronado and the Sunset Cliffs -fantastic - along with the zoo and whale watching. We had several breakfasts at Mission Cafe, just a short walk along the boardwalk behind the resort to San Jose Blvd. And my husband met up with an old Army buddy from 44 years ago!

Reviews.Title: “We plan on a return visit here”
Reviews.Author: minitraveler2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay here, as a wrap up to a business trip. We booked it through an online site after reading reviews. Our room was in the tower, and also beside the elevator. As I stepped off the elevator the first time & saw the proximity, I thought for sure we'd be changing rooms. I was surprised, but fortunately, the elevator was no bother! Our room was a king deluxe, spacious, & it overlooked the bay. We had a gorgeous view. I'm not sure the view would be any good below the fifth floor though. As some have mentioned, the room has some telltale signs of age. It is still very clean though. I've seen worse things in 5* hotels. Even the corners weren't dusty as most rooms are. The room included free wifi. There is only one restaurant on site, the Atoll. The food was tasty, but not cheap. The dinner cheque for two came to around $100, which included 1-2 hi balls. We used room service numerous times throughout our stay, at different times of the day. It is without a doubt, the fastest room service I've experienced. The food was still fresh & tasty. Even when we asked to order something off of a different, not that time of day menu, the food was still delivered fresh & quick. The pool area was clean & well stocked with lounge chairs/towels. In their brochures, it says water is 80 deg, but hmmm, not sure about that. Kids there still enjoyed it. We used the spa a few days too, and it was clean & well stocked. There is a separate whirlpool there for spa guests only if you want something a little quieter than poolside. The couples massage was excellent & well-priced for a spa. Still more expensive than you would find at home, but good for surroundings. Water sport rentals are available too. Prices seemed reasonable, but I don't have anything to compare to. We enjoyed an afternoon on the water trying out some new things. We are planning a return vacation there with the whole family in the next month or so.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: thehappycampers
Reviews.Content: Pros: First, I must comment on the beautiful grounds throughout the resort. The tropical Polynesian feel was like paradise. Loved the Koi ponds, the plentiful ducks, the macaws, the tiki torches lit at night, and the gorgeous greenery throughout. ...We had a room facing Mission Bay and it was very nice sitting out on the porch early morning, sipping coffee, watching the joggers and dog walkers pass by, while our son loved building sandcastles on the beach. The room was very clean and well stocked with towels, soap, shampoo, and coffee. The beds were comfortable, and so were the pillows (which is a refreshing change from some other hotels we've stayed). Every member of the staff was very friendly and welcoming throughout our stay and never hesitated to pass on a friendly "hello, welcome" as we passed by. Cons: $13/night parking..because we paid less than $100/night for our room, I cannot complain, but had we paid more, I'd expect complimentary parking for hotel guests. ...and though the resort itself is very family friendly, I felt the surrounding area of Pacific Beach lacked the family atmosphere..way too much traffic with lots of local bars and apartments which would be better geared toward younger singles. ...One more thing...our stay was in January, and had we visited during the summer, the resort is an easy short block from the beach, which would have made it very convenient to jump in the ocean at any given time..

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: Art F
Reviews.Content: The view of the pacific was the best part! The higher the better! The staff was ok ! It seemed like they were just going through the motions? If your coming to Cali stay in Carlsbad ! The town has a better vibe ! I recommend the Carlsbad Inn ! Same beach environment only much cleaner surroundings!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Getaway at the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: AmarilloFresh
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. We loved the Catamaran and would go back again. Our hotel was right by where they have the bird purches and loved seeing them everyday. The grounds are just beautiful and they Koy ponds are fun to see. Our room was just great, it was a bay view room and was just perfect. Since we went in January, it was a little chilly so we really enjoyed spending time around the fire pit. I wish we were still there now. If you have a chance to go and stay there, do it!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel -- Expedia is dead wrong”
Reviews.Author: esqEsq
Reviews.Content: Have travelled throughout the world for work and know a four star hotel when I stay at one. Expedia is dead wrong here. Maybe a 2 to 3 star property -- and a 2 if you are in room 100 where (a) near impossible to find a light socket, (b) half the room lights don't work, (c) the banging of the nearby lobby-access door wakes you, and (d) there is a frosted glass window that is the washroom and the other side of which is the hall outside. Had it not been almost 11pm in the evening of a one-night stay, I would have left. I paid almost $200 for the night and the best western across the road could have been had for almost half that amount and been on the ocean side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for the location and grounds. So worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Danean
Reviews.Content: As soon as you step out of your room or go on your balcony, you feel like you're at a resort. The rooms are dated and bland, but the views, location and grounds make the money spent worth it! I'm watching the sunrise from my 12th floor balcony as I write this. To my left are mountains, ahead is the sun rising over the bay with the city skyline ahead in the distance, and to my right are waves breaking on Pacific Beach. Below me are the immaculately manicured grounds and Catamaran's dock where sailboats power boats and kayaks can be rented. If you stay here, splurge on a room with a view of the bay. Some views are of the parking garage. That would have provided such a different experience. With my 12th-floor, bay view suite, I awaken to a sunrise over the bay and can enjoy the evening sunsets from the same location, though I chose to walk two short blocks to the ocean instead. I am a lady staying here alone and I feel entirely safe here. The staff have all been friendly and helpful, though not at all intrusive. I hope to stay here again soon! Oh, one small issue was that there was no hot water the first night, but it has been fine since. This is my third, and sadly, my last morning here.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: thrifty
Reviews.Content: We returned here again, this time for a pre-Christmas stay and it is still our favorite place. The location is brilliant, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and we found the service, cleanliness and overall appearance of the resort to be even better than on our last visit. This is a unique property in many respects. I would characterize it as a three-star hotel with five-star facilities. It's not for everyone but it works perfectly for us. It's a great place to relax! The only word of caution is that on busy occasions, like for example weekends, when there's a ball game or other big event, it will be loud and noisy. That's a fact! However, the rest of the time more than makes up for that. We will stay here again, for sure. The unique location, the beautiful gardens, the pool, bar, restaurant, spa and everything else makes this place simply unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, restful resort on Mission Bay (Sail Bay)”
Reviews.Author: cruzinSantaCruz_Ca
Reviews.Content: We booked this place sight-unseen for a 3-night trip after Christmas. So glad we did! Great location on a spit of land sandwiched between the ocean and the bay. Grounds are beautifully landscaped, with little surprises -- parrots, ducks, koi, tiki lamps -- plus a pool and hot tub. Ocean front room was worth the splurge. Great view of sunset from the Bayside walking path. Spa services were friendly and professional -- had a pedicure and decided to come back the next day for eyebrow waxing, half hour massage, and a half hour facial. Enjoyed room service for one breakfast. Great happy hour deal in the lounge. We walked across to Pacific Beach to eat most of our meals (The Green Flash, World Famous), and to enjoy the Ocean front walking path. For great, cheap food, we also recommend La Playa Taco Shop (3973 Mission Blvd) -- try the pozole and the HUGE serving of horchata. We've stayed several places in San Diego over the years. Overall, this resort is now one of our two favorite resorts in San Diego (the other is Pacific Terrace). Highly recommend Catamaran Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Spa and Massage at Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: mtntrash
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at this location, but I did have a fantastic spa experience here. It was amazing! Spa is complete with extremely clean locker, relaxation, steam, and sauna room(s), The massage therapist was one of the best I've had. She made sure it was interactive, asking questions and giving instruction during massage, but not so much that it distracted from the relaxing experience. It was great, and the rest of the property was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Run down , dirty, OVER-RATED by 4 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: Ministemel
Reviews.Content: Apparently they hand out 4 star ratings to anyone who applies! Filthy, run-down roach hotel!!! Skip this place for a 2 star!!!! At least you'll save some $!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy dirty!”
Reviews.Author: MinisterMel
Reviews.Content: I can tell what kind of hotel I'm in by the cleanliness of the elevator... Call me crazy, but it works every time. The elevator carpet looked like it had never been vacuumed, let alone cleaned. Combine that with the filthy sliding glass doors and popcorn ceiling in our room and you have a filth infested 5 roach special! Overpriced and run down. Do yourself a favor and try the Best Western on the beach! This place is disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Resort - not. Party central - maybe. Hot water - everywhere but shower.”
Reviews.Author: GarageBear
Reviews.Content: Yep, That sums it up. We arrived for a nice weekend at a resort that we had been to in the past. Looking for a quiet time we were greeted by a crowd similar to spring break gone wild. We were upgraded to a suite, probably because we paid over $500 for our weekend when everyone else there paid under $200. The decor was outdated, but clean, so no real concerns there, First off the water from the faucet was scalding hot on hot or cold. Both sinks, the one in the kitchen and the bath had the same issue. Obviously something was not plumbed correctly to get hot on the cold side. The shower however seemed to like to pulse from scorching hot to freezing cold. Then after midnight there was major partying and screaming coming from the rooms below us and across the way. It was as if they were in our room. Now maybe we should have taken them up on the screaming at 2 or 3 AM asking everyone to go skinny dipping, but we were there for alone time. We called the front desk after midnight to complain and were greeted by a statement "well, it IS the weekend, what do you expect" and then after insisting they said they would send security. By the continuing partying and noise they apparently didn't send anyone that had any hearing out to see what was going on. We complained again at check out and were told that they would make a note of it, but no apology or anything - until my review and response to their survey when I was offered a free basic room for one night and a refund for $100 on our stay. Yeah, right. A nice effort, but really a poor showing. I wonder what the restrictions are on using the room and am not sure if we will use it or not.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Catamaran Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpj028
Reviews.Content: I attended an event in San Diego which I recieved a group rate of $99/nt. The garden/pool view rooms are small and dated but have the latest 42" flat screens if you plan to hang in at night. The pool and spa areas are very nice. The exercise facilities, hot tub and spa services are worth the stay at this hotel. I was very impressed how well maintained and clean everything was. They truely have a resort feel and you are within a 5 minutes walk to the beaches on the ocean and bay. There is a restaurant and lounge area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Catamaran Spa Resort Hotel San Diego CA”
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: We booked very late but the hotel pulled out all the stops to get us a fantastic room with great views of the pacific. We have visited this hotel on three occasion and we have never been let down. They are as helpfully as they need to be without being intrusive, they have good bars and restaurants which are good value for money. The hotel gave excellent advice on their Spa facility but where not pushy about using their fantastic facilities. My wife and I had a very relaxing holiday with just the right amount of interaction with the hotel staff. The rooms were cleaned daily to a very high standard as was the rest of the hotel and the cleaning staff worked around your day, so no pressure to move out for cleaning. In fact the cleaning staff were all but invisible but extremely polite. Well don the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nicole w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights over Thanksgiving weekend and could not believe that there was no hot water (water was luke warm) for two days!!! We were told there were too many people in the hotel. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “My best in San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: Radim P
Reviews.Content: This resort is placed in ideal location-on bay shore & jump to the ocean & 15 min airport+downtown. Tropical ambiance with pool, jacuzzi is crowned by excellent relax zone and treatments. I recommend it for couples, but also luxury conferences. I like to stay in the bay view studio, from higher floors you have amazing view from the bay and ocean to downtown. Little kitchen and fitness just complete usual needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Customer service issues...”
Reviews.Author: Starrcee
Reviews.Content: This a a beautiful hotel right on the bay. Loved the location and tropical ambiance. What I didn't love was that the pool/ jacuzzi area was closed after dark due to a broken light. Unfortunately, this was not posted anywhere in advance. We ended up with a very unhappy child who had expected to finally get into the pool after a long day. The other issue was that we were charged far more for the room than the amount quoted over the phone. The staff eventually agreed to change the bill, after a fair amount of hassle. Make sure to take your email rate confirmation. Overall, a lovely hotel and they deserve another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Brady Bunch decor in a gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: swroller
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel if you're there for a conference or won't be spending much time in the room. The location is perfect - a couple blocks from the ocean, and on the bay on the other side. Beautiful. Walking into the lobby, I felt transported back to the 1970s, which is when this hotel was built, I would guess. The lobby, the hallways, and the rooms felt quite dated. Certainly functional and quite clean, but just not a recent look. The spa and workout facility, on the other hand, are great. It's a small gym, but good quality equipment, and the spa and locker room area is upscale all the way. I used the sauna and relaxed on a chaisse lounge listening to zen spa music while I tried to meditate my way around the business events of the day. Didn't work, but I felt like I was in an exclusive club. Overall, interesting place, great location, but a bit overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: V1rotate
Reviews.Content: Due to mixed reviews about the room quality we only booked three nights here but wish we had stayed longer. Maybe we were just lucky but our garden view room was very clean and probably refurbished as the front door brushed against new carpet. Out of season but with glorious weather at times we had the lovely pool to ourselves. The location is perfect. Out the back is a delightful cycle path around the bay and pacific beach is just one block away out the front. If you want to save some money then park on Bayard Street, search out Rays cruiser rental for $10/day and shop at Ralphs using their loyalty card which they freely give out.

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing wants sorting”
Reviews.Author: MIKEYDREAD
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in September. Annoyed about having to pay Â£15 a night for parking. On arrival we were allocated a room on the 10th floor with a stunning view. Unfortunately I suffer from mild vertigo and had to change rooms much to my wifeâ€™s chagrin as she is not a fellow sufferer. The desk clerk found me ground floor room which was fine. The hotel is in a beautiful spot just off a quite beach. Pool was great â€“nice and peaceful .What a contrast to that pool from hell I had recently experienced at the MGM Grand in Vegas! Surrounding area was nice too with a couple of sports bars nearby. Hotel is looking a bit tired but that doesnâ€™t really bother me.However the plumbing wants sorting. Couldnâ€™t get cold water out of the taps. Bar was cheap during happy hour but got a bit cold later on in the evening due to the breeze from the beach. Concierge was very obliging about hanging around on our last day and stayed round the pool until we left at 4pm. Would love to return earlier on in the year when hotter.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: addy-family
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the hotel, but we left prior to the end of our booked stay due to cold weather, instead of the sunny beaches that we were expecting. The hotel itself was a bit outdated, especially the bathrooms, which looked like they had seen better days. In summer, the Catamaran would be good, as it's in walkable distance to a supermarket, beaches, and other activities (e.g. bike riding, surfing, etc.) However, the AC in our room did not work, and some of the areas of the hotel smelt very bad.

Reviews.Title: “People make the difference”
Reviews.Author: launcher69
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is old, and probably could use some renovations to the rooms. The beds weren't the best, but the rooms were spacious and clean. But the staff at the Catamaran were some of the best I've ever encountered. From the front desk staff, the bar staff, the restaurant staff, to the convention organizers, they were spectacular. I don't think you could ask for people to treat you any better then they do at the Catamaran. I enjoyed my stay, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyMyVacations
Reviews.Content: Room was big with great view. Comfortable beds with awesome landscaping. Heated pool and spa were a plus. Enjoyed my stay very much and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “room was a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: emonty52
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice ..lots of green area....but, old and worn out....there is no table to sit or eat at in the room...no refrigerator in room and not extra vanity sink outside the bathroom as described on the web page....when i questioned all the missing amenities ...i was told there are so many rooms the description doesn't describe all the rooms....they did tell me they would send up a refrigerator ....needless to say....i have no refrigerator....each time i called i was told they don't know why or what is going on....it is now 3 1/2 hours since i was told they would bring one up....not.....i would never come back.....

Reviews.Title: “Tropical paradise in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Lynne A
Reviews.Content: What a great find in San Diego Mission Beach area. Sandwiched between the bay and the ocean has the feel of luxury resort property in Hawaii. Stocked with exotic birds and amazing tropical landscaping and with two real paddlewheel boats to traverse the bay to their sister property the Bahia. We found we had no real need to go anywhere else for food, entertainment and spa treatments. Plan on going back soon. My son is in love with the parrots

Reviews.Title: “Great escape!”
Reviews.Author: msil85
Reviews.Content: I stayed by myself and it was great. The food was good, not great. I spent time in the complimentary beach chairs and got a spa treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Xapis220
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 5 nights at the Catamaran Resort Hotel in San Diego. Our room was on the 10th floor of the tower and the view was beautiful - Mission Bay in front of us and the Pacific Ocean to the right of us. Everyone at the Catamaran were polite, helpful and catered to all of our needs. I would happily recommend this resort to anyone traveling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Fed M
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday and had a blast but the hotel is severely overpriced for what it is. Back when the hotel first opened, it must have been the jewel of Pacific Beach. Today it is in dire need of remodeling. Everything is old, except for a decent flatscreen tv and alarm clock. Beds are not comfortable, towels are old and look dirty, bathroom is small and run down, the roof on some of the buildings looks like it survived a nuclear bomb. On the plus side, you are only one block from the beach, staff was very friendly, the bar and restaurant are very affordable and good, and the fitness center is actually very nice. Overall, I would stay here again only if the room was 40% less than what I payed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tired resort”
Reviews.Author: VacaBoy
Reviews.Content: Great location on the bay. Front desk staff friendly and eager but need training in service and operations. First floor room in tower old and wet. Second night no fitted sheet - training or sheet shortage? Restaurant great location looking out at bay but staff again eager but needs direction. Grounds beautiful but seem a bit tired, not maintained as they once were. Stayed here several times, and it just seems to be graying and sliding away.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: tgpooch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our friends' wedding that was held on the hotel's beach. Overall, the location on the edge of Pacific Beach is great for access to the ocean as well as Mission Bay. The hotel grounds are very impressive with some amazing tropical landscaping, a nice pool, beach on the bay, and outdoor patio to enjoy a drink or two with friends. We stayed in a standard room, which was just okay, and slightly below average for a hotel of this reputation. The decor was decent with a nice flat screen TV and iHome alarm clock for your iphone/ipod, but the in-wall A/C was not very good and the room had a humid, almost damp feel to it. The bathroom was probably the low point - carpet under the sinks, and a standard shower tub with one of the lowest shower heads I've used. I'm 6'3 and usually it's not an issue, but I felt like Will Ferrell in the movie Elf when he was taking a shower and had to slash water up on his face. On top of that, their water heating system must be old, because every time we took a shower without fail the water temperature would fluctuate from scalding to cold with no warning (we weren't flushing our toilet or using the sink, either). Enjoyed the free Wi-fi access, but had to pay for parking, since it seems that parking is a premium in Pacific Beach, AND not to mention that their parking garage has an over abundance of compact car parking. Expect to take up two spots if you have a normal sized sedan. On a side note, they did not have any laundry facilities so my wife and I had to trek into town to find a laundry mat...I guess I would have hoped they had a small one on the grounds for families with that need. Overall, the room was average to below-average for a hotel like this, but the grounds were impressive and resort-like.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort located in ideal location. Rooms just need updating.”
Reviews.Author: Charliesmom23
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for riding bikes or walking on the bay or on the ocean. Plenty of restaurants and shops to walk to. The resort itself is gorgeous and even has a poolside bar and grille. The backside of the resort is on the bay and has excellent dining accomodations on the bay. Just gorgeous! They offer a free cruise (with cash bar) around the bay during your stay. They have bike rentals also. The rooms were big, but need some updating. They were clean, but very simple and old.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 527Trees1
Reviews.Content: This was the 6th hotel we had stayed in on our trip to California. Where we travelled from San Francisco to San Diego, so had already booked this hotel (through 'Trailfinders') before I read the reviews, so was very wary on arriving at the Catamaran Hotel and was thinking that I would be very disappointed. However found it to be one of the best hotels we had stayed in! And definitely on this trip. The reception and all the staff were very helpfull, and the reception area was very attractive with a waterfall and fish in the large pool. Our 'standard' room was on the ground floor, with 'patio' doors overlooking the well kept gardens, where there were ducks and parrots. The room was very clean and spacious. And the furniture was in good condition (no knocks). The bed linen was expensive, being very soft cotton, and was changed every day, as well as the 4 bath and hand towels. The water in the bathroom was always pipping hot as soon as you turned on the tap. Coffee was provided everyday in our room. The frigde was handy to keep fruit, milk and water As a guest booked via 'Trailfinders' we had breakfast provided up to $40 per day per room. This covered a full cooked breakfast, freshly squeezed Orange juice, toast, jam and coffee. The orange juice and coffee were topped up. This kept us going till our evening meal! The sun loungers and sun shades on the beach overlooking the bay were free to guests as well as Beach towels. This beach was swept early every morning. Although we didn't use it, the swimming pool and jacuzzi was always clean and the furniture around the pool area was new and of a good quality. The hotel also provided towels for the pool. The bar provded a 'Happy Hour' that was from 4.00pm-6.00pm, where the cocktails, wine and beer were half price. There is also a boat the 'Bahia Belle' that is free to guests, and takes you to a sister hotel 'The Bahia' that lies across the other side of the bay and runs every hour from 6.30pm - 01.30am. There were several conferences and weddings held on the 'South Beach' of the hotel whilst we stayed at the Catarmaran, but these did not interferre with us and what we wanted to. In fact they were a great source of entertainment, as we don't see these types of weddings in the UK! We really wished we had booked for a longer period. I would recommend this hotel and would definitelly return again if I returned to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Cataman Resort Hotel Mission Bay San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Montoyablu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for 5 nights in Sept and found it to be the best stay in all the hotels we visited during our vacation around California. Most rooms are set in 2 storey blocks away from the main reception area. We dined twice in the hotel restaurant, and found both the waiting staff and menu excellent. The garden area is exceptionally well maintained, with ponds ,brooks, ducks, carp, and even parrots. Rooms were very clean, and the view from our balcony was breath taking over Mission Bay. Staff all round were very friendly from reception to grounds staff. Highly recommend this hotel - you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobbiFarina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days for a conference. Negative: mold smell, probably not updated since 1970's, bathroom has cracked ceramic and old, stained tub, carpet stained, you will not be greated or even helped with your luggage when you arrrive, concier useless, loud with lots of parties in rooms and crying babies all hour, only one place to eat with a limited menu and expensive. Spa service providers were good but women at front desk were rude.Have to lug your luggage up two flights of steps..no elevator. Positive: grounds are beautiful, right on the bay and close walk to Ocean and grocery store and a Starbucks close walk. If you are acoustom to a 2 Star hotel and are not paying more you will be satisfied. If you expect or want a higher level of customer service or elegance look elseware.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Mission Bay area!”
Reviews.Author: Eric W
Reviews.Content: I have been going to San Diego for years and have stayed at several different hotels/motels. The Catamaran is by far the best. The staff is very friendly, The rooms are large and clean, great pool, food, etc.... It is located right on mission bay with the ocean just across the street. My kids love the parrots, ducks and playing in the bay. The Catamaran is the perfect place:)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and part your catarmaran”
Reviews.Author: SEAMUS M
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of people complaining about this resort after i had already booked and i almost changed and cancel my reservation because of it. We had a studio with two double beds facing the bay and the view was amazing. We found the staff extremely friendly and we ate at their restaurant for dinner which was fantastic. I travel to every corner of the world and i have stayed in 2 Star and the best 5 star hotels and I saw nothing wrong with this place. Sure it is not cheap but what do you expect sitting right on the water. I found it to be very relaxing and enjoyable like a mini Hawaii. My son and i sailed our catamaran all day and come evening we parked it right on the beach in front of the hotel and stopped by and had some appetizer which were perfect. My wife and daughter came to meet us later in the evening and we all had a wonderful meal. My kids went up to bed and we sat down in the Piano bar enjoying a few drinks after a fun day. If you want a place to sit down and relax at the beach this place is a perfect place for the weekend. The only complaint we had was that the room below us made allot of noise at 7am with a family of young children but that was no fault of the hotel. My only advice would be to get a room that is on the beach in one of the two story buildings instead of the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: leilaj80
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the 2 story building adjoining the lobby, which doesn't have an elevator. It faces the garden which is OK. The rooms are OK too; they do have a particular smell but it didn't bother me (that is, it wasn't unpleasant) and I am bothered by odors in general. The grounds are very nice. I enjoyed walking around through the tropical surroundings and then onto the beach facing the bay. No one swims in mission bay that I could see, which is too bad. It really would be ideal if it were a swimming beach. My daughter went to the pool and enjoyed it. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant; it looked pricey and I couldn't tell if it was worth it. They have a special before a particular time; we got there a couple of minutes after and they didn't give it to us. We went to the luau, which was overall a good experience ( convenient, lots of food and entertaining show). The only negative was that we got there early and had to wait about an hour for the action to begin. Would be better if they started entertainment earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: pam d
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel...older...but perfect location. Loved the BAY beach - mild water. We stayed in a suite and walked 50 yard to the shore - it was great. Food at restaurant is very good. We walked across the street to Pacific Beach, and were very happy to walk back to our "quiet" calm beach at the hotel! Very Hawaiian - loved watching the luau from our balcony. The Bahia boat cruise was a nice addition to our stay too! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Super 8”
Reviews.Author: 1PfLA
Reviews.Content: Booked a up-graded "Bay Front " room. Got a view of the lawn with screaming children in the front and a noisy bar in the back. The TV didn't work, the tub didn't drain and the security bar on the sliding door was broken. Asked about these "up-grades" the staff was completely unhelpful. Will not be back to this so-called resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: VickyandJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon. We got upgraded to a deluxe suite. At first we tought this was great as we had a beautiful view over the bay. However we were right next to the restaurant and on our second night there was a wedding. This kept us up till 2am with noise. The room was ok, but it did smell of smoke, and it was supposed to be a non smoking room. We also didn't get our room cleaned both days until 4pm. On a positive note, the location is fantastic. The bay is beautiful. We spent a couple of mornings just reading and it was so relaxing. Then a block away you have Pacific Beach, which is so different but full of great restaurants, bars and incredible surf. We rented bikes and body boards from the hotel, which was a good price and they were really polite. I would say if luxury and peace and quiet is what you are after this hotel is not for you. It is outdated. However if you're after a good beach location, it has got a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great trip, fine hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ValleyGuy69
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I booked this place after extensive reviews on very short notice. I had two choices to make; Catamaran and Ocean Park Hotel, both of which are popular hotels on the PB strip, but with major differences. First, I want to start out by saying that I booked this trip on Orbitz, which has a Low Price Guarantee, but beware, if you book on short notice like me, and within the cancellation period, Orbitz does NOT honor their guarantee; so its kind of like a guarantee-only-if-you-plan-far-enough-in-advance. They did however, comp me a gift cert after time wasted with their system. Now, on to the Hotel at hand. I booked the CAT mainly because of its location and overall feel for the place I got from the reviews; and they were spot on. Here's the difference; if you want a nice family get-away that mimicks Hawaii with lots of on-location activities then pick CAT. But if you want a beach-front location and like to PARTY pick the OPH, since that's in the party action-zone where the CAT is in a tranquil, private setting directly on Mission Bay, and one block from the ocean. When we arrived on Friday pm, there was a huge cluster...at the valet since they have Luau every week at that time. This place is big on weddings and corp events so keep that in mind when booking. Not that its an issue since the weddings were entertaining and the luau is right on the public bay-front so everyone can watch; so you get a free show even if you skip on the admission. Check in was easy and quick. They put us in a king-bed garden deluxe room in the tower bldg which is right behind the bayfront room bldg. The room was clean and spacious; a suite complete with kitchen, dining area and living area with sliders out to the patio. The bathroom was clean and the room is generally well-kept, not terribly dated or unkept like many posters on this board have complained about. There are flat screen TVs in the LR and BR-and WiFi is FREE!. Frankly, those people need to get over themselves; what do they think this a Ritz or something!?! Its a fine hotel with beautiful grounds with amazing tropical birds on display, a koi/duck pond. The pool and hot tub area is large and very enjoyable as well. Kids will love the big arcade room. Ok, now to the best part which is the bay-front beach. This place is very relaxing with plenty to do on-site including an array of water sports. The lounge chairs are plenty so no need to fight for comfort. I took my wife and baby onto the Funcat for a ride around the bay which was terriffic. Service is fine and friendly throughout the hotel. The Snack shack girls make great smoothies and the pizza was excellent-they bring it right to your lounger!! The main restaurant has decent food with great service, but a bit pricey. The bar offers happy hour and was hopping during our weekend stay. The people staying there generally seemed like they were having a good time. Book this place and you won't be dissapointed. We will def be returning to the Catamaran for our next Get-away!!!

Reviews.Title: “4 star in the 1960's, 2 star in 2011”
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: I don't usually judge a book by its cover but in this case it is appropriate. Upon entering the hotel grounds, one feels that this hotel has seen some of its best days in the 1960s. This resort was probably top of the line in the 1960s but by today's standards this "resort" is no better than a motel with beach access. The hotel grounds are dated with an Hawaiin theme that no longer works even by Hawaii's standards. San Diego is a modern City with beaches and resorts that should reflect this new era of technology and youth. The hotel does not even try to embrace today's tastes and desires. The pool is too small with an insufficient amount of seating areas. The saving grace at the pool is that the gaming area provides all the video gaming for free but the video games are far from modern with most games probably popular in the 1980s. The food services amounts to a guy or girl at a grill making hot dogs or hamburger or chicken. There is no waiter or waitress services at the pool and the bar provides only limited drink offerings again on a serve yourself basis. The parking areas around the resort fail to provide easy access to the rooms...and if you are lucky enough to park in one of the compact spaces in the parking structure, park on a low level because the structure has no elevator. Even at the lower levels, good luck getting all your stuff to your room from the parking structure. You will also most likely come back to some door dings on your car. Now to the room review. The resort offers tower rooms and the standard cabana rooms. We were given the tower and upgrade from a standard room to a junior suite. It sounded good at first but upon entering the room, Back To The 1960s both in style, appearance and cleanliness. The bed spreads were dirty. The carpet was worn with burns and stains. The bathroom was small, cold and inefficient. The kitchen was useless to us except for the refrig. The view was nice on the 9th floor from the balcony which was in poor shape with no amenities except from some outdoor furniture right out of Motel 6. The TV did not work clearly on most channels and the WiFi never worked well. This sliding doors was broken as were the shutters so we were awoken by first light. On our one night, I noticed that the resort catered to a large European contingent. This was confirmed when I asked hotel staffers who indicated that this time of year, they get a lot of German, French and English tourists. I have been to Europe. Hotel standards in general are not the same as those in this country. Maybe that explains the lack of upkeep devoted by the owners of this hotel to the facility. Maybe they feel that the current hotel is good enough for their largest number of visitors so why should they change anything. I would agree if I weren't paying $225 per night. This resort needs to close for a year and provide a major overhaul that is necessary toward making this facility world-class by US and world standards. Overall, I give this resort a 2 Stars out of 5 Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Be Very Careful...”
Reviews.Author: EMVeccia
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms here (for a variety of logistic reasons). I paid almost 2X what my partner paid on the same trip and got a room that was a complete dump. The bathtub was disgusting (photos attached). Thankfully I could bath my kids in the other room. My room also had a terrible odor (the room service person my first night even acknowledged that it smelled bad), and the â€œdeluxe garden viewâ€� was two small trees right on top of the patio with the pool fence behind. I think this place is VERY over-rated. While the staff is nice, service and attention to detail is completely absent. Interestingly, I was never asked at check-out if everything was â€œOK.â€� I was ready with tub photos and a list of issues to present. My opinion â€“ there are a lot of hotels in close proximity. I would expect you could get a lot more value for the money elsewhere, without the extra cost for the stench and filthy bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant waiter and waitresses were arrogant and racist!”
Reviews.Author: stir m
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I were not treated right when we went inside the restaurant by mistake to look for the restroom. One white male waiter and two white young waitresses gave us some attitude problem and were very arrogant when we even apologized to them for making the mistake of going inside the restaurant. "RACISM" is still alive in this restaurant and resort. We spoke to the manager about it. Manager was apologetic. But harm has been done.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding event....awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen P
Reviews.Content: I read the reveiws of the Catamaran and was a little unsure as to what to expect. I was dismayed that the bottled water in the room was $5...for Aquafina...so note to self, bring water from Ralphs grocery a block away and stock your in-room refrigerator which is in cabinet in vanity. That being said, we had an awesome time. Our daughter was married on the grass, had her reception in the ballroom upstairs. The food was wonderful, but more than that, our catering "captains" left no stone unturned. They were there thru set up and a different crew and captain there for the evening. The next morning we hosted a brunch in the Atoll (?) restaurant that was wonderful and spent several hours enjoying their beach and pool. It was wonderful and stay again just for the family fun.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lizachloe
Reviews.Content: My family booked this hotel through expedia based on it's reviews. We got to the room and what a disappointment! The carpet looked 20 years old with stains as well as the bedspread. It felt dirty and disgusting! We were in the tower and although the view was nice, I couldn't get passed the gross room. The sliding glass door wouldnt shut properly and the plantation shutter was broken and wouldn't shut. Honestly I am baffled at the good recommendations and I would never stay here again especially for 200+ a night! Yuck is all I can say!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveler45876
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay a the Catamaran very much. On prior San Diego trips, we stayed at the Hotel Circle area. We decided to splurge this trip and stayed right on Mission Bay. We did not regret our stay at the Catamaran. In the midst of the bustling Mission Bay district, the Catamaran gives the illusion of being secluded. The grounds and landscaping are nothing short of spectacular. Waterfowl and tropical birds are on the premises and they have a daily bird show. The ocean is across the street, a short block away, and is easy access to surfing, bicycling, etc. The hotel itself is on the bay. We had a studio on the fourth floor of the tower which afforded great views of the bay, the nightly fireworks from Sea World and great views overlooking the gardens. The studio apartment was spacious and our two teenage children felt that the space was more than adequate, though they had to forego some of the privacy that we might have had with a condo rental. The hot tub was spacious and inviting and we never found any of the hotel facilities overcrowded. Parking was covered and, though somewhat pricey, very available in the garage. I used the fitness center every day for the week that we were there. The equipment was top notch and well maintained. We didnâ€™t use the restaurant, so I cannot comment on that. The front desk staff was friendly and the room cleaning service excellent. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the aquatic center on the bay where you can rent just about any recreational watercraft you might want. (You can also rent quite a bit at the rental site on the premises). I would certainly consider returning to the Catamaran for a future San Diego visit. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “On paper, lots of appeal, reality does not quite match!!”
Reviews.Author: TFOPB
Reviews.Content: The good: Plenty of activities available, pool area pleasant, free Arcade games room The Bad: Limited common parts to sit and relax in the evening, other than the bar, which is not always suitable if you have young children. 30 minutes from San Diego The Ugly: Pool gets very crowded, Beach chairs packed away at 5pm, service lacking everywhere except front desk, rooms in need of makeover, Conclusion: At a price, this hotrel is acceptable, however do not use it as anything more than a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “We come back every year”
Reviews.Author: mparis4386
Reviews.Content: My family and I LOVE this place. It is one of the few resorts in San Diego that is right on the bay. You literally have grass, a boardwalk, then sand. The rooms are very comfortable and very quiet. I very rarely hear any outside noise. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, and the resort makes the housekeeping very convenient. Housekeeping is pretty much all day, so if you are in and out of your room during the day, they can clean your room late afternoon. Location is great. Besides being right on the bay, you are very close to shops and restaurants! It is definitely on the pricier side, including the restaurant and room service. If this is your first time to San Diego, and you can spend the money, I would hands down recommend the Catamaran. I have stayed at many other places throughout the years. That being said, I believe there are a few areas where this resort can improve. First of all the service at the bar is horrendous. It takes forever to get a drink and every bartender seems extremely overwhelmed. When you are paying that much for a drink and are at a beautiful resort, you should be able to get a cocktail quickly, no problem. The water pressure/shower is pretty bad. The temperature literally changes throughout your shower and the pressure is low. The service at the water rental stand was pretty low too. Other than that, Catamaran is an amazing resort to stay at!!

Reviews.Title: “Best family trip ever”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed here before and enjoyed it so much we had to bring the kids back. Rooms were awesome and the staff were so friendly and made my kids feel very special. My kids loved the the pool and the fact that they could walk right out of our room and onto the beach. They loved the crafts and seeing the birds, turtles and fish. We can not wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: MyLtPny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and got a great rate as a wedding guest. The grounds are stunning and the location cannot be beat. The loction right on the bay with the beautiful beach made a gorgeous background for the wedding reception. The room was large - wish there were 2 queens beds instead of 2 fulls, but we made do. The resort provided a rolling mini-crib for my son, which must have been pretty comfy as he never woke during the night. We never ate at the restaurants or visited the spa so we cannot comment on that. My mom and sister did the lei making and had a great time - well worth $10.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for location”
Reviews.Author: soseid
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. Not anything special unless you consider the location. Not worth it's hefty price. The simple things they could do to improve the value is have nicer linens throughout. (Sheets, towels down to the cheep cloth napkins in the restaurant.) This is first time Iâ€™ve been to a â€œresortâ€� with beach chairs and a pool where you have to get up and go to the bar to be served. Instead they pay someone to monitor and write down how many towels you took out to make sure they can charge you $10 for each one you donâ€™t return. The bathroom sink ran only warm to hot water. We complained and they sent someone to fix it twice. I finally gave up. I did not ask for a new room just dealt with brushing my teeth with warm water. The shower temperature was also touchy and not very consistent, throughout the shower it would go from warm to hot or cold without touching the dial. The location is awesome, super close to Pacific Beach restaurants and sites. Beach front seating right on the bay. The ability to rent boats and kayaks and other items was nice. The restaurant food was average. The menu was very pretentious but the food was good. The spa was fantastic. I used the private whirlpool, sauna and relaxation room. And the massage I received was perfect. Our room was a "deluxe king" but it was a basic small room. Not enough counter space to set ANYTHING on. We had to move stuff out of the bathroom and into the closet to set our toiletries down. The very small desk was covered with hotel stuff so we had to move that aside and to floor to use our laptop. Wireless was free but extermley slow. Our room was right next to stairwell and elevators. We had to run the fan to not hear the noise in the hallway and the stairwell doors didn't have stoppers so whenever used they'd slam so if you are a light sleeper make sure you aren't anywhere near the stairwell.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: lisasledge777
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights. This hotel is beautiful on the outside with many amenities and a great location. My only dissapointment was the quality of the room when compared to the price. For the rate they charge, I would've expected more. I read many reviews that said the rooms were not what one would expect for the price, but I was willing to try it out anyway since it had been recommended by a friend. The beds were VERY uncomfortable and had spreads that looked very old and outdated -- the kind you want to rip off immediately and toss in the corner so you don't have to sit on them. The beach access is great for families with young kids, and we loved the Friday night luau.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and activities; just ok rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LuvsTheCaribbean
Reviews.Content: The location of this beautiful hotel is ideal - 2 blocks from the Pacific promenade and the conciege is more than willing to arrange for you, excursions to the many other places of interest; and you are right on Mission Bay. Hard to beat that. They also offer a free shuttle service that takes you all around Mission Bay til midnight each day - sweeeeeet! The grounds are impeccable - lush vegetation and koi ponds are frequent. The pool is alright - seems a little small. The onsite restaurants are very good. They offer many activities on Mission Bay. The spa is wonderful and very relxaxing. The only drawback is that the rooms are a little outdated - just slight blemish on an absolutely wonderful resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviewers made it sound...”
Reviews.Author: elatho
Reviews.Content: We were reluctant to stay at the Catamaran due to some of the unfavorable reviews we read here on Tripadvisor, but we thought we would give it a try. At first look at our room, we had to agree, the furniture and decor were quite outdated. The carpet was old, the cabinets were very old, the screen on our sliding door was torn and would barely close. When my husband tried to wash his hands in the bathroom he discovered there was no cold water. An engineer came and discovered the problem that had been affecting all the rooms in the row of the tower, were all originating from our room. He told us we were being upgraded to a room with a larger kitchen so they could fix the room we were in. The newer room had a bigger kitchen, but was definitely not a upgrade. Previously we had a studio and now we had a regular room but we didn't complain. We were anxious to start our vacation and just went along. The beds were very comfortable, linens were clean, bathroom although dated and very small, was clean. The room overall was quite spacious. We had a great view from our balcony of the bay and were able to watch the fireworks each night that took place at Sea World. After getting over the fact that everything was very outdated, we enjoyed our stay. We were fortunate to have gotten a discounted rate on the room which made our stay a good value and worthwhile. If we had paid full price, we would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “The grounds a very nice - guest rooms terrible”
Reviews.Author: stefChicago
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a conference at the Catamaran Resort Hotel. The grounds are beautiful, the location right on the beach great. I also cannot fault them for their service. The hotel hosted a client appreciation happy hour for our customers , which was nicely done with friendly service. The hotel rooms are a different story. This had been my second stay at the Catamaran, and both times I could not get over feeling that the room is dirty. Additionally, this time my air conditioning unit was not working and the bathroom did not have bath towels. The carpet in my room had a large tear and some shiny stuff on it, and the bed-spreads/sheets seemed old. This resort would not be my choice for a vacation - way overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A one stop vacation paridise”
Reviews.Author: mamakakes
Reviews.Content: We just love the Caramaran. Everything was right here ,pool, bar ,ocean,great restaurant,and friendly staff. Our room was so quiet ,we over slept every day. We especially loved the old fashion paddle boat ride around the bay,and it was free! My husband and I are retired now,but we really enjoyed seeing all the young families with kids,so much to keep them happy. We will be back...hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “A "bait and switch" web site”
Reviews.Author: grandmaD8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the picture on their web site because we expected to spend a lot of time in the room. It showed a large room with sofa and kitchen. We were put in a room 2/3 the size with no place other than the beds to watch TV. (no better than a Holladay Express for $179 a night) They didn't make it easy to move so we stayed three nights before we moved. After 3 nights we went through the grief of moving to the room we had expected for the $350 a night. They offered no compensation for the first three nights. They said the rooms were in the same catagory.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: suegalway
Reviews.Content: Our room was ground floor facing Mission Bay - big windows/doors opening out onto a grass area just before the sand and water. Perfect! We didn't book a kitchenette room but asked for a microwave which was provided with no fuss or bother. Two big beds, two basins in the bathroom/shower room. Massive flat screen tv. Loved every minute of our 5 days stay at the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “location rocks!”
Reviews.Author: rileysm0m
Reviews.Content: Catamaran is a great place to setup homebase on a trip to san diego. One can walk out and enjoy sail bay OR cross the street and bam! You are on the boardwalk and ready to enjoy the pacific! We met up with friends and had a pool day which was laid back; we brought our own floaties and had much fun! There was a grill setup and a bar ready for us to enjoy; there is an arcade for older kids right off the pool. The prices are reasonable; some rooms come with a kitchenette. Nice job, Catamaran!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: stacydavies33
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran is a perfect family destination. It is beautiful with all the amentities you will ever want or need. The location on Mission Bay is perfect! My family and I will stay at the Catamaran every summer!

Reviews.Title: “destination wedding great place with minor irritaions”
Reviews.Author: sailart
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in Bayview room 511. beautiful scenery of water,sand and sails. our balcony view was partially obstructed by tree branches..lower room numbers worse...higher better on this 2nd floor... Irritations ...the parrots are unpleasantly loud during the day on the garden side of those same rooms Staff was very efficient and friendly in all areas..luau was great food and entertainment for the price... very safe for children. They loved the parrots. irritant:a leisure car driver from a company nearby named "Unique" was deceptive about prices to airport and although he seemed well-known by the Catamaran folks..we would strongly recommend using someone else for transportation. His name was Frank then.The hotel covered our fare dispute without question! Another couple at our wedding was similarly tricked by the same man.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: VickiLVCM
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran Resort is the best one in San Diego. It's right on Mission Bay with a nice beach and within a short walk to the Pacific Ocean. The rooms were clean and beautiful and the grounds were tropical and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Towleway
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good. The grounds of this resort are beautiful. Very well maintained, exotic, and lively with parrots, massive koi (coy) fish, and a duck sanctuary. The beach is well maintained and there are decent water activities if you're so inclined. The staff was also very friendly outside of the maid staff that pretend you're not even there. Great location, too. A block away from Mission Beach and right on the bay. This is where the compliments end though. If this place spent half as much time maintaining their rooms as they do their grounds, this would be a much better place to stay. Unfortunately though, they don't. The decor of this place has an 80's look and feel (because I'm sure it's the last time any of it has been updated). Rather than repair the damaged drywall around our sliding glass door, they used what appeared to be packing tape. When we finally made it onto the balcony, it had more spiders and webs than we saw at the zoo. Anything that could leak water, did. Our air conditioner leaked so much, the carpet was soaked all around it. I took a closer look at it on our last day and found mold all over the interior of the A/C unit. Unfortunately, I didn't see that until our check-out day. Who knows what we were breathing in while we were there. The pool is way too small for a resort this size. If you're there while it's busy, good luck getting a seat. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this place. We weren't in San Diego to spend our time in the room, but when we did, it was musty, wet, and moldy.

Reviews.Title: “Caught in a 1960's Polynesian Time Warp”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: The lobby tells you what you're in store for: an indoor waterfall, a dark koi-filled pond, lots of palms and tropical plants. Inside the complex you'll find a maze of pathways lined with lots of overgrown tropical plants/trees, streams filled with some huge koi, and a multitude of ducks (and lots of duck crap...so watch where you walk and don't go barefoot!) Our first impression inside the room wasn't much better: we had two stained comforters on the beds, carpet that was in need of replacement, bathroom tile that needed some serious re-grouting. We were unable to get a king bed (hotel was booked solid they said) so they gave us what they called 'two queens', which in reality was two full-sized beds. The place needed a fairly significant face lift and freshening up--and perhaps a good hosing down as well. It did look like the hotel was replacing carpet in the rooms across the courtyard from us, so perhaps they're underway with the cleanup. On the plus side, the pool was very nice, there is a large hot tub, and the hotel is in a convenient location, within walking distance to many restaurants, bars, etc. and Mission/Pacific beaches. We did not use the restaurant or spa services; however, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend. Old & dated but nice grounds & love the ducks & birds.”
Reviews.Author: KathandArn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days as my husband was attending a conference here. The hotel itself is very old and dated. The furniture, carpets, and bedding are very old. The carpets are stained in the rooms and hallways. The hallways look very grungy with dirty carpets and old wallpaper. I would never have stayed here if my husband's conference werenâ€™t being held here. We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite in the Tower, which was supposed to have been renovated & one of the nicer rooms! We got the conference rate, which was $259, but the price goes up to $400 after the conference ends which is way over priced for a hotel like this. I would not stay here. You can do much better I'm sure. Also, the restaurant is just so, so. We had a decent breakfast, but lunch was not good. And the hostess when she seated me started to put me at a table that wasn't set and was dirty as someone had just left, which I found very strange since there were other tables all set. She was brushing the crumbs off with her hands while I stood there. Then along comes one of the servers who told her that the guest sitting there was coming back! Very, very strange! And the salad I had was very bland. Having said all this the best things about this hotel is the location along the Bay, which has a nice boardwalk and we enjoyed running here. As well the ocean is on the other side of the street and there is also a boardwalk along there. In addition, they have several exotic birds on the property and lots of ducks, which were absolutely my favourite things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful grounds”
Reviews.Author: SicilianGirl62
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many places in San Diego, but we really loved the setting of this hotel. We were there for Mother's Day weekend visiting our son at USD. You feel you are in a tropical resort but in the heart of Mission/Pacific Beach. The lagoon in the back has it own beach with fantastic walking/biking trails all around Mission Bay. We loved the location to all the action on the main drag, but how quiet and serene you feel once you enter the hotel. You feel like you are in another world. Very beautiful and romantic setting for weddings (which we got to witness) on the grounds. The staff was super accommodating! We love the location to all the bars and restaurants in the area. The ocean is directly across the street. I love the fact that you can rent bicycles and ride to La Jolla from here. We had a wonderful time and are planning to return in August when we take our son back to college.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: KimbaWP
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Easter break with my family (2 kids) and another family with 2 kids. We loved the atmosphere of the hotel and its proximity to local attractions. It was a short walk to the beach, which was great also. The resort has activites and its own beach, which is nice, but it was a little chilly when we were there to take advantage of these. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ahappytraveller101
Reviews.Content: Sadly disappoinbted as this was big trip with our son and daughter in law who live in the States.On arrival we were shown to rooms which did not meet our booking critera (and both smeltt ). we were then kindly upgraded to suites which are very nice Sadly one smelt very badly and had to be deodorised three times .We had requested quiet rooms and sadly there were receptions and weddings outside our room for two of the four days . The hopeless Elvis impersonator was unbelievable and loud We just got away from the hotel as much as possible .My laundry had to be chased every evening .Most of the reception staff are lovely aqnd helpful but sadly for other guests there is one really rude young woman working on the desk .The rooms we were upgraded to cost four hundred dollars per night ,and werer eally noisy and not well cleaned It is so sad as there is much to offer here ,we have travelled the area and will return to San Diego but not to this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good location near the beach”
Reviews.Author: PatDSalemOR
Reviews.Content: Attended a work conference there. Nice room looked over the pool. Only one block away from the ocean beach and good restaurants. Resort restaurant and conference facilities face Mission Bay (which also has a beach). Nice restaurant and bar on property. Helpful, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with discount!”
Reviews.Author: jackpalance
Reviews.Content: Really nice place in fantastic location. Some of the rooms need an update but nice atmosphere on week days. Weekends for LOUD partying! We had a good deal staying for 4 nights but would not have liked to have paid RR! Happy hour food & drinks really GVM. A little bit DIY, car parking ect. but most facilities & sports.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - wish we had more time!”
Reviews.Author: Linda154944
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after being very disappointed with another property on Shelter Island. What a breath of fresh air! Front desk, bar service, and cleaning staff were all wonderful and accommodating. Grounds are lush and beautiful. We chose a gardenview room which is their lead-in category and were very happy with it, especially our balcony overlooking the gardens & paths. Rooms are nothing fantastic and could use an update but it was very clean, the beds were comfy, and we had all we needed including a mini-fridge and in-room safe. Restaurant was pricey for breakfast - didn't try any other meals there as we were out & about most of the time.
