Beach is very nice, on the Bay side which is much quieter, warmer, and calmer than across the road on the Mission Beach side. Pool area is very nice, a few too many children for my liking, but it is a family-friendly hotel and we knew that when we decided to stay. Definitely need a car if you want to see all the wonderful sights of San Diego. Lots of things within walking distance at Mission Beach but there is so much more to this beautiful city! We spent the first few days of our stay in the Gaslamp Quarter and highly recommend that area as well. All in all, a great stay at the Catamaran and we will be back when we can spend more time.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Futuremauian
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from 2 nights at the Catamaran Resort. The hotel is spectacular and very reminicent of Hawaii. Grounds are well-manicured, with many species of fish, birds, and exotic vegetation on display. The location is outstanding, fronting Mission Bay with the Pacific Ocean a block away, and visible from many of the rooms. Upon check-in, we visited our assigned room. It was huge and clean, but the view was uninteresting. We went back to the front desk and asked for a pool view. We were cheerfully switched to another room #303, that was perfect. Several times we remarked that this was an excellent value, as well as a beautiful place to relax. The pool temperature was perfect, allowing us to stay in the water for what seemed like hours at a time. On the second day, we rented Segways at the hotel for a ride down to Belmont Park, and up to Crystal Pier. (An hour cost us each $30). There are many restaurants and bars within walking distance of the hotel and we enjoyed several of them, including Kono's for breakfast. We never did eat at the hotel. In past years, I have stayed at the Beach Cottages on Pacific Beach, and at the Hyatt Islandia by Sea World. The Catamaran is a far superior experience!

Reviews.Title: “PURE DISAPPOINTMENT & FALSE EXPECTATIONS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lilac153
Reviews.Content: Catamaran Hotel was actually recommended by a friend that have stayed w/them before. Sad to learn and say though that, that friend has no taste at all or cannot tell the difference between the Nice and not Nice. The minute I pulled my car in the parking lot to check-in I had the feeling that I will not enjoy my stay here and I was totally correct. The Front Desk Clerks are not very friendly, inefficient and does not give the correct answer to questions given to them. Anyway, As I enter the room assigned for me I got really upset because the room smells as if someone took a dumb in the bathroom and to be honest I think someone did and of course smells will stay when thereâ€˜s no vent or exhaust fan in the toilet. The room was literally DIRTY UNMADE!!! Kitchen was dirty!!! had lots of crumbs on kitchen counter and floors. So I started to scrutinized the whole room and found the flaws one after the other. In the Bedroom, the bed was just haphazardly made. Some pillows that I think belongs to the bedroom were in the living room, the edge of the dresser in the bedroom was sticky and so did the Flat screen TV I was guessing a family w/little kids stayed here. The sliding glass door in the bedroom was broken! Then the sliding glass door in the living room from the outside/inside was dirty, again sticky w/hand marks of little kids. To be honest, Iâ€™m not a fuzzy person and I hate to complain if the problem was minor and I donâ€™t really will make a fuzz or make a big deal about it but then I was thinking wait a minuteâ€¦ I am paying for this room $350 a night I have to be comfortable at least. I called the front desk to ask to be move to a different room but the answer I got was they donâ€™t have and I understand that because it was Holiday and they might probably sold out so I said ok. The funny thing is that the clerk on the other end of the wire did not even exert some effort at all to ask why, you knowâ€¦to at least find out if there is a problem on my side you know... If I even like the room or not. I took one more look of the room and decided I really have to complain about it because itâ€™s not right. Called Front Desk again and finally told them the problems in the room and demand to be move or I will just check out. Suddenly they have the room for me when they hear the scenario I was having in the room and so I ask for the room facing the bay at the first level (and Literally ask for the rate of it) and I was actually given a standard king one but before that happened I also asked how much was the room I was actually told by Sara that itâ€™s okay itâ€™s â€œCOMPLIMENTARYâ€� (but not â€œCOMLIMENTARY UPGRADEâ€œ did she forget to mention the word UPGRADE? I donâ€˜t think so!) so I just said Thank You! Then I was told that the room will only be ready in about 20 minutes and should go down to Front desk in 20 minutes to pick up the key card for the room theyâ€™re moving me to, I said thatâ€™s fine. After 20 minutes I went down to the reception and was given the key card and also was told to wait another 25 minutes so I said ok again besides, what else can I do? 25 minutes lapsed I went over the front desk again to ask if the room is ready and Kelsey said, room is not ready yet and cannot give certain time when it will be ready because only computer will know if room is ready so it means that, if it doesnâ€™t show up on their computer telling them the room is ready or not anytime that day I may just have to stay waiting at lobby I told her that I was told in 25 minutes it will be ready she answered me the same answer but this time looking annoyed with me. While I was waiting I decided to call the Hotel Del Coronado because I was so unhappy with whatâ€™s going on, it just ruined my short San Diego get away, before my call get picked up Sara waved at me from front desk saying that the room is ready, finally! I accessed the standard king room facing the bay small but way okay than the room given the first time and again, I must say that this hotel have a very poor housekeeping . Housekeeping overlooked so many things when it comes to cleaning, I believe that they only clean whatever is visible to their eyes, I donâ€™t think they put effort in what they do because behind both night tables I found empty bags of cookies & chips. At night I woke up w/itching torso something bit me so the next day I put the tag on the bed to change the linens. I passed by at the front desk again to ask if I need to inform them for the housekeeping to clean the room because I was going out to check the Hotel del Coronado that day , the receptionist wasnâ€™t looking at me when I approached her for questions instead engaging words with me while her eyes were glued to her computer while asking me of my room no. after answering her question she made me another key card I did not ask for key card my question was if housekeeping will clean the room automatically without me informing any of them at the front desk she naturally was not paying attention. Since I was so disappointed from the beginning I checked in I decided not to use anything in the hotel except for the room. To be honest my mind was actually set to get a nice massage in their spa and have dinner in their restaurant but because of all the problems I have encountered, the drawn agenda that I had totally changed that very moment. The next day, I drove to Hotel Del Coronado to get a room over there which unfortunately did not happen because they are totally sold out I believed them because they were packed and guestsâ€™ seems all happy as I gave myself a little tour of the area. I donâ€™t want to drive back and forth that day from San Diego to Los Angeles so, I just made the most of my 2 days here in this crappy hotel cooped up in the most ugly room I have ever stayed in a hotel in my whole life. In fairness to them the only good thing I could say about this hotel is their location itâ€™s by the bay but wasnâ€™t able to use because the weather did not permit it. It was cold to even sunbathe and by the time the sun came out it was about time for me to check out. At the time of check-out the confusion began, I question the bill because I remember Sara told me it was Complimentary the first night because of the inconvenience I was put through but no, the clerk thatâ€™s checking me out insisted that it was not complimentary and later on she said oh, it was complimentary upgrade but I told her you guys werenâ€™t specific because I wasnâ€™t told that way I was told the other way. I was really devastated but because I just want to leave the place already I just paid the freaking bill and promised myself to not ever set foot in this ugly crappy place ever again. Sorry Folks so upset that i forgot to take pictures of the problems and of course, who wants to remember a crappy place like this one not me for sure! By the way, you don't want to have a room next to the restaurant because you won't be ab;e to have a good sleep because of the noise that's what happened to me I was up until 3 am. Just remember, DO NOT STAY IN THIS CRAPPY PLACE OR YOU WILL HAVE A CRAPPY STAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “on the plus side...ummm...there weren't any cockroaches?”
Reviews.Author: blissfork
Reviews.Content: what a bummer. such a bummer, in fact, that i booked the catamaran for 2 nights and checked out after 1. i started thinking about checking out early, however, as soon as i saw my room. this hotel is the kind of place that must have been uber-chic in 1983. i can imagine jaws dropping when people walked into the lobby and saw a waterfall, noticed the ducks strolling the grounds, and maybe even saw a parrot or two (in a cage that is now noticeably empty). with a 2011 lens on, the place is just gross. the hotel rooms REEK of gross hotel. you know that smell i'm talking about. i would have expected that in booking a bay front room opening out onto the sand (note: it's actually grass) that my room would smell like the great outdoors. uhhhhhghghghg. the smell was suffocatingly bad -- like a roadside motel but worse because i paid $$$ for it. i was upgraded to a suite when i checked in, but the suite has the bed in the way back, with no view of the bay! the bedroom part is basically a dark cave, with windows that show a view of the legs of people walking by. why would i want to book a bayfront room if i can't fall asleep looking at the water? it makes no sense. half of the furniture looks like left-overs from the set of the Golden Girls, but less appealing. the other half looks like your grand-mother's gross old couches she now keeps in the basement. oh -- and there are a few plastic beach chairs for good measure, but if you check in too late the people next to you likely already nicked them for their patios. :-( The sink/fridge area in my room was falling apart, and the plumbing is exposed if you open the cabinet. What the heck? Did the plumber just get bored in the middle of the job? It was truly a horrific experience. I suffered through one night, checked out early the next morning, and headed to a cheaper hotel on the beach side that was ten times as nice. the staff is super-nice if that counts for anything. no problems with them whatsoever. and the pool area got the job done too. everything else? ack! AWFUL VALUE. i have never paid so much for a san diego hotel and gotten so little. there is free wifi though. i guess that was the best part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “The top ten at Catamaran resort”
Reviews.Author: jfbartist
Reviews.Content: 1.Noisy rooms due to the AC system. 2.Noisy rooms that face the street. 3.Dusty rooms, I'm allergic to dust. 4.Sconce lights with low voltage made the rooms very dark and had to be replaced the light bulb. 5.Old style furniture and stinky. 6.No microwave. 7.Valuable TV inside of an old wood armoar. with limited vision from a double bed room. 8.Lots of ducks, parrots, birds, etc, good landscape for people who never been to the jungle. 9.The drainage system from the bathtub was clogged. 10.The service man must be at your service working 24Hr to fix what is not working.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Fozmonster
Reviews.Content: The hotel has not been updated in decades. For the price I was amazed at how I was nickled and dimed. No coffee in the lobby and $13 for self parking. Try something else.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Catamaran!”
Reviews.Author: suegalway_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after some debate as to whether it would be better to have an ocean front view or a Mission Bay view. We were so glad we chose the Catamaran. We had a ground floor studio with direct access to the beach area of the bay, very close to the sailing activities and the jetty. There is a boardwalk a few feet away from the big french windows but nobody stared in or bothered us at all even though there are plenty of joggers and cyclists going by all dy. We didn't have a kitchen but we asked if we could have a microwave and one magically appeared in our room. Handy for snacks and hot drinks other than coffee. Everything in the room was clean and modern and we were very happy with the amenities in the bathroom - two sinks, bath and shower and a very good (hot and fast) hairdryer. We tried the restaurant for a snack and it was ok. As said in other reviews, the service is a bit glum. There are plenty of great little restaurants (especially the Green Flash on the ocean front) in the area so there's no need to use the restaurant at all but it's handy if you don't want to walk too far or you've just tried out one of the sailing activities, as we did. We didn't want to leave the Catamaran and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Older place, but great location and nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: mamamoss
Reviews.Content: this was our first stay at this hotel, and would recommend it as a place to stay in San Diego. although the hotel is older, the grounds are lovely and the location is great. It has it's own beach on Mission Bay, but also a stones throw to Mission/Pacific Beach and the walkway there. Also very convenient driving to Sea World as well as the Zoo and downtown SD. The decor of the room is older, but was fine. Our studio room came with a small kitchen with microwave, fridge, stove and sink, and had the basic necessities for cooking and eating. The coffee maker did not work (although the light was on, no water would go through the filter), which was unfortunate, and we didn't find this out til our last day. We were also supposed to get a morning paper, but one never arrived. The restaurant was ok - quite expensive and adequate food. The service there was mediocre. We arrived at 6:25 on our last evening to find that there was an "early bird" special that went until 6:30. The hostess wasn't going to give us that special menu because her watch said 6:29. However, i did tell her that it's still not 6:30, and there's no reason to not give us that menu - particlarly since the early bird was $22 for appy, dinner, and dessert (dinner including choice of steak, chicken or fish) and on the regular menu, the steak was $35 alone (heck we were going to order a bottle of wine and our oldest daughter is no longer eating from the kids menu, even though she keeps getting the kids menu)! She said she'd 'check with her manager' to see if they'd "allow" us to take advantage of the early bird...which they did. our first meal there (our first night) was ok - the waiter was a bit glum and not engaged with clients at all. the grounds are lovely - lush lawn with nice gardens. the pool is nice too with lots of seating. there looks to be a pool bar, but it was closed when we were there. lots of parking for vehicles too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds at a reasonable hotel with location”
Reviews.Author: namasteanita
Reviews.Content: 10th fl. suite with view of the ocean...beautiful grounds and great price. One block from beach. Ate at World Famous, shopped at Ralphs for groceries. Nice pool. Drove 15 min into town for fancier meals. also drove to La Jolla for fab brunch at Cottage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aspataro
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Catamaran more than several times while staying in San Diego during 4th of July weekend. I really love this hotel, and you can't but feel on vacation when staying here. You can't ask for much more out of a beach hotel, which happens to be one of the best in San Diego. Of course with a great hotel, means your going to pay a great price. The average price a night was $300, which could definitely put a dampening on your wallet, but a group of us stayed here so everyone pitched in making it much more feasible. It is a hotel that has much to offer such as, constant ferry rides back and forth from the south part of Mission Bay, on-site restaurants, and boat rentals. The rooms are pretty good, but I consider them a gamble because I would much prefer to have a bay view room over a garden view anytime. Also, you feel a little claustrophobic in the halls as the rooms are stacked on top of each other, thus making the rooms a little small. Overall, the Catamaran has never disappointed, but now that there are many beach houses available for rent, their competitive pricing almost makes it hard to stay there anymore. I would say that if you prefer the convenience of a hotel and you could afford the $300 a night, then the Catamaran is definitely for you; but if you can live without room service and clean towels then getting a house would give you much more value for the money you'll pay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MomOboysOmahaNE
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay. Our room was on the 8th floor of the Tower, it did not face the bay, but we had a very nice view of the city, and the ocean in the distance. The room was a little worn, but nothing like we had expected from reading other reviews. We stayed 5 people, two of which are good sized teenaged boys, in a two bed, one pull out sofa room in the tower. I was surprised that the room was an adequate size for us all. I had envisioned a Holiday Inn sized room, and this was not the case. We had a sufficient sized kitchenette, table and two chairs, one bathroom, and a small area outside the bathroom with a mirror. We found that the hotel staff were pleasant, helpful and prompt. I had neglected to mention that I needed a "non-feather" pillow, due to allergies. The staff was quick to locate and bring to our room, not one, but three pillows for me. We did run into one desk staff member who seemed a little clueless, but were directed to other staff to answer our questions. Some of our favorite things were the beautiful landscaping through out the property, the fun parrots on display, teenagers loved the complementary game room and pool, and the location to restaurants, grocery store, and shopping. We also utilized the water sport rentals by the bay. My husband and boys also rented sailboats on the bay, and dearly loved the experience. We did have a rental car to sight see during the day, but I can imagine you may not need one. The only negative I can specifically point out, is stay away from the free coffee provide in the morning on the bay. I don't think I've had coffee that bad since I had the instant stuff in college. Save yourself, and either buy the coffee in the restaurant, or take the walk down to Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel between the Beach and the Bay”
Reviews.Author: bumz
Reviews.Content: Great locations, ocean is only one block to the west and bay-front to the east. A short walk to (24hours) Ralphs market. All tropical setting and a nice swimming pool. We got a garden view room with King size bed and a sleeper sofa. Looks like every room in two story building has a balcony. The rooms has a mini refrigerator, two sinks in the bathroom , free wifi, and a flat screen TV. Very comfy. Spa area looks very new but the rest of hotel needs upgrade and maintenance attentions. The napkin/utensil left by other guests outside the room was never picked up through out our 3 days stay. The maid cart was left next to our room for the whole time. (no place to hide?) The sprinklers need to be adjusted away from all walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ldspencer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran on Mission Bay for 9 nights during spring break in late March/early April. We had a bay view suite and the view was spectacular. The area is more residential but with the ocean a block away, groceries just a bit further and lots of restaurants we could walk to most everything in the evening and saved the driving for the day. About 20 minutes from the parks and downtown. Hotel restaurants not cheap but there are so many other options. Room was always clean and tidy when we returned from our day trips. Tropical setting with the ducks, turtles and resident macaws and you felt like you were in a tropical setting like Hawaii. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: drheathr
Reviews.Content: I was traveling toSan Diego for a business meeting and decided to go a day early to enjoy the resort. I love to stay in a beautiful setting and sit out on the patio, eat room service, read my book and enjoy the view. I like a nice room but it is less important than the patio and view. I explained this on check-in. When I got to my room I was very disappointed, The room had a popcorn ceiling, badly outdated furniture, and the TV was ontop of a dresser in an alcove on the side of the room. The TV was not visible from either bed or the couch that was in the room. The patio was no better. It overlooked a parking garage and a busy street. The ocean was visible if you looked out to the left past the parking garage, the street and the buildings on the other side of the street and the sound of the traffic was so loud that relaxation was impossible. I called the front desk and asked to be moved. The bellman came up and he seemed very concerned. He said that he would be happy to move me but that I had "one of the nicest rooms on the property"! Oh, lord help me. He explained that the room I was moving to was much smaller and did not have a kitchenette. I moved and the room was much smaller; however the TV was in an amiore at the foot of the bed and the balcony overlooked the pool and the gardens. Yay! The trade-off was the stained carpet and broken lamp. Happily I chose my breakfast for the morning and humg the room service tag on the doornob. I went to bad and anxiously awaited the morning realaxation. I never got breakfast in the morning. Nobody had come by to get my room service order. I called and and eventually got breakfast. It was very tasty. The next day, the same thing. Ordered breakfast, none came. Nobody picked up the room service order from the doornob. Also, noboby came to clean my room that day. And when I checked out they had charged me for parking for for three nights. I did not have a car. They asked me when I checked in if I had a car. I think it was $12/ day! The grounds were beautiful but the rooms are terrible. The service is passable. The food was good. Much, much too expensive for what you get. The rooms were $189.00 per night and so not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not my idea of a "resort"!”
Reviews.Author: ElvisLoveChild
Reviews.Content: Rarely have I seen a hotel of such inconsistent quality. Pros: Friendly staff (front desk, landscaping, concierge, food service), beautiful beach, interesting and well-maintained landscaping. The lobby and common areas are fine, albeit a bit dated. The bed was very comfortable. The two restored steamships that are owned & operated by the resort are absolutely beautiful. The fitness center was surprisingly good, given the other lackluster amenities. Cons: My room was dark, dingy and somewhat dated. The water pressure was atrocious, and the housekeeping sub-par. (On the fourth day of my stay, the sink still bore some whiskers from a previous guest.) Small, scratchy towels, no robe, and one bar of soap for both the shower & sink. Although there are signs indicating a concern for conservation, asking me to hang up my towels if I would be re-using them, each day this was ignored and I was given new towels. When I checked in, the TV/remote weren't working, though this was remedied the same day I asked. The alarmclock is completely baffling. It has gone off early each morning, apparently set by a previous guest. Admitting defeat, I asked the staff to taddress this issue, but they were apparently baffled by it as well, since it once again woke me at 6:01 today. I came here for a conference, and found the meeting rooms and ballrooms to be dark and to have poor heat control. The "business center" is atrocious: a small, moldy-smelling room with a waterstained ceiling and old computers that freeze up frequently. Not even a telephone. For this, they charge $5!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but expect to get nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The property is quite lush and the grounds are impeccable. Rooms are a bit dated, but clean. Beware that you will get charged for the smallest things. The last straw was wanting to print out tickets, but the business center access is an extra $5. Really? I get free wifi, but printing out 4 tickets will cost $5? Also, be sure to use an outside site (hotels.com, travelocity.com) to book travel. A family member used an external site and reserved last minute and got a bay view room for less than our family. We ended up with an internal view at a higher price reserving directly from the hotel weeks in advance. Beautiful property, but be prepared for airline-esque extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: thrifty
Reviews.Content: This location is without equal in San Diego. Itâ€™s directly on Mission Bay and only a block from Mission Beach. The tropical gardens and exotic wildlife are a unique feature of the resort. When you step into the hotel complex from the street, you are in a different world. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. Only the studio kitchen was rather cramped and outdated, but sufficient for fixing breakfast or a lunchtime/evening snack. The swimming area is very pleasant with a large pool, hot tub, etc. We enjoyed the hotel Happy Hour in the tropical courtyard. When eating out, The Eggery was excellent for breakfast/lunch and of course, The World Famous, where you can watch the sunset during the crazy, busy Happy Hour. For provisions, Ralphâ€™s supermarket, two blocks away, had a great selection at reasonable prices. Since our last stay in Mission Beach a few years ago, the whole area has improved significantly and all the seafront properties have been wonderfully renovated. This location is also an excellent base for sightseeing. We purchased a transit pass and used the bus/trolley system extensively for easily getting around. This is a great place for everyone and we will definitely be returning to the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “it is like trying to sleep at a frat party”
Reviews.Author: twb27
Reviews.Content: I am here right now in room 104 and the noise and partying going on is like a frat party. I got dressed (it's almost 1am) and went to the front desk to call security, 15 minutes later it is still going on. We were not offered to be moved to an different room or offered any credit. I have traveled extensively and used trip advisor for years. This is the first negative review I have submitted. Don't waste your time or money here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Signet01
Reviews.Content: Although I had my doubts driving the area streets on my way to the resort the first time from the airport, the minute you walk in and then through the resort, it is a completely different world. Exquisitely kept gardens, very friendly and helpful personnel, and gorgeous views of the Pacific as well as Mission Bay allowed us to escape for a week and simply enjoy. Kudos to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian-style paradise on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: time2getaway
Reviews.Content: I had a great first trip to San Diego at the Catamaran. The Hawaii-inspired resort put me instantly into a vacation mindset - there was no transition time from the work week I left behind into my relaxing week at the Catamaran! I spent lots of time wandering from the jacuzzi to the pool, to the bay, to the beach. I tried paddleboarding on the Bay one afternoon, rented a bike for several days and rode around the Pacific and Mission Beaches and Mission Bay. Whenever I took a drive to do sightseeing, it was always easy to find my way, and traffic was not a problem. I enjoyed the food I ordered from room service and loved the variety of restaurants that were a short walk from the resort. All of my interactions with the staff/personnel were great and they took care of whatever I needed. My room was kept spotless. The grounds are well-maintained and it is enjoyable just walking around the resort in the morning or at the end of a busy day. The only thing that could have been better was the cycling rental - this may be common in the area but I was surprised that they only had beach cruisers, and that some of the bikes were a little rusty or in need of repair. Check out your bike carefully before heading out. But the staff are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice- Everything I expected”
Reviews.Author: pjbatra
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on a hotel I stayed at. I probably will in the future. But this hotel for the money and the location was worth it. Safe, nice, clean, comfortable. If anyone writes a bad review about this hotel is probably a very demanding, unsatisfiable person. Next to the beach, easy travel, a lot of restaurants. Just awesome. I took my wife and three kids aged 18, 10 and 9. Everyone was happy and kids always tell the truth-right?

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel and its location!”
Reviews.Author: ahuffington
Reviews.Content: This is such a beautiful hotel, I have been here a few times when traveling to San Diego and every time its an excellent stay. I can't say enough great things about it. Stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Cat!”
Reviews.Author: seejogo
Reviews.Content: We had a local San Diego convention but wanted to stay somewhere more relaxed and California-like (we are from Denver). Right on Mission Bay, away from the craziness of Mission Beach, this place is a gem. The grounds are beautiful, full of exotic foliage, waterfalls, ponds - and lots of waterfowl live there year round, nurtured by an attentive staff who feed and look after all the ducks and swans that populate the winding paths that make up the center of the resort. The staff, particularly the Concierge Alan, were wonderful; helping us get a rental car; giving us good advice about local eateries and such. All the staff we met were top-notch. Room, overlooking the bay, was not built yesterday, but it was comfortable and quaint; seaside resorts have their own unique personality and this one didn't disappoint; one of the better "bay" side resorts we have visited. We travel a lot and stay at a lot of places. Centrally located, this low key, tropical and relaxed lodge was perfect for us. Kiddos to the Catermaran; nice experience. PS Also a great place for families with kids; great green areas for the kids to romp.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: tracy h
Reviews.Content: beautiful grounds and location with excellent views of the sea and bay. Most relaxing stop of a 1 month holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super friendly staff, very clean, lush grounds”
Reviews.Author: aprilgirl76
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1 AM and were put into a tower room, floor 2. We immediately noticed the rug was wet, but were too tired to do anything about it. The next morning we noticed small ants on the night stand as well as how much of the rug was actually wet. We were not too happy. We called the front desk and they immediately said they would change our rooms. They seemed to know the rooms facing south had water because of the all the rain for the last week. I understand the issue, but why were they putting people into these rooms? Anyway, they put us into a much better room, twice the size of the room and bathroom in one of the smaller buildings on the property. The rest of the stay was uneventful. The staff at this hotel is super friendly and accommodating. We had a burnt out bulb and they were there in less than 5 minutes to change it. We loved the location, the grounds, and the food in the restaurant. I would stay there again, but not in the tower...the room and bathroom were just too small.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, Worst Service, Falling Apart”
Reviews.Author: GinaRubel
Reviews.Content: It was obvious after the first day that no one seems to care about how guests are treated at Catamaran "Resort" Hotel nor do they care about staff training, upkeep, or creating loyalty among guests. It was by far one of the worst customer service experiences we have ever had. We traveled with two young children so we rented a suite. We stayed in the tower overlooking Mission Bay and the view was wonderful - that was about it. Upon arrival, we discovered that the linens on the pull out were filthy (and stained). We had them changed. There was a leak in the bathroom sink. The shower didn't drain. A light bulb exploded and wasn't fixed after eight hours so we called again and housekeeping came, cleaned up the glass and was about to leave without replacing the light bulb. We had to instruct housekeeping on what needed to be done. On a daily basis, they did not replace the coffee (we had to ask). The phone in the bedroom didn't work. There was no air conditioner or fan in the bedroom - only the living room. Other guests were extremely noisy, the beds were uncomfortable, if we called the front desk we were put on hold, and the list goes on. When we asked the concierge for assistance, he couldn't tell us anything of value. When we asked about something suitable for families on New Yearâ€™s Eve we were told, "This is a college town. I doubt you'll find anything." With all of the families we encountered at the hotel, you would think they would do something to accommodate them. As for room service, the food was terrible. As for the breakfasts, they were very good but extremely overpriced. We paid $120 for breakfast for five people. Go to Mission Mission instead. It's about five blocks away, the food is outstanding and we paid just over $60 for five people there. I was hoping to use the spa but decided not to take a chance - since everything else was so bad, why risk it? So our advice is unless you don't care about spending your hard-earned money to be treated like crap, DON'T STAY AT THE CATAMARAN "RESORT" HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Wet floors, old interior”
Reviews.Author: sandiego0910
Reviews.Content: As local San Diegans, our family decided to take advantage of the discounted rates offered by the Catamaran. We received excellent service by the front desk at initial check-in, bellhop, and server at Moray's lounge. The hotel room, however, was completely antiquated including kitchen appliances and fixtures. The carpet on our ground floor unit was completely soaked and had been flooded by recent rains. There was a wet floor sign in the hallway, but no one bothered to mention the entire room floor was drenched. We were moved to another room on the ground floor with the same problem. It seemed the entire ground floor area was flooded. We moved again to the 2nd floor and experienced damp carpet near the windows. Too tired and exhausted to move again on Christmas night, we stayed and placed boots on our daughter to avoid soaked feet. Our extended family stayed and were moved as well. As local San Diegans who frequent the Catamaran restaurant and bar area, we were extremely disappointed at the lack of service and poor condition of the hotel. It's definitely time for a remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal beach location”
Reviews.Author: roeboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for 5 nights in September 2010. The hotel is in a unique and desirable location. It is unique in that out the front door you are a 1 block walk from the Pacific Ocean, a fantastic beach and the PB / MB boardwalk while out the back door you are steps from the sands and calm waters of Mission Bay. You really are spoiled for choice and the phrase best of both worlds springs to mind. If you want for some reason to head downtown from here then there is a bus stop across the street and you are within walking distance to many eateries and bars. We have stayed in PB many times. This hotel itself is spot on. Lobby is a site to behold, performing parrots in the courtyard and the adjoining grounds would not seem out of place in a Hawaiian Island. The onsite gym is among the best I have experienced in relation to one provided by a hotel. The pool and hot tub and great as is the comfort of the surrounding loungers. In terms of the room, we stayed in the tower as opposed to the lower rise rooms which are dotted throughout the property. I have no issues with our room. Spacious, clean, nice balcony with a view to die for. Do not mistake me for equating this with a 5 star property because it is not. The thing is though that if luxury accomodation is what you seek then MB and PB aren't truely the places for you. The best you can get in terms of luxury would be the Tower 23 or the Pacific Terrace. However be prepared to pay 6 star prices for what is truely (in any other beach location) 4 star properties at best. If money is no object and/or you don't mind paying a premium then one of these 2 would be your preferred option. However, if you are happy with a solid 3 star in a great location for considerably less then you will not be disappointed with the Catamaran

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was actually in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Sofieah
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and spa. We had a small problem when we checked in, our room was not made up so they upgraded us up to another room on the top floor. Totally over the top compensation for that, but it made for a really nice weekend. My husband and I both got massages at the spa and I would definitely recommend going to the spa to sit in the sauna or whirlpool even if you don't purchase a large service. Some of the decor in the rooms needs a little updating but the grounds were gorgeous and it was fun to be right on the water.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great pool, better than reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMan73
Reviews.Content: Reviews we read about the hotel were so-so, but our experience was great. The hotel grounds are beautiful, the pool is great, location is excellent. The room was fine, even though some reviews said the walls were thin, etc. We were pleasantly surprised by the entire experience. Breakfast at the restaurant was very tasty. The hotel is about 15 minutes from downtown and the airport and easy to get to by car. Would be nice if parking was included, but almost all the hotels seem to charge for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gettingmarriedat41
Reviews.Content: I was at The Catamaranr resort for business with a co worker, who happens to be a friend as well. We stayed 2 extra days for "play", so it was really a combined trip. The place was perfect for us. I had never been to San Diego and loved the Mission Beach/ Pacific Beach side of San Diego. This resort was in the perfect place for us. Downtown is a little far, Coronoda also a little far. We didn't care tho. Room was clean, view from ours was amazing, pool/beach (on Sail Bay) are great....Restaurant not worth using in our opinion. Concierge extremely helpful in renting us a car for the day. Locally we loved the Eggery for breakfat and lunch, the beach Bar (Lahaina) for sunset and beer, Kono Cafe for lunch (ask where ocean front seating is). Rented bikes up on the beach beacuse it was cheaper, dont use hotel rental. Check out a place called the wave house (south of hotel on beach). No one had mentioned to us until the last day and we had fun watching the surfers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort hotel...just needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastKC
Reviews.Content: Great location on Mission Bay with only a 1 block walk to Mission Beach. Rooms in the Tower need sprucing up. Interior door did not dead lock properly since the return was practically falling off, the exterior balcony door didn't open without a lot of muscle power and the screen balcony door was completely off track. Maintenance did offer to change my room. Exterior was lush and tropical...loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quality, and Service”
Reviews.Author: BAMF90266
Reviews.Content: Went for a recent conference and enjoyed the quality of the hotal. Staff, grounds, rooms, nearby restaurants, beach, and bay were all enjoyable. Like the "feel" of the place. Family and business friendly. Will go again on my own to get away from the big city.

Reviews.Title: “You're gonna' like the Catamaran!”
Reviews.Author: Grant70115
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the food was great, the room was perfect, the place is beautiful & affordable, and I'm a bit picky. It was just a pleasure to stay there, and it's obvious that they have a great management team, because the staff is cheerful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-Bad service”
Reviews.Author: ella00
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice,the location was good,but the service was very bad .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lollipop2010
Reviews.Content: Everything at The Catamaran was perfect for us...Spacious room in the Tower Block with beautiful views over the tropical gardens and Mission Bay. Then just across the road was the Pacific Ocean with all the beach activity that anyone could wish for. Just a short walk to many restaurants and quaint shops. Really enjoyed our stay and would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, easy, great beach and garden, enjoyable- but no fridge in room”
Reviews.Author: Dholtz9
Reviews.Content: Overall, a nice hotel and restaurant. Enjoyed our stay. on the bay, free boat ride is great. Restaurant was fantastic also. Problem was an advertised fridge in the room, that wasnt there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but pricey and a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: FBaralli
Reviews.Content: I spent a week there for a conference. The hotel is placed in a beautiful area and it has a very nice garden with several tropical trees. Food is good and their support to the conference attendees was ok. However it is a bit pricey and it starts getting old. Rooms in particular would need to be renewed a bit (wall paper and carpet are a bit dirty).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, staff needs serious training”
Reviews.Author: nvrnrml
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Catamaran for 3 nights with our 6yo and 3yo. The hotel offers suites, which accomodates our family well and the hotel itself is clean and in an awesome location with a big pool. Unfortunately, our family is quiet and the family we were placed next to was not - wailing children @10p and 5:15a. Not much the hotel can do 'bout this but a bummer nonetheless and given the rest of our experience, just added to our overall impression of the hotel. The Staff - from the front desk to the Concierge to the restaurant - needs some SERIOUS training! Everyone, without exception, seemed wholly disinterested and lethargic about their job and their customers. Slow check-in, though we were the only ones in the lobby. Concierge was unable to make a restaurant recommendation and didn't know how long it would take to travel to the restaurant offsite that we did choose. No shuttle services at all. SLOW restaurant service and after asking both the hostess and the waiter for booster seats, finally just went to the couch myself and took cushions off for my kids to sit on. Housekeeping showed up at 5:30p on Sat to clean our room just as we were all readying to go to dinner. When we called the front desk about this they simply said "housekeeping has until 5:30p to clean your room". Uh, how 'bout informing your guests of that BEFORE 5:30p?! The parrot handlers and groundskeepers were all very friendly and engaging and clearly enjoyed their jobs, taking the time to answer questions and offer information about the wildlife. After paying $250/night for our room, the hotel charged an additional $13/day for parking AND $5 for use of their "business center". We usually stay at Embassy Suites or Hyatt hotels and, though the Catamaran location is great for beach access, we will not be staying again nor recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely trip, great hotel (despite the worst July weather in history!)”
Reviews.Author: samiamincali
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old son and I decided to take a trip to San Diego to visit an old friend of mine. She recommended this hotel, so we gave it a try. It is very centrally located to San Diego attractions (the Zoo, museums and Sea World are minutes away driving). So that part was great. It was also located right between the bay and the beach, so to either side you have water. Totally cool. So when we checked in, we were early, so we were told there would be a slight wait. My son put on his saddest face, but we didn't complain--We were EARLY and check in was not for a few hours....So suddenly a room opened up for us. It was a penthouse studio with a view of the pier and the ocean and the boardwalk. Quite an AMAZING upgrade! That allowed us to make our own meals while enjoying the view from the balcony, so we could afford a few extra trips to Sea World. The staff was great, the restaurant fantastic, and you've got to try the little hole-in-the-wall Mexican place to the left of the hotel as you walk out the driveway. Cheap and yummy. At the hotel they had a free ride on the hotel's boat, exotic birds and fish, and they even had s'mores around a fire in the evening times. There is a great pool and an arcade for the kids on-site. It was, all in all, a wonderful trip, despite the gloomiest July on record and an earthquake nearby during our stay. I would definitely stay here again, and just hope for more typical San Diego weather....and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Meh-too expensive for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: CheeseheadFred
Reviews.Content: Had a discount rate of $145 per night. Far too expensive for a motel. Had a lovely view of the parking lot, our reservation was for a "Garden View" with a private balcony. We shared a common walkway with 4 other rooms directly across from the overpriced soda and ice machine. First night was really noisy due to paper thin walls. The other 3 weren't as bad. Miller Lite in their bar area was only $6.25 a bottle! I know that things are a little pricey in California, but really? Service was good and grounds were well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jfb8
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego and needed a Staycation. This was the perfect place. Beautiful views and good service. Their spa offers the best massages in town. I've tried several spas in San Diego, and this one was the best. Don't expect a five star resort though. It's a little run down and the buildings are aging, but it's the best place to stay in PB or Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE IF YOU LIKE TO BE TIRED AND DIRTY!”
Reviews.Author: dogballs
Reviews.Content: The plumbing sucks, the walls are paper thin the elictrical transformer hums so loud that theres a constant vibration in the walls and foundation. (all night) the rooms are old and dirty the water changes to scalding hot with out warning. beds uncomfortable. not enough words for how bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable family vacation”
Reviews.Author: RickF2
Reviews.Content: Our family had a super time at the Catamaran Resort & Spa and San Diego recently. The staff and amenities were top notch. They were all very accomodating, friendly and service focused. My wife enjoyed her spa treatment, my son and I learned to sail together with the help of the facilities water sports offerings, and I was also able to use and take advantage of the resort's fine fitness center as well. In addition, my wife and daughter had fun taking in the cute shops in and around the Mission Beach area. During our stay, we visited Sea World, the Midway aircraft carrier, Little Italy. Between the local attractions, nice climate and the Catamaran resort, we all enjoyed ourselves throughly.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a resort, but that's not what we got”
Reviews.Author: anscovel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because some friends were getting married nearby. The website shows a beautiful resort, so we were expecting something really nice, with great views and beautiful rooms. We were so disappointed to find the rooms are nothing special (very outdated and old-more like a cheap motel) and our "garden view" consisted of a tree with a couple flowers! The staff seems annoyed whenever you have a question or need. Our coffee pot was broken and was not fixed after several attempts to have it fixed.Not only is the price ridiculous for this place, you also have to pay $13 per day to park your own car, and hike your luggage up and down stairs, because there Is no elevator! While the front is very nice looking, I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Patrick2008
Reviews.Content: After being unsure of where to book a long Labor Day trip to San Diego, we settled on the Catamaran Resort solely based on online research...and were pleasantly surprised at how great it was for our family. Location was ideal, on Mission Bay, one block from Mission Beach. Never even went to Sea World because we were so happy with the beaches and pools that were walking distance. Room with a kitchen on the tower (upper floor) is highly recommended. Only minor stag was that on 2 of the 5 days there were delays with housekeeping, but on one of the busiest weekend of the summer was somewhat understandable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Views and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: desert238
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, they had a free buffet in the lobby. Nice touch after a day of traveling. When we first booked the hotel, we could only get a basic ground floor room with one bed. When we checked in, I asked the desk agent if we could get a basic room with 2 beds. He said for an extra $15 a night he could put us in a room with 2 beds. He told us the room is on the eleventh floor of the tower. I took the offer. We went to the room and WOW! 2 queen beds, a full kitchen (fridge, oven, sink, plates, utensils, etc), couch, dining table, full bath, TV and south facing balcony. It was bigger than my apartment! We could see downtown San Diego, Sea World and the ocean. Right on Mission Bay. The hotel has it's own dock, watercraft rentals, snack shack. Pacific Beach 1 block. Restaurants and big grocery store are 3-4 blocks. Kitchen and grocery store were used often to save some money. Great landscaping with Koi ponds and ducks. Big swimming pool. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: kypros73
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding at The Catamaran. Enjoyed and highly recommed this wonderful resort in Mission Bay SD. Encountered good and consistent service from all staff members during our stay, especially from Front Desk Agent and Server at The Attol Restaurant. Hotel Room overlooked subperb views of Mission Bay and Ocean. We were impressed with the lush and well maintained tropical landscape throughout resort's grounds. Booked a party of 11 at resort's Attol Restaurant. for their popular Sunday Brunch. We were promptly seated on grass area overlooking the Bay. All agreed that this was one of the best Sunday Brunch experiences and great value we had experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for a family with children with 9, 13 and 15 in group”
Reviews.Author: KirstM
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the hotel for 5 nights after stopping in LA, we needed to stop longer. A quality hotel, with super location inbetween the beaches. Wasn't expecting towels included, so don't bother taking any for the beach or pool. Arcade games are free, yes free!!! You must talk to the parrots.....and see the show at 3pm with the kids! Grounds are well kept, swimming pool gets very busy, not really busy enough. Chairs on beach are free, get there early, although towels usually not available until 10am. Visit Ralfs supermarket 5 minutes walk away for you breakfast, snacks, beer etc, as hotel is expensive to eat and drink. Don't forgot your parking charges everyday.

Reviews.Title: “OK but needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: BellaPeterborough
Reviews.Content: Nice location on Mission Bay. We stayed in the 16 floor high rise which had good views but the lifts were slow and in need of refurbishment. Had the choice of 2 beaches either Mission Bay or the Pacific Beach which was used by surfers. Found the resort/hotel expensive for eating. Rooms wer an excellent size but the hotel did tend to get very noisy and the patio doors did not keep out the noise from either other guests or the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fantastic with kids, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: dolally
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay.. Pool fab free video room nice touch... ,Make sure you walk over to the ocean side and walk on board walk.. Restaurant in hotel great and rooms fine. Ask for bay view lovely x Seal tour fantastic in SanDiego and trollwt tour great way to be a tourist ..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hockeydadToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nites.Hotel is perfect location;across the street from beach and right on mission bay. Resort has all one needs;nice pool setup,bay with multiple seacraft rental options.Staff very accomodating,Rooms a bit dated but more then adequate as one doesn't spend much time in rooms.Beds comfy.Wedsnday night bbq buffet was excelllent and well-priced. Fitness facilities were clean and more than adequate.Overall you can't go wrong at this resort .

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has its moments”
Reviews.Author: Winezperce
Reviews.Content: Here for a conference. I was given a room directly above the sliding doors of the "tower" lobby and also next to the door for the stairs. The only way I could drown out the noise of the doors sliding open and closed, people running up and down the stairs slamming the door each way, and people generally being loud in the area in front of the doors was to have the AC or fan on high all the time. The room was small but fairly clean. I did find a long black hair in the fold of one of the bath towels and there was hair on the bathroom floor. We did have a 5.6 earthquake during the stay and the room did rock and roll. But no damage. The friendliest staff was a waiter in the resturant. He was an exceptional man. The beach and resort aspects of the hotel were very nice. The hotel is old but seems to be wearing well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything you need”
Reviews.Author: greyhound123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for 8 nights and had a fantastic time with our two teenage daughters and celebrating a 16th birthday. This is a Polynesian-style hotel with immaculate grounds and gardens. The location is superb. One block to the Pacific Ocean, beaches and boardwalk; three short blocks to the grocery store and cafes; out the back of the hotel to the Mission Bay Beach. It was a short drive 20-45 minutes to everything we wanted to do: downtown, the zoo, Old Town, amusement park, etc. I looked online but called the hotel directly to make reservations. Finding out that we were staying 8 nights, the hotel manager gave us a further discount. When you check in ask for hotel calander of events for the week. They have something going everynight-- free s'mores and bonfire on the beach, beach volleyball, morning Yoga, exotic bird shows, game room, pool and hot tub. There are also reasonably priced wine and cheese happy hours and the authentic Hawiian luau is one of the best values! We've been to Hawaii and other than pulling a real smoked pig out of the sand this is as authentic as it gets in America. For more deals, stop by the beach bike rental hut in front of the hotel near the circular drive. You can pick up a fantastic coupon book with area discounts. We used the discounted surf lesson coupons for the girls (awesome time and great instructor); the beach bike rental coupon, the sail boat rental, the spa discount, too many to remember. I selected a second floor, pool/lagoon side room. It was a great location if you have kids and we could view the pool from our balcony. The free business center was right near the pool and free game archade so I went there while the girls were playing. The room was clean and well kept except for the carpet - it was showing its age. The drapes, bed linens and towels were fine. Our refrigerator had issues but maintenace came promptly and fixed it. The spa was luxurious and adults can use some portions of it for free - make sure you call down and ask the spa which services are complimentary. I had a pedicure (it was on special) top notch. (Great side trip: sea kayaking in LaJolla.) We would definetely go back! This is little paradise in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but room definitely needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: asamn4
Reviews.Content: I vacationed with my husband and young adult daughter. When we arrived to the location we were impressed with the beautiful foliage, waterfall, birds, walking paths. Check in was quick, maybe waited 15 min, check in went well, no problems. The price we paid for the room had us anticipating a very nice room. The room had a bad smell upon entering, not very clean. I did like the double sinks, which allowed my daughter and I to get ready at the same time. The room had 2 very small beds with very old conforters. The beds had to be full size, I ended up sleeping with my daughter throughout our entire stay. The location is perfect though, bay on hotel side and the ocean within walking distance. We enjoyed jogging and bike riding and the Bahia boat (which is free for hotel guests) was a nice treat. We did attend the luau which I highly recommend. We did not have a car so we did take a taxi from airport which was $45. Later we found out that there are town cars, usually one parked in front of hotel which are more reasonable. We took one to Del Mar racetrack ( $45) and at a different time used one to take us to Broken Yolk ($10) which was great place for breakfast. We did use the town car service to get to the airport on our return and negotiated with the driver before hand and we were charged $30. We would stay again because of the ammenties but at $259 a nite the establishment needs to update the rooms to include changing out the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun for the kids”
Reviews.Author: Canadoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it sounded like a fun place for my children, aged 11 and 13. The rooms were nice. Not opulant. The view from the Bay View Suites was awesome. The walk through the property was beautiful with trees and flowers. The duck ponds were great. The kids loved to stop and just watch the ducks. The parrot attraction was unique. The parrot keeper came out to talk to us and show us the birds. The lobby with its waterfall was great although a bit loud. The restaurant was lovely and we had room service which was prompt and still hot by the time it reached us. The whole place was a gem and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: AZSMF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary and found the rooms lacking any patio privacy, broken A/C in the first room and then again in the 2nd one... it was hot in the room and we couldn't sleep, especially when the fan started squeeking. Then, to top it all off, the 2nd room we were put in was a 2 bed handicapped room. I've stayed at many other places on the beach which blew this place away for roughly the same price, some cheaper. I doubt we'll be back. In addition, I was unable to get any response as to why this happened from their website

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and fun, but not San Diego's best ...”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Ro
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran Resort definitiely doesn't have "Corporate" stamped all over it! A grotto in the lobby, exotic birds outside ... a very different ambience, though sadly in need of updating ... too shabby for the price bracket. A not great resturant, but good conference facilities and a really nice harbor-side location. Room was comfortable, room service was prompt, internet access worked ... I'd recommend, but check out other reviews first ...

Reviews.Title: “The complete package with small children”
Reviews.Author: TRCLasVegas_NV
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with a 3 & 8 yo in standard garden room by pool. The hotel has beach, pool, beautiful grounds, entertaining birds, parking next to the room, boats, room service- in short everything I needed traveling with the kids. Lots of families staying- other kids to play with! Yes the hotel is older, but my room was clean. I was not in tower, and location next to pool was nice and convenient. There are a few unusual things- the walk to the beach was circuitous, service was inconsistent, but more good service than bad. You cannot get ANYTHING else like this in San Diego for the price/location. The other hotels with resort type amenities on Mission Bay are also somewhat dated- at least Catamaran is clean and maintained. I did Sea World package and the week pass to Sea World for the price of a one-day ticket was wonderful. This place is perfect as a family-friendly resort- depending on what you are looking for. You can walk to ocean from hotel, as well as shops and restaurants outside hotel. My only "complaints"- I wish the room was a little bigger, had a microwave, and they had more kid-friendly tv channels.

Reviews.Title: “Something For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: QuailLady
Reviews.Content: OK, are you traveling with small children? Every family with little ones I saw was having a splendid time. The large well appointed rooms had lots of space but the ducks, parrots, fish and beautiful white sand beach on the bay right outside the rooms wowed all the kids. How about traveling with teens? Well, the reasonably priced water rentals for Kayaks and paddle boats as well as the beach volley ball court on the bay side; the pool and arcade (Opens at 7 AM) kept the teens busy and then walk across the street to the ocean and there is enough surfing and skateboarding to keep any teen very busy and happy. Did I mention that the bay view rooms have an unobstructed view of the fireworks from Sea World on the weekends in the summer? Hotel guests can watch the fireworks for free from the deck of the Bahia Belle a paddle wheeler that goes out on the bay in the evening. also great views from the lawn and the restaurant as well. Our garden view room was well appointed, very clean, nice carpet and very good beds and linens. While our room was at the back of the property and near some vacation rentals the landscaping kept our room very quiet. Business meeting? Well there were two while we were there. The receptions on the lawn looked fun and the bar area and fire pit had a lively vibe. Me, I wanted quiet, a great room, and family time. So while my teen was kayaking the bay the lounge under the trees by the bay was perfect. We felt that the area supported everything we were looking for great access to beach and bay, good food and shopping all within easy walking distance of a great hotel. And if you like chocolate... coffee and the chocolate pomegranate egg rolls at the Atoll serious desert.

Reviews.Title: “Lush”
Reviews.Author: mmv0703
Reviews.Content: We only had a couple of days to spend in San Diego but wanted to be near Sea World and the beach. The Catamaran is right on Mission Beach, which is beautiful. We stayed in one of the Garden rooms and it was clean and had good amenities but a little dated. The gardens are beautiful and it was nice to wake to the sounds of birds in the mornings. The vegetation is very lush and the exotic birds are beautiful, along with the fish, turtles, etc. It was a very good place for a family or a couple. If I could make one suggestion to the owners it would be to upgrade the rooms and get 2 queen beds rather than the doubles. I would go there again. We got a good price for our stay and it was definitely worth that and more.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Catamaran. Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: rsonne
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Catamaran! The location is perfect, the grounds are beautiful and everything was clean and well attended. The service was awesome. I will start with the service at this resort. When we arrived (quite early) our room was not ready but they offered to call our cell when the room was ready. I thought, ya, sure. Well they did call! Our deluxe king garden room was on the second floor very near the lobby, a great central location. The room was good size, well appointed and clean. Nice flat screen TV and a fridge. Large closet. Comfy bed. The next day we got a call in the morning that the water heater had broken in our building and we had to be moved. That was a bummer as we had unpacked everything, had gotten groceries etc. I asked where we were being moved to. They said they would give us an upgrade to a BAY FRONT room. We packed our stuff and got assistance will our move. The view from the bay front room was awesome. The room was bigger, the bath and sink area was huge (double sinks, yay!), there was an even bigger flat screen TV as well as a couch. The bed was still nice and comfy (there is nothing worse than a crappy hotel room bed!). We had a room with a second floor balcony maybe 20 feet from the bay board walk and the white sand beach of Mission Bay. I was sooo happy that water heater broke and was very impressed with the management for taking such good care of us. But, it gets better. We left for the afternoon and when we returned to our room the management had provided us a wine and cheese tray as well as a card apologizing for any inconvenience! We have traveled to lots of hotels and have been on several cruises with various problems that have popped up and never, ever, have we been treated so well. After staying in both rooms I would recommend paying the extra cash to have a bay front room. I think it is well worth the view and the people watching. The location of the Catamaran is great. It is located on Mission Bay, which is a much quieter location than on the Pacific side of things. But, if you want to see the Pacific you just walk one block over and you are right there. There are great restaurants, shops and groceries within walking distance. We rented a car while in San Diego but your really donâ€™t need one in this location with public transportation being what is and with everything being so close. (Parking can be a pain and you usually have to pay. Watch the parking signs on the street closely, we almost got a parking ticket!) Our favorite restaurant was just a few steps from the Catamaran. It is called â€œWorld Famousâ€� and is right on the beach. Go at sunset for an incredible view! They have the best lobster bisque soup I have ever had. The grounds of the Catamaran were very tropical. Lots of palm trees and flowers. They keep ducks, geese and other birds on the property-- lots of fun to watch and photograph. The pool and the hot tub was clean and good size. The spa seemed very nice as well (a little spendy though). The lobby has a huge waterfall. We did not eat on the property but we were there on Mothers Day and there were lots of people paying $40/person for the buffet. I guess it must be good. We would not hesitate to recommend the Catamaran. Everyone from the front desk staff to the maids to the gardeners were very friendly. We hope we can go back sometime very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pammy_4567
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel in a different city always feels like a monumental task. I researched here on Tripadvisor, as well as other sites to find the right hotel for us. I hemmed and hawed over a couple of hotels and after seeing a video of this hotel I was convinced I needed to stay at the Catamaran Resort. I am very glad that I chose this hotel. We knew we wanted a great view and a balcony and the Catamaran Resort had both. The grounds of the hotel were well kept. Located between the bay and the ocean, we were in the perfect location for our trip. The rooms were large with a large bathroom. Unfortunately the shower head was a bit too short for my boyfriend, but perfect for me. The view from our balcony was the best part. We were able to sleep with only the screen door shut and it was fantastic. The only downside is that they don't provide beach towels. You can take one of their bathroom towels to the beach, but they don't recommend it. Additionally the parking was $13 a night which isn't too bad considering the prices at the other hotels. I would definitely recommend staying here! If we stayed a little longer, we would have tried the spa treatments. Perhaps we'll just save that for our next visit out!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: flyingwaitress
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married on the bay, just a few minutes from the Catamaran, but we stayed at the Catamaran, as did many of our friends. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed with how friendly and welcoming everyone was. Eric the bellman not only helped us with our bags, but joked with the kids and gave us some great pointers on restaurants and activities close to the hotel. The hotel grounds are beautiful. We felt like we were in Hawaii! My stepsons absolutely loved the koi, catfish, ducks and birds at the hotel. The birdkeepers were so kind and taught the boys so much about the birds - we got quite a lesson on the trip home! I had gift bags for all of our guests, and they were delivered to the rooms. There is a small fee for the delivery, but it was well worth it to have the bags in the rooms when guests arrived. My guests all thought it was a very nice touch. We did host one event at the hotel - Sunday brunch. It is worth a trip to the Catamaran just for that! The food was amazing - and plentiful! I made arrangements through the Banquets dept, and we had tables reserved for us, with our own waitstaff. Let me tell you, my Mimosa glass was never empty! We absolutely loved our stay, and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Dated”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually in Pacific Beach, about 10-12 minutes north of San Diego. I liked the locations as it is only a few blocks from the ocean and boardwalk area. The hotel is a bit dated. When we parked our car to register we parked on the side and went in through a hallway that reminded me of a dorm hallway, and a bit dingy. However, the lobby is nice, as well as the entire area surronding the lobby. It looks renovated. Our room was on the second floor, parking right in front ($13 per day). Again this hotel is dated, older bathroom, popcorn ceilings, etc. The beds were very comfortable, our room was large, and had a balcony where we could see the pool area. I think for families and travelers on a budget this is a good choice. The trolley stops right in front of the hotel. You can walk to many restuarants, beach, Starbucks, etc. This hotel also has a spa, which is in this newer renovated area.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort/beach location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: blpete
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Catamaran many times and have never been disappointed. It is in my opinion the best San Diego hotel. Whether you stay in the ocean-front bungalos as we did this trip, or in the tower which offers excellent ocean views (have stayed there too), you are guaranteed to enjoy your stay. Great resort-type feel. From the moment you step into the lobby, you will feel like you are in a bit of paradise, think "Hawaii", with exotic birds roaming the grounds and exotic plants. Hotel is located literally right on the beach. Walk out the door and you're there. They are the only hotel I've ever visited that offers FREE chairs and umbrellas on the beach for guests. They don't nickel and dime you to death on the little stuff, and provide those little extras that guests take notice of, like the luxury bath products and extra towels. I give this hotel an A++, but their food and room service is on the slow side, although the food is worth the wait. A meal at any restaurant will delight you and you know there is a definitely a CHEF in charge, and they are not just throwoing burgers and fries on a plate. The food is reasonable and very, very good. Great local getaway and great place for the kids. Lots of great restaurants and shopping within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: P.Nelson
Reviews.Content: Love the location: close to so many things. Love the ambiance. Rooms and grounds are very nice. Wish we had had more time to enjoy. They upgraded us to a bay-view room without our asking. There is a charge for parking. And if you are traveling with someone who had difficulty walking for long distances, make sure you indicate this to the front desk. The walk from the parking structure to some of the rooms is quite long...and there is no elevator to the second floor of the structure. Not something I usually think about, but had an elderly person with us. It was quite difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for making our engagement so special”
Reviews.Author: tsgoldber
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with our recent visit to the Catamaran. I was planning to propose to my girlfriend that day so they gave me a free upgrade to a beautiful room with an amazing room. The consierge set me up with an excellent flourist and went above and beyond. They placed champagne and other items in the room for me at my request and took the time to individually place about 100 paper hearts on the bed for me. They made our engagement special and very memorable. I will definitely be back and I would highly recommend the Catamaran. The location is perfect and the service is even better.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our Honeymoon during September 2009, the location is great and facilities pretty good however front desk staff were close to downright rude and acted like we were putting them out just by checking in!. Food is okay but rooms are outdated and need to be improved. Also you have to pay for the parking which is a bif of a joke. Overall hotel is not bad but staff would definitely put me off staying there again Ruth Coleman, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: esquirewarrior
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with very good affordable restaurant. Location on Mission Bay is great for staying put and the one-block walk to the Mission Beach on the Pacific is doable and an added treat. Although the front-desk personnel was mostly cool, when asked, they were very helpful and plesant. The best service was in the restaurant where each person encountered seemed excellent like the food. There is no shuttle so prepare to provide transportation. Even the close attractions such a Sea World was a medium bus ride away, but fun. Other attractions require taxi or limo (well worth limo for long rides) A friend and I stayed for three nights and had a great stay. The pool is nice, and the hot pool is so great that it was often full. We had a room with kitchen which I recommend as it is away from restaurants and stores. We found it helpful for leftovers. The hotel overall and the room was clean, quiet, comfortable, beautiful setting and location and I plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Really relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MrsMas820
Reviews.Content: Pros: The staff at this hotel were overly accommodating, kind, and responded quickly when we had a problem with our shower, which was fixed immediately. The room was great, we were in a garden room that had sliding glass doors to a beautiful garden and exotic birds. We were close to the pool and I was worried about the noise, but we couldn't hear a thing, thanks to the lush flora. The pool was great. The private beach and walk is amazing. The lounge/bar was reasonably priced. The drinks and food were good. The bed was comfortable and clean. A couple of negatives: The fridge and coffee maker, etc were in the vanity area. I think that food stuff should be further from the bathroom. The pool could have used a lifeguard or a staff person, there were some drunks being loud and obnoxious at about 5:30 pm which was when most families left the area. I wish the towels at the pool were bigger, they were the normal, undersized shower towels that you get in your room. I wish there were robes in the room. There was no comfy seat in the room, only a semi-comfortable desk chair. Parking was expensive but we found a spot on the street. The restaurant (as opposed to the lounge) was extraordinarily expensive. The service for breakfast was poor even though there were very few people there and all we wanted was coffee. I will definitely go back if I can find an online deal.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: lflawson3
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in town for a graduation. We chose the Catamaran for its proximity to the bay and the ocean. We enjoyed watching fireworks from the bay. We also took advantage of the pool and walking the lovely grounds. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. We really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran, the real San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Surfguy007
Reviews.Content: If you want to get an excellent true San Diego feel, The Catamaran is the place to stay. I recommend it for families & singles (active & couch potatoes) looking to experience SD as it should be, day & night. Really close to the crowded beach boardwalk & next to the tranquil bayside boardwalk, with places to eat, shop & party everywhere. Sure you can stay downtown, but to me, thatâ€™s not what itâ€™s all about. Everywhere has a downtown, but not everywhere offers this kind of beach life that the locals enjoy. Or you can never leave the beautiful grounds of this quiet resort & be comfortably content. No need to drive anywhere. There were NO disappointments (except leaving), a very well ran establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back - For Sure”
Reviews.Author: smchristy
Reviews.Content: My family traveld to San Diego for a wedding the week-end of April 17th. We stayed 3 nights at the Catamaran and really enjoyed it. We had a suite in the tower (room 551) that had a king bed and a separate living room area with a pull out couch for our son to sleep on. There was also a small kitchenette with a fridge, stove/oven, microwave, and sink. The walk-in closet was a nice touch since we were able to put the luggage out of the way. There were also two large sliding patio doors, each with balconies, that overlooked Mission Bay. If we looked to the right we could see the ocean. Even though our room was right next to the elevator we didn't hear it. At night the room was so quiet we felt like we were at home.
