The king bed was very comfortable and my 7 year old son was happy with the pull out couch. The hotel also has nice cribs available for babies/toddlers. The hotel is conveniently located a block away from the ocean and there is a great "boardwalk" to enjoy a nice walk by the ocean. Since the hotel is right in the Mission Bay/Pacific Beach area there are TONS of great places to grab a bite to eat. Not to mention the Ralph's that is two blocks away so you can grab snacks for your room. I would suggest going to Rubio's for fish tacos and The Eggery for breakfast. We had a great stay (even if parking is expensive) and we would come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Brock615
Reviews.Content: Dear TripAdvisor; I never thought I would be writing a letter like this to you.... We stayed 4 nights at the Catamaran resort and had a great time. The grounds were very clean, despite a large group of teens who were in (for a choir competition, so they may have been better behaved than most). The pool area was clean, the spa was crowded occasionally, but in good shape. A nice touch was that during the spring break season, the games in the game room were gratis. My two sons enjoyed this. The rooms were clean and up to date, with comfortable beds and nice linens. We did not try the hotel resturaunt, as there were some great ones nearby. We had great success at "World Famous", just a few blocks towards the beach and had an especialy good meal at "Saskas". Awsome steak and seafood place. Chose poorly one night and went to Tony Romas. Maybe it was a bad night for them. I wouldn't go back to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful grounds, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: IlliniMan10
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel/resort, and my wife and I really enjoyed our family stay with our two "tweens". I initially booked a garden room, which was the only thing available when I made the reservations about 5 weeks before our trip, but was able to upgrade to a studio with kitchenette in the tower by calling about 10 days prior. Highly recommend a studio... we were on the "parking garage" side, which I actually prefer as you can see the Pacific ocean as long as you are above the fourth floor (we were on the sixth and had a wonderful view). The resort is ideally located on Mission Bay and about one block to the ocean beach. Beautiful grounds with koi ponds, exotic birds, beautiful foliage. Room was a nice size and enjoyed the view from the balcony. My only complaint is that the beds were a little small, but other than that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Locaton”
Reviews.Author: captainlew
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for a family vacation. The hotel is in a great location, it is easy to get to all the tourist places (Sea World, Legoland, Zoo, beach). Park in the garage, $13 a day, it is an easy walk to all the rooms. We had a bayside suite room on the first floor, which was great for the kids to play on the bay beach and take walks on the bike/running path that runs right behind the hotel. The room has a small fridge, sink and small coffee pot, so don't expect much of a kitchen. The grounds are great, the pool is good, the only compliant we had was that the soundproofing between rooms needs to be upgraded. The room next door had a bunch of teenagers that were all talking at normal levels and we could hear everything they were saying. Anyway by leaving the loud bathroom fan on you can mitigate the sounds from the adjacent rooms. Maybe that is the hotel's solution. If you can get over this, then you will enjoy your stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the 10th floor, clean, great location, helpful / friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: chuckybigballs
Reviews.Content: Walk out the "front", across the street to Mission Beach. Walk out the "back" to enjoy quiet time on the bay. Sunset ocean views from our patio (10th floor) were amazing. Lots to see an do within a short distance (walking or driving). Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: OCMOM562
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a wedding at the Catamaran. When we got home, we noticed my husband's dress shirt had a line of black paint across the back. We found out that the Catamaran had painted the balcony railing the morning of the reception. They had taken the wet paint signs down and that evening my husband leaned against the railing. I called the Catamaran and no one was available that evening to talk to me. They said someone would call me in the morning. In the meantime, we took the shirt to our cleaners. They wouldn't touch it. So my husband work on soaking it and cleaning it for 4 hours because it had been a birthday gift from me and he really like that shirt. When I called the Catamaran back and told them what happened, they asked me to mail them the shirt so their cleaners could try and get it out. I told them my husband had already gotten most of it out but the fabric was a little worn from the cleaning. But I would send them the shirt if they paid for the postage and would reimburse us for the shirt so I could get him a new one. The girl on the phone went back and forth to the manager asking the questions and leaving me on hold. She came back to tell me that they would only pay for the postage if they determined the shirt was damaged. So I was suppose to go mail the shirt, take a chance that it would be lost by them etc. so they could determine whether the shirt was damaged. Finally I ask to speak to the manager directly. He was unavailable but would call me back. He called the next day to let me know that he had to have the shirt because if he didn't follow policy "they would go out of business". At that point, I told him all about what happened again. How upset we were that something nice was damaged and that they should have kept the signs up. When I also mentioned to him that after speaking with four different people no one had even apologized or admitted they did anything wrong, he said he apologized the first thing when I answered the phone. When he said was, "I'm calling regarding your trouble." The whole attitude was that they did not wish to take any responsibility unless I in some way proved to them that this happened. It didn't matter that I don't live in San Diego or that they know that the balcony was painted. So much for customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Was a pretty nice resort”
Reviews.Author: mom24hr7dz
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in San Diego area. The resort was nice the view we had was a mazing our room overlooked the city and at night was breathtaking. We also could see Pacific Beach from our balcony. The grounds were beautiful all the flowers and trees. The pool area was clean and so was lobby area our room was a little dated but other than that it was a great place we also had a full kitchen and the grocery store was 2 1/2 blocks down so we walked there the first night and made all our breakfasts and lunch. It was close to everything and had its own private beach area with cabana chairs and tables it was nice. Also a little snack shop on beach and a boat that took you on a hour ride to another resort and back it was nice just to get on the water and enjoy the night air. But be advised we had 70's during the day but by about 4:30 or 5 it would get cloudy and windy and we had to wear sweatshirts and pants and we are from Wis. and used to cold but it was chilly at night so make sure you pack accordingly. It was nice place to stay we would recommend this hotel to others but only thing was on our last day the spring breakers came in and were at a different beach down from ours but it was a bit noisy when you laid out with them going past to go party glad we were checking out the next morning. We all enjoyed to place we didn't eat at the resturants so don't know how food was we did lots of site seeing in 3 days we were there. You can also rent bikes to ride on the pathway that goes along the beach of the hotel that was nice but pathway can get busy. We have 14 and 18 year old and they enjoyed it to. Also Belmont Park and shopping is just down road about 11/2 so if you are up for a walk you could walk it or there is parking down there but go early for good spot. Also recommend zoo, and old town if you have older teens recommend ghostly graveyard tours it was fun not scary but some adult content nothing bad though it was fun. If in this area I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Good Value, Decent Service.”
Reviews.Author: buffalorider
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Catamaran with 2 other friends in a studio room. The room was spacious and included a fridge and microwave, which turned out to be pretty handy. The Ipod dock was also nice. We were on the 9th floor on the opposite side of the bay. We still had a decent view of the ocean and pacific beach area. The staff was friendly, however I found it hard to reach the front desk on the phone when i had a question. It rang at least 8 times before someone picked up. The area is nice with many places/restaurants close by to drive to. Also, Mission Beach and Pacific beach are in walking distance. I enjoyed the food and wine at the Atoll Restaurant, although it is a bit pricey. Moray's Lounge is a nice place to have a few drinks. The bartenders are good people, and they have a decent happy hour appetizer menu. The pool and whirlpool area is a nice place to hang out with friends or family. Having free access to the fitness room was also convenient. They also have a business center, but only 1 computer available for use. And it was always in use, at least when I needed it. Since I was staying in March, we got a pretty good rate on the room. Of course it isn't very hot in march and there is less to do around the beach and bay area. Overall though, I enjoyed my stay at the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value!”
Reviews.Author: Off_to_Somewhere_Fun
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Catamaran, and we enjoyed every one of them. We booked our room for a very resonable rate at a travel web site & were lucky enough to find a bonus upgrade included in the rate. When checking in the lobby instantly relaxed us...waterfall, fish pond and greenery. Check-in was quick and courteous. Our room had a kitchenette, which we used frequently to toss in a pizza and enjoy breakfast at our leisure...the kids could veg out and watcha movie or cartoon & we could enjoy the sound of Pacific waves crashing in. Our balcony had a panoramic view of the ocean (was over the parking garage, but that was easy to get by...look out, not down). The pool and hot tub area was very well kept...lots of comfy seating, towels and even a yummy bar. You can swim and sun on the bay (Mission Bay?). There is equipment rental, too. All was in really good & clean condition. The ocean is a 1 1/2 block walk...Pacific Beach is an odd place but great for watching the waves, sunset, dolphins and surfers. We took advantage of the free twighlight boat trip to wind the kids down. It was brief, and provided a nice look at the bay. It was kind of cheesy, but low-key & relaxing. The Catamaran is a nice place to wind down and enjoy the beach and San Diego. It is not a five-star property but well worth the reasonable rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RESORT, Great Location, So-so Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mseghers
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this place! Great pool area, and amazing landscaping, trees, local ducks, etc., and the boys really loved the friendly parrots! Very safe feeling to the place. Laid back, just a great time. On one side, you have the lagoon, where you can play volleyball and hang out on that beach, or rent a bike and ride to the amusement park, or around to Mission Bay park, etc., and on the other side, you can walk one block to Pacific Beach. We could have stayed here a month and still had things to do! Spa was great, my wife was very well treated and they were very nice. The only downer was the fancy restaurant on-site. Fare was WAY overpriced. Ornamental but ordinary entrees delivered by a tardy and barely-caring staff who seemed like they wished they were somewhere else. They didnt know who was supposed to be doing what. Poorly managed and detracted from our stay. Overall, an excellent experience and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great view with a very unique atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Fluffi_slipperz
Reviews.Content: when i was first introduced to this hotel i was given two places but in the end i chose Catamaran as it was nearer to shops and restaurants. i really enjoyed my stay here as they gave me a big room on the 11th floor of the tower which i didn't expect. i had a fantastic view of the beachs the strip and the pool! there was also an ipod dock to play your music in the room, the only minor fault was our tv wasn't working at one point and we called up for help, in which the repairman came very quickly within 5 mins and as for the male and female on the concierge desk they were incredibly helpful. the hotle is about 5 min drive to seaworld and 10/15 min drive to shopping centre from what i remembered. i had to write an review to say how much i enjoyed my stay even thought it was only a year and half ago i have to say the room was really spacious and has an incredible holiday feel to this place. on the ground floor there were lots of ponds and palm tree which made you feel like you;re really on hoilday.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fantastic...except the kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: maketracks
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Catamaran. We were travelling from Ottawa, Canada via the Syracuse airport and the price of $625/US/person including flights, accommodation and car (versus close to $1000/Cdn/person from Ottawa) was unbeatable so we really don't have any complaints about anything. The hotel grounds are lovely and extremely well tended to, including the pool area where freshly laundered and rolled towels are always available. The restaurant's Sunday buffet looked fabulous and the view can't be beat either from there or from the fitness room and little hottub in the very classy spa. We had places to go and things to do so we didn't eat at the hotel so unfortunately can't comment on the food other than what I've mentioned above. Service was excellent and the front desk staff were very helpful. Before we left I had read some of the comments on this site and was a bit concerned about being over the garage in the tower so I contacted the hotel to request a room on the bayside where we would have a view from our balcony. A little juggling around by the front desk staff upon arrival made this happen. Our package included a free upgrade from a regular room to a studio with kitchenette (subject to availability which was arranged with the juggling noted above!) which was great because we wanted to cook our dinners in. Our room was spacious and comfortable with room to move about. The bad part was the kitchen which was incredibly poorly equipped to the point that cooking a real meal was impossible. Our stove was about 50 years old and not all the burners were even connected to anything. The turntable in the small microwave spun in both directions with no rhyme or reason and the only cooking implements we had were : 1 pot, 1 frying pan, 1 slotted spoon and one large spoon. That's it, that's all. No can opener, spatula, sharp knife (other than the 4 or 5 sets of cutlery that were provided) or anything we could put in the oven to cook with. No big bowl for a salad...We adjusted though and ate cereal, boiled eggs and fruit for breaky, pigged out at lunch in Mexican eateries around town and so soup, pre-cooked chickens and cold vegetable platters from Ralph's in the evening (also lots of potato chips which we don't usually buy so our 18 year old was happy!) became our staples. As far as the beds go - they were really, really comfortable - especially the pillows. The sheets were crisp and seemed to be new. I hate hotel blankets because they don't get washed very often but the Catamaran encases them in the sheets which is great and something way more hotels should do. Because the tower rooms have balconies we could open our room to the night's fresh air which made for great sleeping. We're used to a King bed though...doubles these days are really way too small and we would suggest upgrading all doubles to Queens throughout the hotel. New microwaves are pretty cheap these days too and it's definitely time for that! Would I recommend this hotel? Yes - but not to everyone! If you want to cook a real meal, forget it. If you want to picnic in your room and you don't mind a double bed and furniture that is somewhat dated (clunky wooden table and beds) then go for it. We didn't mind a bit - the price was right, the value for our trip was great, staff were pleasant and helpful, grounds lovely, and the rooms were spotlessly cleaned. The location is prime and is close to everything, everywhere. The free hi-speed internet was also great because our daughter had exams to study for and used it daily. Thank you Catamaran for this - I've never understood hotels that nickel and dime their customers with internet fees. I wouldn't want to pay a couple of hundred dollars a night for the room we had but...we didn't so for us the Catamaran was a great choice and we would return in a heartbeat. Thank you for a wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for kids”
Reviews.Author: perlani
Reviews.Content: Close to SeaWorld, nice bay beach for kids to walk around and play in the sand, restaurant on the beach so that you can eat and watch the kids play. Pretty good food at the hotel restaurant. Pool was a bit small and cold. Tower rooms were a bit dated but nice to have small kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bhjensen
Reviews.Content: We just had a FANTASTIC trip to the Catamaran Resort Hotel. We stayed in a Bay Side Suite which was perfect. Not the most beautiful decor that I've ever seen but other than that the room was great! Service was great. The front desk accommodated all of our needs. The Atoll Restaurant was okay. The Happy Hour at Moray's Lounge was great. The concierge gave us some less than great restaurant suggestions. The World Famous is pretty good and you can't beat the location. The Mission Cafe is the place to go for breakfast. Rubicon Deli for lunch. For dinners we did Gringo's Cantina for Mexican and Enoteca Adriano. We had to take a cab down to Enoteca Adriano but it was totally worth it. $5 each way in the cab and the food and atmosphere were INCREDIBLE. I can't imagine a more perfect location for a family vacation. Sits right on the bay and is 1 block away from the Pacific Ocean. The pool is beautiful and clean. Our son loved all the birds, ducks, and fish on the property. We took the metro bus from our hotel to SeaWorld which was a cheap and easy trip. It would be great if the hotel had a shuttle but hey, can't win 'em all. Metro Bus was $5 round trip per person and only took about 15 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a beach front experience in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful:)”
Reviews.Author: AnitaColifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself chose this hotel for a weekend retreat because it sounded amazing and was close to home. We absolutely loved our stay there because of its tropical theme and the beautiful ducks and the birds around:) Breakfast is amazing, the water front restaurant has a breath taking view! The staff is very friendly and accomodating. We will definitely be back and recommend the hotel to anyone who is looking for a relaxing getaway:)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: papa_rono
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at this hotel online and mentioned that it was our 10th anniversary. We were greeted at the front desk by a very pleasant lady who said that they would be upgrading us to a BayView Suite. After a short walk to the tower, we took the elevator to our room (1251) and were amazed by the room. The view was simply breathtaking, as you can see both Pacific Beach and Mission Bay! This would be really great room of you were travelling with kids or another couple as there is a separate bedroom in addition to a hide-a-bed in the living room, as my wife and I were the only ones, this room was very spacious! The grounds of the hotel are immaculate, and kids will love the ducks and koi on the property...not to mention the Parrots! The pool area is gated with a great Jacuzzi and also a video game area for the kids. The location for the hotel is absolutely unbeatable if you are into the beach scene, as it is across the street from the Boardwalk on Pacific Beach, and direclty on Mission Bay. It is also very close to a Grocery store (Ralphs) if you want to save some cash and cook your own food. There is also free wireless access for hotel guests. Now on to the negatives (although I feel bad for even mentioning them) -While the room was fantastic, we were right beside the elevator so we could hear the elevator going up and down during the night. (Not really that bad, but noticable) -If you plan on having a hot shower, you should try to have it before 8 am or after 10 am, as there will not be much hot water between those times. All in all, I would highly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: UtahMayflower
Reviews.Content: After reading several disappointing reviews on this hotel I was worried about what would greet me once I arrived. I didn't need to be. My sister and I stayed in a 5th floor tower room overlooking the parking lot (the bay was on the other side), but I could still enjoy the view by looking out instead of down. I was surprised to find a full kitchen in our room as no one had mentioned there being one, and we utilized it fully (the cleaning staff even washed our dishes for us!). There is a grocery store just down the street. I couldn't hear my neighbors at all and the staff was friendly and helpful. The only negative about the room was that the shower head is placed pretty low on the wall. I am 5' 6" and it worked for me, but would have been too low for anyone taller. I was also charged for a daily newspaper that was never delivered to me (if I was supposed to pick it up somewhere I wasn't told about it.) You can opt out of the newspaper if you want. We took advantage of the self-parking (yes, I thought the price was a little much, but better than alternatives for us) as well as the fitness room, which met our needs and was clean and new. Bring your earphones if you want to hear the small tvs they have on the machines as you work out. We enjoyed the free cruise around the bay on the Bahia Belle too. If you are expecting to be entertained you'll likely be disappointed, but if you just want to be out for a nice evening ride on the bay you'll be delighted. We also had a very relaxing time at the spa where the therapists were professional and pleasant. I enjoyed the decor and learning about the exotic birds they brought out to the gardens daily. The location worked wonderfully for us and it was nice to have the bay out one door and the ocean 2 minutes out the other door. Couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: plumeria30
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed here before but because it is billed as a resort I expected so much more. The room was noisy - traffic noise all night and I awoke each morning to the sound of the neighbors' crying baby. The room was very plain with limited table space. The sheets were rough and dingy. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDMTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catamaran Resort in January, 2010 with a large group and our experiences were universally bad. Several members of our group came down sick from the constant cold air blowing on us in the conference room. Several nights are dinner meat and fish were served to us in a near raw condition and 40-50 plates of food had to be returned to the kitchen to be cooked again. We generally did not have hot water for showers in the morning. To top it off, all of us were overcharged for our lengthy stay and we are still trying to get these issues sorted out. I would stay away from this hotel if you want to have a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Polynesia in CA”
Reviews.Author: TomFromTucson
Reviews.Content: This is as close to a Hawaiian or Tahitian vacation as you can get without leaving the US. The location is unrivaled, being right on Mission Bay, a block from Pacific Beach and walking distance to local shops. We had a "garden" room close to the lobby so it was quite convenient. The room was clean, nicely furnished and had standard amenities. We enjoyed the Luau and were very impressed with quality of entertainment. Renting watercraft for fun on the bay was quick and easy. The dining is great unless you are on a tight budget. This was our second stay and our favorite San Diego resort.

Reviews.Title: “We want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: PiceaOrientalis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Catamaran for a trip that actually combined work (academic conferences) with a family trip. While one spouse went off to a conference, the other watched the kids (ages 5 and 7). The view from our balcony window was breathtaking. The proximity to the beach and to restaurants couldn't be beat. We loved the Catamaran's lush garden and tropical birds. We rented bikes -- including a tandem bike -- one day and cycled around Mission Bay, happily, for the kids, finding a playground nearby. We'd all love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Catamaran offers all the niceties we were looking for at an excellent value - with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: Arger
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran has a lot to offer, starting with exceptional and friendly service and very comfortable rooms. Being an older establishment, the fancy facade that is often present at high-end resorts wasn't there - instead, what the Catamaran has is authenticity. The staff are genuinely nice and pleased to help, the beds are the most comfortable I've experienced at a resort, the on-site food and drink selection (and once again, service) are exemplary.

Reviews.Title: “*Beware* - Beds crawling with Bed Bugs! Not Baby/Handicap Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: tanneraz
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER recommend the Catamaran Resort and Spa to anyone: 1. The Resort is not Baby/handicap friendly. The parking is far from the rooms and the parking garage only has stairs which resulted in many trips carrying our stroller/baby up and down. 2. We realized our room on the 12th floor was crawling with bed bugs when we were awoken our first night itching and scratching. Although most of them smaller in size we killed half a dozen the size of coffee beans. The attendant on duty did let us change rooms, but moving all of our belongings in the middle of the night was aggravating. I also considered the move a downgrade as the room was similar in amenities but the view went from an ocean view to one of the parking garage. We gave the new room on the 9th floor a good once over before moving in and although clean of bed bugs, our peace of mind was shot and was tough getting any rest that night. 3. Although we hadn't noticed the first night after moving rooms because of our tiredness, the second night we realized our heater was not working which resulted in our baby getting sick and not being able to sleep. What should have been a relaxing vacation turned into a nightmare! 4. We decided to stay at the Catamaran Resort and Spa and spend a little more money thinking the guests would be more responsible, and obviously this is not under the control of the hotel but there was considerable noise and partying going on in the hotel. One morning as we were going for an early morning walk on the beach we were taken aback by the smell in the elevator filled with throw up from too much partying the night before. 5. After all this management did nothing and only said we should have said something earlier when we complained at check out. We did say something but they obviously didn't care since we had paid through hotels.com and already received their money. 6. There were some nice things about the resort: the location, the overall appearance of the hotel, right across the street from the ocean, but we felt the negatives heavily outweighed the positives.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty - Then we were moved”
Reviews.Author: ACALIFNative
Reviews.Content: Nasty, nasty bed covers made you wonder about the entire room and whether anything could be touched or not. Opened the screen door and heard lots of people partying and drinking and talking loud. It seemed to be the place for wedding receptions with lots of drinkers. Finally, could not stand the room any longer and called the front desk. A VERY nice African-American lady said "no problem" I will call you back. She called within 10 minutes and asked if we would come to the front desk for keys to our new room as she was the only person at the desk (11:10p.m.). We gladly obliged. We had been in the tower on the 2nd floor, but now we were relocated to the 8th floor. It was so much better and although I could not help but think creepy crawlies were going to come out, we did manage to sleep. In the daylight the next day we found this room quite odd. There was a queen size bed, one little nightstand and only one electrical outlet where you had to move the table and lamp on you knees to get to it. We had a partial ocean view (nice) and by the time we left we were thinking the hotel was not that bad, but in desperate need of remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: bren777
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Catamaran on Christmas Eve and Christmas day with my sister and my preteen (12 y/o) girl. We were not at hotel very much because we spent most of our waking hours spending quality time with our family elsewhere. PROs: 1. Friendly staff; asked for FREE water & they gave it to me with a smile 2. Beautiful landscape throughout the exterior grounds 3. Extremely beautiful view. The view alone was well worth the stay at the Catamaran. 4. We stayed at the Tower on the 12th floor and room was very clean and spacious. 5. We had a sofa and two queen beds which were very comfortable. 6. The kitchen was well stocked w/utensils, dishes and necessities; appreciated the refrigerator because we had A LOT of left overs from our family gathering 7. HBO for me and Cartoon channels for my girl; always a plus keeping kids occupied. 8. FREE Internet; FREE is good 9. Good air quality (have asthma so this is important to me to have clean air) (We did not eat at any restaurants or experience the Spa so I can't comment on it.) CONs: 1. $13/day Fee for parking 2. No fan in bathroom; small annoyance 3. Door heavy and it automatically slams if you're not careful 4. Paper thin walls so you can hear your neighbors, but we were not at hotel much so it didn't bother us that much 5. Hard to find free outlets for all my electronics so suggest to bring a travel outlet (or similar) to accommodate your techie needs 6. Hard to find control for heater (got a little cold one day) so just closed the sliding door 7. No free breakfast (usually stay at Best Western or similar that provides free breakfast); plus for hungry kids Overall, our experience was wonderful and I would stay at Catamaran Resort again, but will insist on only staying in the Tower (on high level) again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, dated rooms, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: cmor1701d
Reviews.Content: December might not be the best month to be in San Diego as the weather is on the cool side (high of 60 daytime, nighttime in the 40s). The Catamaran's location on Mission Bay is hard to beat. The Atoll restaurant is decent if a bit overpriced. There are hundreds of great restaurants in the area though. I had a 3rd floor studio room so the view was of the gardens and trees that abound. The ducks can be noisy at night if you leave your balcony door open. You can hear your neighbors banging around, and the furniture (couch, chair pillows, etc.) are showing signs of aging. The most annoying thing was the LACK OF HOT WATER between 8am and 9am DAILY! I did not spend spend much time in my room so with the exception of the hot water issue these were minor annoyances. There is also a bird sanctuary on the grounds that is worth seeing especially when the trainer is doing a show.. I would love to come back here when it's warmer, get a room above the 5th floor in the tower and take advantage of the of the beach and water sports amenities. This trip my niece and old friend kept me quite busy with the sights of San Diego so the hotel was really secondary,

Reviews.Title: “Close it is to the beach and boardwalk.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesMaybell
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable hotel with pretty landscaping in an excellent location. I would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted Beach and Ocean in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: GlendowerCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec 25 - 28 2009, room 452, visitung from Calgary AB Canada. I wanted to be on a quiet beach while being able to experience the ocean. This resort met all of my needs. Check-in was a breeze. The lobby is large, modern, with a fantastic water falls. My rental car was afe in a modern 4 level parking garage that never too more than 2 minutes to arrive at from the time I closed my room door. The $13 charge for a private, secure, restricted area with unlimited in/out access was worth every penny. The grounds are a soild 10 out of 10. It ranks as nice as the courtyard at the Flamingo in Vegas. Beach access is simple. Walk 15 seconds and you are there. The Pacifi Ocean and boardwalk is a 2 minute walk. The bar and restaurant serves excellent meals at a price which was lower than what I had expected. There is Staff everywhere throughtout the resort! They speak to you! They are always there to help you. I booked the most inexpensive room because people who spend their vacation in their room need to give their head a shake. The room was cleaned to a 5 star standard. It was appointed with a small kitchen but lacked a couch. I have taken the opportunity to check out other near by hotels. Nope .... NOTHING close to this standard. I will stay again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Like Hawaii- beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraM48
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. Got a really good rate- last minute. The lobby looks like Hawaii- waterfall and beautiful plants. There are tropical birds and lovely fish ponds on the property. I think they said it was the former Scripps estate. Really loved it. I tried the bar and the restaurant and both were very good. The restaurant may be a little pricey for some. Great service, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but needs work”
Reviews.Author: FrattyFrat
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my mother to a conference in San Diego that was being held at The Catamaran, so we decided to stay there. We had terrible problems checking in to the hotel, although my mother made her reservation months in advance. In general I found the staff to be sweet but somewhat incompetent. The room's in shabby condition- it's acceptable, and it's clean, but definitely needs a major update. Otherwise the hotel is lovely. The grounds are beautiful, all the guests looked really happy and relaxed, they have an AMAZING gym (views of the water and a wonderful breeze from the beach- one of the better workouts I've had), and they have a great brunch place, from what I hear (at 40$/person, I couldn't afford it, but it's supposed to be great). The hotel is in a great location- you can walk to the beach and to several excellent restaurants. All in all, we had a great stay, but this hotel could definitely use a little updating.

Reviews.Title: “perfect holiday getaway for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: naspe
Reviews.Content: Read reviews from this site and was nervous as I already booked. Understand reviews of others, but my family is extremely picky and we absolutely loved it!! The location is perfect! No car needed, pacific ocean right across street, and property sits on mission bay beach. (teen daughters) Arcade room with about 20 FUN games was free,yes games were free for my 12yr old boy and we would have easily spent hundreds! Pool chill due to time of yr but hottub lrge and perfect, and beautiful fully equipt park on bay beach about a 5 min beach walk for my 6 yr old. Tower room a bit sml, but VERY nice (Yes bedspreads old & Stained so threw it in the closet) Sheets & blankets fine. Decor similar to the disney polynesian, throughout, very lush and exotic, cleaned frequently, but you will see droppings of ducks here & there always felt like I was going through an arboretum,with exotic plants & birds. If this isn't your style, you wont like it. rented a sailboat, bay had wind but very smooth. Sevice slow, but freindly,food great, Expensive. but reasonable kids menu. housekeeping very accomodating to needs,switch off late vs early cleaning with other floors, Felt safe & relaxed and didn't hear a single complaint from any other guest. Free boat ride @ nite can be used for entertainment(older ) or siteseeing.(none during winter months) Very cool!concierge not too helpful, so do some research there's tons to do! Or easy to just relax @ the resort & surrounding area!

Reviews.Title: “Keeping it a secret is out...”
Reviews.Author: smilinman57
Reviews.Content: If you are an old Aztec re-living some great memories this is the place to stay.. Still have the beach about a football field away or the now appreciated kick back style that the bay offers. The staff helps promote a great atmosphere of {Pacific, Mission} attitude with a smile. {Genuine}

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: laikashadow
Reviews.Content: A great location with the bay on one side and across the street, the beach. Tons of stuff to do by just hanging around. My kids loved walking the bay and beach, swimming the pool, renting bikes and boogie boards. We never went to Sea World and saved $250 because of all the good things to do there. Downside is rooms have double beds, not queens, a little tight. Views in upper floors (5th and up) are maginificent.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: brian1000
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here on business. Our conference wasn't here, but luckily our boss didn't have us stay where it was held- I guess the rooms at the Town and Country were AWFUL according to folks at the conference. I'm not sure how, but our rooms were incredibly reasonable ($119 night for our penthouse suite with view of Pacific Beach!). They were comfortable and cleaned very thoroughly daily. Our refrigerator had an odor and needed to be investigated (it wasn't messy- maybe the drip pan?), but overall it was great. My coworker and I got up early every morning and walked the beach and watched the surfers on some beautiful breaks (my boss is lucky no one offered to loan me a longboard- I'd have been awol for the conference!) before heading out. Evenings we were close to several nice restaurants nearby, many within walking distance. I would definitely stay here for personal travel, assuming I could get the same rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: MayorBurtLake
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, room had great view of bay and ocean and the location was excellent. Could walk to a number of locations and we could walk accross the street and walk along the boardwalk. Free boat ride on the bay on weekends was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cazz777
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Rooms were very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. The amenities were great. Love the fitness center and outdoor treadmills looking at the beach. The location was great you really don't even need to rent a car. Everything is within walking distance. Looking forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort on a great location”
Reviews.Author: Foxden
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 days at the Catamaran. We did the bed and breakfast plan and enjoyed delicious breakfasts (esp. the belgium waffle with real syrup and whipped cream, blackberries and raspberries and candied walnuts.) Restaurant was too expensive so we would not have eaten there otherwise. Room is nicely decorated and comfortable. We were expecting a Garden view room and ended up on the 10th floor of the tower overlooking the bay and ocean....what a beautiful view. The room had a kitchenette and living area. Location is close to everything and only 1 block from the ocean and lots of restaurants. The grounds are beautiful with a lagoon with fish, ducks, exotic birds and nice landscaping. There is a Polynesian feel to the hotel with a waterfall in the lobby. Sailboats and paddleboats are available for rental

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for teenagers and grown ups alike.”
Reviews.Author: HampshireMaisie
Reviews.Content: We were travelling through California and only had three days in San Diego and the travel agent had included the Catamaran Resort in our itinerary so it was not exactly our choice but we were very pleased they did, it was idyllic! The teenage boys enjoyed Mission Bay, the easy bus and tram ride into San Diego to the shops and cinema and they explored a bit further afield and found a guitar shop, just what they were looking for. The Hookah bar was a revelation too. All the cafes and bars along the beach were busy and friendly. I loved getting up early in the morning and stolling along the boadwalk around Mission Bay. The hotel itself was excellent, it is unlikely we will visit San Diego again as we live in the UK but if we do we will definately head for the Catamaran Resort.

Reviews.Title: “If I had to pay for it myself, I would have stayed somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: SJDuges
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of a business trip. It was clean, the service was good, and the rooms were nice, but the extras (even room service) were VERY expensive. It also cost $13 a day to self-park. That's mostly why I gave it the average rating. If you can afford a 50 minute massage for $110, (I can't), then this is your place. The resort also advertises that some rooms walk right out to the beach. Well, it's not the Pacific Ocean, that's across the street. There is a little beach with a lagoon that some rooms have the access. Again, it served my purpose for the business conference, but if I were bringing my family, I might look for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Location ... location ... location”
Reviews.Author: counsel4u
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I've stayed at the Catamaran, but it definitely won't be my last. On Mission Bay, one short block from the Pacific Ocean, where else coud be better? Add to the people watching, walking around the Bay or on the Ocean Boardwalk, coffee at the Mission II, the beach, fun restaurants and you have the perfect vacation spot. Sunrise and then yoga on the Bay beach in the morning, the pool and the exercise room, and finally evening cocktails by the fire pit,all combine to make the Catamaran a wonderful place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “The Catamaran in October is spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Motsd
Reviews.Content: This is our 17th annual beach biathlon & chili cook-off and our 5th year at the Catamaran hotel. This hotel is perfectly located on the bay side of Mission Beach with spectacular views of Sail Bay. The wait staff is always accomodating to our large group (50+ participants). The bay-front rooms are right on the sand and perfect for a family or romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Lovescalifornia24
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was hesitant about staying at this hotel. I received the room I had requested and during check in was given the free cruise tickets for the Bahia Belle. My room was cleaned every day to my satisfaction. The grounds are just beautiful. Eating meals at the Atoll was as great as I had remembered from our previous trip. Staff was wonderful! Yes, I may agree that the rooms cld use some updating. Our room looked like it had some work done. Looking forward to my next trip to the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: alex6612
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a lot nicer than expected. It's your ordinary room nothing super special but clean and roomy. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel couldn't have been better located. Just a block away from the beach and just a hop away from the bay! Perfectly located to go out to all of the bars just a couple blocks away. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “What you miss in the room you make up in location and property”
Reviews.Author: ndjennie
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better--one block from Pacific Beach, steps from the Bay and a more quiet beach. The amenities on the property were great--free game room, pool, great science camp for the kids, grassy area, beach area, boat rides, bikes, friendly talking birds. The rooms could have been much better though--the furnishings and linens were old and dark, and the bedspread was used too many times. It's unlikely you'll spend much time in your room, but this part needs improvement. Overall we were happy with our experience and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful, and awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: Catiyana
Reviews.Content: This place was great. $30 cab ride to here from the airport. The grounds were awesome really great with the ducks, black swans, and parrots (must talk to Chadwick he is a cutie). I searched out great places to eat nearby within walking distance. We were on the top floor of the tower and you could see the beach so clearly. They provided us with the tickets for the ferry though found out you could just show your room card too. This is probably only good for 1 round trip in my opinion. The bar has a aquarium behind it which was nice, oh and a pianist playing. Pool was nice as well as the hot tub both really good sizes. They didn't kick people out either when the time to close it. They also had a safe in the closet of the room. The room was nice, though we would spend all day out looking about. The hotel also has a car service with Lincoln cars and they are priced about the same as cabs and you can charge the trips to your room. Honestly I will be back there, and recommend this place 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel grounds, but rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: bt73005
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We stayed in a suite - so our 2 yr old slept on the pullout sofa bed and our baby had a rollaway crib in the living room apart from our bedroom. There was plenty of room and the view was great! Service here was excellent too - the concierge was very helpful. Lots of good restaurants around - even family-friendly ones. Very short drive (10-15 min) to Sea World and the Zoo and only about 30 min from Legoland. The room decor/furnishings seem a little outdated compared to the upkeep of the hotel grounds, and the bathroom is a little small too. Still very clean though and I would recommend the suite for families!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: In one word, WOW!! We walked into our 12th floor room, opened the curtains and were just spellbound by the view!!! We could see Mission Bay, the ocean,and all the way to downtown! It was hard to leave the balcony to enjoy the other hotel facilities. We were able to check in early at noon. We also were able to find free street parking nearby. We wandered through the lush tropical grounds watching the water birds and listening to the parrots. We passed the inviting looking pool and hot tub and headed out to explore the bayfront facilities. There was a nice sandy beach with some chairs and umbrellas and a snack shop. There were all kinds of "water toys" for rent like kayaks,paddle boats,sail boats etc. You could also rent bikes or segways to use on the miles and miles of paths around Mission Bay. Later we walked across the street to the ocean and kept saying this hotel has the best of all locations in the city. It was too bad that we were there during the week in fall, because the Bahia Belle was not running on the bay and there was no live entertainment in the bar BUT we managed to enjoy the piped in reggae and the happy hour food and drinks at Morays. Seriously good food,large enough portions and decent prices. We are already planning to come back on the 4th of July to watch fireworks AND for me to enjoy some spa treatments!! I think my only niggling negative comment would be that our king size bed did NOT have king size pillows BUT that did not stop us from having a wonderful romantic anniversary "staycation".

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roswell_NMPete
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for approx. 8 days and all I can say is wow! The room was very nice, the resturant(s) were excellent and the staff was very friendly and seemed to be at our beck and call from the valet service (which I would recommend) to the maid service. While not part of this resort, the cab service is less than honest. We took several cabs from this location and it seemed that the return trip was never within cost of leaving, I would recommend the Orange Cab service over the others. Again, this is NOT a reflection on Catamaran Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: charleysmom8
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed this month for a weekend while attending a conference in San Diego. I have stayed at the Catamaran before with my family and have always loved it. Unfortunately, this time the room was not clean. We opened the refrigerator and it had leftovers from the people that stayed there before us along with a half drank bottle of wine. There were also lipstick marks all over the drinking glasses. There was trash (candy and gum wrappers) on the floor around the base of the beds and behind the headboards. For the amount of money that they charge, they should be able to keep these rooms alot cleaner. I was really disappointed. Upon checkout, I let the front desk know and she was very apologetic. Also, they need to upgrade their towels , they are extremely scratchy and the decor could use an updating. I will be giving this hotel another chance though, as I have been a customer now for a few years. You can't beat the location and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. They just really need to hire a better cleaning crew!

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Jtirona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a "ten" in our books! When we vacation in San Diego, the Catamaran Resort is the one and only place for us. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are clean and tidy, beds and pillows comfortable, white fluffy towels, a/c works perfectly and a nice large flat screen TV. You can walk right out onto the bay. They have many watercrafts to choose from, including Segways! This time we rented the seadoos and motorboat. They give complimentary tickets for everyone in your party on the Bahia Belle riverboat after dusk. It's a beautiful cruise around Mission Bay. The hotel is only a few miles away from Sea World and easy access to the freeway. This is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IBSTECH
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Catamaran Resort and it was impressive. It truly is a resort with a beautiful hotel, awesome grounds that are like walking through a polynesian park, pristine white beach on Mission Bay and the Pacific Ocean across the street. Large pool and hot tub with change rooms and plenty of deck chairs. We didn't rent a car and spent less on cab fare to/from the hotel and bus fare to Sea World and the Zoo than renting a car (never mind parking fees). Sea World was a 15 minute bus ride, the Zoo about an hour and it was easy to do. Had a bay view suite that overlooked Mission Bay and the Pacific Ocean. I could have spent hours just watching the view! Variety of eateries close by, grocery store and drug store all handy. Wireless internet was truly high speed also. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jroot4
Reviews.Content: This is the 16th time that I have stayed at the Catamaran Resort Hotel. Each time just gets better. The staff if very stable and many of them remember me on my return each year. I would highly recommend this Resort.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: wolfenstein
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife and two young kids,and had a great time, it is right on the bay which was great for the kids, or if you prefer waves the beach is right across the street, the room was decent and clean,i have no complaints and will definatley be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't plan on sleeping too much at night”
Reviews.Author: shilpiandken
Reviews.Content: I'm torn since there were some aspects of this hotel I really liked and others we disliked so much we had to change hotels. What we liked: 1. Service (friendly hotel staff) 2. Hotel grounds (ideal for young children - with parrots, shaded trees, comfortable bay-side drinks and dining) 3. Hotel restaurant (Atoll: great food) 4. Relatively inexpensive, plenty parking ($13 a day, plenty covered parking) 5. Location (very close to Seaworld and the beaches) 6. Free internet What we didn't like 1. The rooms (terribly outdated) The AC vent is right next to the bed and my husband and son got allergies so bad (the air quality was really really bad) we had to leave the hotel because we could not sleep at night 2. Hot, un-breathable polyester linens (for the price they charge, you'd think they'd spring for cotton sheets at least) 3. Unclean rooms (really unclean) 4. Disgusting,outdated bathrooms 5. 70's era kitchens (we stayed in a suite) Since after a long, hot day at the beach we wanted to take a bath and relax on the balcony and have a good night's sleep, this place was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: travelnmoma
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Catamaran. My mother, son and I went for 5 days/4 nights. Everything went smoothly. We were upgraded to an bay front suite which was beautiful. We could walk right out the door to the beach. My son loved playing in the sand, and the bay side was much more relaxed than the Pacific side. We did eat at a restaurant on Pacific Beach a few times called World Famous...the shrimp tacos were amazing! We had breakfast every morning at the hotel, and the portion was large enough for my mom and I to split it making it a very reasonable price for breakfast. The hot tub was large enough for my son to swim in, so he spent most of his time in there rather than the large pool (chilly at night). He also loved the free arcade room. This was a great resort for a family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn out, but good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Casebas
Reviews.Content: Staff tries hard, but dirty room (don't ask for details) and some odd smells throughout the hotel made for a mixed stay. Pros: nice setting, lots of foliage, friendly staff, good location. Cons: Dirty room, crowded pool, mediocre restaurant, older buildings. If you get a room for under $120 on a weekend, it's probably worth it, but otherwise shop around a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless memories”
Reviews.Author: familyvacation12
Reviews.Content: The view of Mission Bay and the Pacific Ocean was amazing, not to mention the Sea World fireworks. Price incl. tickets to the Bahia Bell bay cruise. Tower room was large and roomy for a family of 4. Kitchen with frig, stove, sink. Pool was family friendly with grill food, smoothies and a bar. Free play arcade. We purchased tickets to the Friday night Luau and was not disappointed. Every activity is available and the Pacific Beach is only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: JMMontreal
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed there for 4 nights. PROS: Well located, on the bay beach and walking distance from the ocean beach, very nice pool, beautiful gardens, room with kitchenette available, boat tour included (between 9-10pm it stops to see SeaWorld's fireworks). CONS: We didn't get the room we reserved for. We specifically requested a room with a sofa bed. On the website, this room is posted with a certain square footage. We got instead a smaller room at the same rate. The room was clean but smelled bad. We argued and obtain a nice and large room for the next 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for families with children”
Reviews.Author: kianinike
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran was perfect for us, with 2 children (6 and 10). The show, birds, friendly staff and inexpensive children's menu were highlights as was the room upgrade (unasked for) to a room on the bay. The room could be brightened up a bit and updated and there could have been more kids channels accessible on the television, but it was adequate and large. The bay was wonderful for our barely swimming 6 year old and the kids enjoyed playing in the sand outside the room while we watched on the free lounge chairs. Also convenient was the beach, right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran Hotel is conveniently located to the sites, located on the beach, and has a nice spa.”
Reviews.Author: KailuaGal
Reviews.Content: My husband, children (13 & 10 yrs.) and I stayed at the Catamaran Resort Hotel and Spa for 4 nights in a King Front Bay Suite in Aug 09. Overall, we had a nice stay at the resort and enjoyed our patio that opened directly to the beach; however, it did have a few shortcomings. The first shortcoming was the lack any real cold water. The water was generally luke-warm to cool, at best. Second, the carpet had multiple stains on it. And third, the lawn maintenance crew was very inconsiderate. They would mow and trim the lawn right in front of your patio only inches away from where you and your family were trying to enjoy a nice, relaxing breakfast overlooking the beach. The resort did have some positive aspects, as well. Of course, we liked that our patio opened to the beach. The rooms were well-appointed with bath items, a safe, ample closet and drawer space, and flat screen TVs in the master bedroom and living room. The lobby had a nice waterfall with a koi pond and the courtyard displayed exotic birds that were very pretty. The resort was also centrally located to most of San Diegoâ€™s main attractions like Sea World, Balboa Park, the San Diego Zoo, and even a couple wineries (Bernardo Winery and Orfila Vineyards). We ate a breakfast and two dinners at the resort restaurant, the Atoll. All the meals were very good. In fact, our first meal was on the evening we arrived only 20 minutes before the restaurant closed because of difficulties with our Advantage rental car reservation. They were incredibly gracious; our server was very attentive; and all of us enjoyed our meal. Our extended family even joined us for cocktails and at no time did they motion or ask us to leave because they were closing. This really helped to ease our earlier bad experience with Advantage Rental Car. The resort also held various free evening events. One such event we attended was the Sâ€™mores night on the beach. My husband, kids, and extended family members declared them to be delicious! The Catamaran also offered a free evening boat ride on Mission Bay. Unfortunately, we did not find the time to take advantage of this offering, but it looked fun. My family also spent time at the pool while I got a massage. They enjoyed themselves, but they stated it was a little too small and crowded. Finally, Mom & I received an aromatherapy massage at their spa. It was a very nice spa with showers, steam room, sauna, whirlpool, fitness center, and relaxation room with tea and fruit. Mom & I also noted the particularly pretty tile flooring. We both thoroughly enjoyed our massages and would highly recommend the spa. Overall, for the level of hotel and price we paid, I give the Catamaran Resort a 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected”
Reviews.Author: LRH98
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other reviewers on this forum, I arrived at Catamaran without high expectations. That is not to say I was expecting the worst, just that I went in prepared for what it was - a convenient , family friendly resort in a great location. Yes, it is an older hotel but our room was clean and comfortable. We had a studio which was very spacious with a kitchenette. We saved money on breakfast by eating in the room. We had a lovely maid who did a great job keeping our room tidy. The grounds are very pretty and we felt secure at all times. As others stated, one side of the resort is Mission Bay with an outstanding view. Unfortunately, we were not on that side, but if I ever go back, I am requesting that side. It was a quick walk to the beach and restaurants. The area is very easy to get around by car or bike. Definitely go to Pirates Cove and ride the Giant Dipper, one of the oldest wooden roller coasters in California. I was not crazy about the food at Catamaran except for what was served from the bar menu. I don't like to slam anyone, but the barbecue night could definitely use some inspiration. The buffet choices were very limited and the hot food was not hot. It was not worth the $25 per adult and $17 per child. But the patio and the view of the bay made it worthwhile. The entertainment was a little hokey, but the kids enjoyed it. S'more night was a lot of fun. There were many, many nice people staying at the resort and my daughter made lots of friends. So, to summarize, it is not a five star resort, but at the price we paid ($150 per night!) it was more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Cat1917
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran is a wonderful experience from the moment you walk into the enchanting lobby to be greeted by a waterfall cascading into a pond of colorful carp. The people at the desk are very hospitable and do their best to make the check-in easy. The rest of the service was excellent as well. The rooms are comfortable, clean and if you are lucky you might get a garden room with a balcony and a fish pond where ducks, turtles, and fish visit. The hotel is located on Mission Bay and it is a short walk across the street to the ocean. So you have the best of both worlds. They also have a world class spa available ( did not use it ). Mission Beach has many great restaurants and inexpensive ones as well. If you have a family this is a wonderful stay. There are all kinds of boats to rent and they have family oriented activities every night. This hotel is very family friendly! Going to the Catamaran is like going to Hawaii, but,you only have to go to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It!”
Reviews.Author: tweenershockey
Reviews.Content: The only great thing about the Catamaran is that it is located in San Diego.... It isn't the hotel that makes San Diego a great place to visit, so if you can find another hotel...do yourself a favor and consider it. This hotel is out dated! When we were at the front desk speaking with the front desk staff, we noticed they are somewhat short/rude. It didn't take long to realize why. It seemed all they were dealing with were complaints from guests...and they made it known they didn't care. After changing from our first room (when we checked in and got to our room we had to relocate as the room wasn't habitable), we were taken to a room in the tower - next to the elevator (I'll get into that a bit later in the review). The room was "an upgrade" and yet it still had an out dated feel, and made us uncomfortable about the stay and about the price. We also felt somewhat short changed as a result of the dead bugs on the wall (only two- but still two too many) and the blood spot on the door inside the bathroom. Our first night was rough. We were on the eleventh floor located next to the elevator. So, when the elevator moved past the floor we heard it - the entire night. Evidence of the outdated structure of this facility is also found in the fact that this hotel doesn't have an elevator lobby. My first advice is to stay somewhere else. However, if you decide to stay at the Catamaran...do not stay in a room next to the elevator. Additionally, do not stay in the tower rooms as they are outdated and do not provide the relaxing hotel feel (they do provide the cheap motel feel at the expensive hotel price). Finally, do not expect the management to address any issues you may have. They seem to be worn down from the constant complaining from guests (you will see what I mean when you check in). Positives.... San Diego is a great place to vacation. We are looking forward to Sea World, the Ocean, the Zoo, and other tourist spots. Unfortunately, at the end of the day we are still coming back here (yes we are still here - day two of our 7day vacation). Finally, the restaurant staff and the bell staff were great. Very positive attitudes, great service, the only positive thus far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds/Old Rooms for Price”
Reviews.Author: BRGuest
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights 7-31-09. The lobby is impressive as are the grounds of the hotel. Very tropical with many flowers and different types of palm trees. Liked the parrots and the quick access to the beach which is across the steet. The spa is so expensive!!! I did not care for the room. We switched to another room which was the same as the first. Both rooms had a very musty dank smell to them. The carpet was dirty and I did not dare walk barefoot on them. The wallpaper was dirty. The ceiling above the shower was moldy as was the shower head. The inside of the closet was so scuffed up. Did they ever hear of touch up paint? I really did not like anything about the room except for flat screen tv. The coffee maker was covered in dust. We paid 250 a night. I will not stay here again unless they renovate the rooms. It was one of those places where I was afraid to get up in the middle of the night because a cockroach may be lurking somplace. FYI I takes alot for me to write a negative review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, Rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: SoCalRR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after finding a good last minute rate on the Catamaran website. When making a reservation on their website, be sure to click on the "Hot Deals" link on the bottom of the reservation page before booking. The location cannot be beat - Pacific Beach and several restaurants across and down the street. The Bay side that the hotel is on is very quiet and pleasant. The lobby and grounds make a very spectacular first impression. Unfortunately, this impression does not extend to the guest rooms. The rooms were just not old, but they don't seem to be well taken care of either. We had a Tower Studio on the 3rd floor overlooking the parking garage, directly across from the elevators. There is no elevator lobby on the floors - The elevator doors were right across the 5 1/2 foot wide hallway from our door. Unfortunately, people congregated right in front of our room waiting for one of the two possibly slowest elevators ever to arrive. I suggest if you are assigned a tower room ending in -50 or -52, you ask for a different room. The room had a a kitchenette and two small double beds, but no table or sofa as indicated by the photos on the website. One of the two beds in right up against the air conditioner vent. The carpet and curtains desperately need to be replaced, as does the whole bathroom. We had no cold water the entire trip! Only hot and scorching hot. It was a problem they are "aware of and trying to fix" according to the front desk. The roof of the bathroom also leaks when the room above is using the shower. I was surprised to see a flat screen TV and I-Home in such a run down room. That being said, the grounds were nice, particularly the beach, and the hotel provides complimentary beach chairs and umbrellas, which is a nice touch. I saw quite a few people swimming in the water off the beach. The hotel also has a lot of activities taking place, such as the Luau, bird show, kids' science camp, bay cruises. Parking is tight and $13 per day. If the rooms were renovated I would stay here again in a heartbeat (if I could find a decent rate).

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JJgrandma
Reviews.Content: I am a return visitor to the Catamaran. We come to the resort at least once a year. We had a bayside suite which made it great for the kids to play out front of the room and we were close to the bay. I would tell my friends to stay here if they were visiting San Diego. It is within walking distance to the beach and to many place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DLH1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran the week leading up to July 4th. We reserved a package through the hotel website that included tickets to SeaWorld. Our room was in the Tower, on the 2nd floor, overlooking the parking garage -- we were fortunate that the palm trees blocked our view. The Tower rooms have full kitchens and Ralph's grocery store is just down the road. The Catamaran is located on Mission Bay and offers complimentary umbrellas & chairs during the summer. Boats and food/beverage are available for a fee. The hotel offers a complimentary nighly cruise across the Bay, which was fun. There is a complimentary arcade located in the pool area along with the pool itself and a hot tub. The grounds are nice -- winding paths, ponds with ducks & fish, tropical birds, indoor waterfall -- very tropical. The rooms are dated, but adequate for our needs. The Pacific Ocean is located across the main road and up one block. This was our second visit to San Diego -- this time visiting SeaWorld, LegoLand, and the USS Midway -- all worth it!

Reviews.Title: “you can find much better place for the same or less money”
Reviews.Author: vpupkin
Reviews.Content: we stayed in "bay front view" suite, first floor next to the trail and the beach. it was very convenient for us and our 5 years old daughter. Hotel is close to the ocean beach (5-10 min walk) and right on the bay beach (no big waves, great for young children). about 30 min drive from San Diego zoo (waste of time, better visit San Fancisco or Oakland zoo - they are much better and compact); 30 min from USS Midway (we spent there about 2 hrs, I was surprised my wife and daughter really liked it) hotel is OLD. carpet, windows etc., many things are old. we didn't have a microwave in our room (was provided after I asked for it, FYI: only rooms in the "tower" have small kitchen with microwave) * no complains about the staff, many hard working people, all looks clean; receptionist helped me with all my questions * "award winning" restaurant is nothing special and a bit expensive, you can find many good places around (5-10 min walk), looks fancy (they probably charge for that) * pool is OK, but crowded almost all day (10am worked for us) * charge you every time they clean your room I don't recommend this hotel, we paid ~$450/night, IMO too expensive, I expected better value for that price

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Location and Great Times”
Reviews.Author: DiDi20
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Catamaran the week of July 5th and it was a wonderful experience. We did alot of research, used this site and decided to give it a try and we are GLAD we did. WE had a bay view room which was spacious and clean. The tub backed up the first day we were there, we told the front desk and it was fixed almost right away. We loved it and would recommened it to anyone. By the way, the Mission restuarant has one of the best breakfasts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location made all the difference for our family”
Reviews.Author: drvosti
Reviews.Content: The staff from the time of the reservation on the phone to the time we left we friendly and helpful. We called the front desk and service desks many times during our stay. They were always helpful and willing to answer our questions. The kids loved the ponds, the fish, the birds, the ducks and their new chicks on the property and it was beautifully groomed. The proximity to the beach and bay were the deal makers for us. We went to the awesome pool in the morning and hot tub. When the kids didn't want to be in the water they played in the free arcade. Then we spent an hour or so on the bay kayaking. We would have lunch in the room. We bought our food at Ralph's (.5mi) and had a small but functional kitchenette to prep. food. Then off to the beach for 4 hours. That was our routine for 3 days and we had a fabulous time. We expected the rooms to seem older and they were but they were clean. I was worried about the sand and messy towels everyday but the room was cleaned everyday and she did a thorough job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ceniceros1
Reviews.Content: We actually live in San Diego but I wanted to do something special for my son's birthday weekend so we rented a tower bay view room at the Catamaran. The view was amazing. We had the bay in front of us and a great view of the Pacific Beach and the ocean to the right of us. Even the kids when we came in at night after the pool had that "wow" look on their face because of the lights at night over the water. The rooms were clean, comfortable,and spacious. The service was great (very friendly). My son and his friend spent hours in the pool, hottub, and free video arcade. They enjoyed the pool side snack area since the restaurant was a little fancy for their tastes. (Hotdogs) There is a pizza place across the street for keeping on a budget. We did the peddle boats and boat cruise around bay which was cheap and fun. You could see Seaworlds fireworks at 10PM which was a nice added benefit of our view room. We also watched torch lighting and Hawaiian dancing on the lawn. Exotic Birds were a nice ambiance. Would recommend for families but recommend utilizing food choices in area and not just hotel to keep costs low. We never left the property and my son was very happy!!! That says ALOT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: chubette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the 4th - it was busy but definitely enjoyable. The location, room, amenities,grounds and staff were great! It's a great family location - I was travelling with an 8 year old and he was able to meet friends in the pool, at the arcade and on the beach. He enjoyed the grounds and was able to run freely almost everywhere. Each guest received a free boat cruise on the bay - we used ours to watch the fireworks upclose! They had a luau on their beachfront property where you could join in or just watch, they had a BBQ on the beach on the 4th and they had bicycle rentals on site. You could also walk to Belmont park from this hotel. Overall, we had a great stay - it was confortable, clean and enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: AgentNikky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a friend had stayed a few years previously. We paid $220 a night plus $13 per day for parking. The room itself was fine, clean and comfy. The hotel has only one bar which is not enough for the size of the property. It just became too busy in the evenings and felt more like a night club with people jostling for space than a relaxing bar. Did not use the hotel restaurant as the menu was a bit OTT for the property. Ate in the bar area a few times, which offered Pizza, burgers, sandwiches etc. The hotel is NOT on the beach, it is on the Bay. The beaches and bays are all non smoking and drinking alcohol. We were in room 550 in the tower and you will see from the photo, not the best view but I guess every room on that side of the tower had the same view. The grounds are lovely and the ducks were tame! Overall, the staff were good and friendly, however I would not stay here again for the lack of amenities compared to the size of the hotel. It is very well suited to families so if you are a couple I would suggest somewhere else. If you like a range of restaurants to walk to in the evening then stay down town in the Gas Lamp area as Mission Bay / Beach does not have that much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for the money. Beautiful grounds.”
Reviews.Author: rockluvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for 8 days on a family reunion trip with my husband and teenage son, my husband's 3 brothers and their family. I was pleasantly surprised with the accommodations after reading mixed reviews on this site. The grounds are absolutely beautiful with ponds, ducks, trees, and flowers and are very well taken care of. I enjoyed talking to the talking parrots that live near the hotel lobby when they were on display and seeing all the families of baby ducks. I had requested a quiet room and we got a room with 2 double beds on the second floor (not in the tower) with a mini-refrigerator and coffee maker in our room. The grocery store is only a couple of blocks away and we purchased breakfast goods and some boxed lunches there to save money. Our balcony overlooked one of the ponds. It was a very peaceful location. My son enjoyed the free video games, air hockey, and billiards. We all liked the hot tub and pool. The location on the bay and just a block from the ocean was perfect. The hotel is also short distances from local attractions with Sea World being just 15 minutes away, the San Diego Zoo 25 minutes, Old Town 20 minutes. We rented a car and parked in the hotel's parking garage - parking is $13/day, but all the hotels in this area charge for parking as they are so close to the beach. We enjoyed the free nightly boat cruise on Mission Bay (Wed - Sat) where we saw the fireworks that Sea World shoots off every night. There are lots of places to eat along the boardwalk and along Mission Blvd within walking distance. One minor point is that the front desk didn't volunteer information about the free cruise when we checked in - I had to ask for the tickets which I found out about online. The front desk also didn't tell us about the spa, business center, or restaurant so they could do a better job upon check in so you know what is available on the property. One thing - the business center has a computer, fax, and printer available for guests use, but they charge $5 for the week and close at 5 pm. We almost didn't get our boarding passes printed because the center was locked, but there was another person still using the computer so she opened the door for us so we could get in. (Free wireless if you bring your own computer.) We called the hotel and got a better rate than what was advertised online and stayed for $129/night. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...loved it...loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom3under6
Reviews.Content: This was our first time traveling with three small children...three under 6 years old. The Catamaran could not have been more perfect. Convienance was a huge issue for us. This hotel was perfectly located next to the Bay and beach. There are many shops and restaurants located within a couple blocks. A grocery store was only two blocks away.
