Let's be frank...the room wasn't the most wonderful, but everything else made up for it. We had a pool view, which was nice and not loud at all. The room was a little small, but so was our budget. We only paid $149 for three of our four nights. It also smelled a little musty, buts seriouly what do you expect for a hotel located on the beach? Also, after being in the room with the patio doors open, you didn't notice the smell at all. Our kids loved the grounds...they were beautiful. Very tropical, extremely tidy, and well layed out. The flora and fauna were spectacular for a hotel!!! The kids loved the pool and hot tub. It was busy at the pool like others had remarked, but if you are traveling with kids...this you wouldn't mind at all. In fact, our six year old made several little friends and they played in the pool together. The staff was very nice and helpful. We wished we could have stayed longer. If you are use to high class, super fancy hotels, this might not be for you. But, if you want a great place for a good value...definately consider this hotel. Parking is hugely convienant too, even if you have to pay for it. We never had trouble finding a spot close to our building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities-terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: ammlAZ
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our stay with our three young children given all the amenities and activities they have for children as well as the proximity to the ocean and the bay. However, we arrived to be told that our room was not cleaned yet at 4:00 pm and it would be 5-10 minutes. Over an hour later and many occasions of being told to check back in a few minutes, we finally got into our room at 5:15 PM. Keep in mind, check in is at 4 PM and we had driven 6 1/2 hours with three small children, including a 6 month old. Relieved to finally have our room key, we stepped into the room only to find a huge wet spot on the carpet where apparently the refrigerator had leaked and no one had cleaned it. We asked to talk with the manager who said to go wait in the room and he would call us with an alternate room arrangement as they were pretty full and he need to search around. Over an hour later, we decided just to unload our things as we still had not heard from him and our children were starving at this point. When my husband went back down to the front desk, the manager just said he was sorry he had been too busy to look for something for us yet. We ended up staying in that room and throughout the stay, the wet carpet began to smell awful. Needless to say, we cancelled the reservations we had for another upcoming trip in August, and all they had to say was "Well, we hope maybe you will reconsider". Highly unlikely!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly and relaxing for all!”
Reviews.Author: Momof3girlsArizona
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran has something for everyone! With the free video arcade directly off of the pool, my children (ages 6, 8 and 9) were able to vary their activities often with little to no effort from my husband or me. The poolside bar and grill abundantly enhanced our level of luxury. The birds were also a huge source of entertainment for my children! With Pacific Beach, quality restaurants and water/outdoor sports equipment rental within walking distance, even on site, we did not move our vehicle for four full days! The rooms are extremely well insulated, we were unable to hear children next door or footsteps from above. For the price this resort provides great comfort, satisfaction and charm!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, easy walk to the beach, and quick drive to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: Rich050
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Rooms are somewhat dated however the hotel grounds are beautiful. Great location on the bay and just a block away from the beach. Easy drive to Sea world, Legoland, and the downtown area. Make some time to visit the Midway museum, its a great exhibit. There were a lot of families at the hotel and it made a great time for our son as he made many friends. He enjoyed the pool and the free arcade area. I would recommend this hotel to families. I have attached a few photos of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMG This resort is so awesome!”
Reviews.Author: shelbiezcat
Reviews.Content: The resort was awesome. The grounds were beautiful and serene. Steps from Mission Bay beach and dock. So many restaurants and shops within walking distance not to mention the real beach one block away. A full kitchen and a grocery store 2 blocks away. The pool was great with a video game arcade and a bar. Close to Seaworld and the beach amusement park. Great for kids and adults.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around resort, and my family loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MelindaStimpson
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about this resort. They had so many things to do right at the resort. They had a free arcade and game room that my kids loved. We have 4 kids ages 8-16, and everyone had a great time. We'll be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both beaches”
Reviews.Author: yomewyn
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Diego, CA many times, but never have stayed at the bay hotels. I stayed at Catamaran Hotel for a data governance conference and absolutely enjoyed my stay. So much, I will be returning later in the year with family for vacation. Catamaran Hotel is a family and business oriented hotel. They have activities for families and pro staff for businesses. You can enjoy the Mission Bay beach, just footsteps away, or cross the street and enjoy the Pacific Ocean. I recommended this hotel to anyone who want to just relax on the beach or looking to surf the Pacific Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SSHNevada
Reviews.Content: We decided to make use of the free upgrade to a tower suite - big mistake. The room that was assigned - number 454 has a fantastic view of the car park! We did comment to the desk about the room, and they would probably have moved us but why should that have happened? If rooms of a better standard were available then why not put us there in the first place? Saves effort on everyones part! There is no privacy, if you have your curtains open then make sure that you are covered up - the guys in the car park will soon have a full view of your "family allowance". Something as simple as netting on the windows is all that is needed. Every morning there is the Disney style "parade of the blue bins", this is a horrendus racket as the trash bins/towel bins whatever they are, are paraded from one part of the complex to the next at 0 stupid o'clock in the morning. Back to the car park - $13 a day to park your car - ridiculous. I should have charged them for my ability to watch everyones car and provide security. How can a hotel justify that price? I dread to think what the price would be if they made the parking slots bigger. My Uplander fitted quite cosily in most of the slots. The Catamaran Spa has devised an ingenious way to make additional money for the Bell Staff and Valet Parkers - really ingenious and something Las Vegas should try out. This is ingenuity is NO ELEVATORS! Try lugging your bags / stroller / children up and down flights of stairs. The plug sockets in the room are too big for the appliances, as the plugs have evolved over the years, the rooms sockets have stayed the same. I had to rig an ingenious device using an ice bucket, a hairdryer and a glass in order to keep my Iphone charger in the socket safely. Hot water! Either fully on or fully off - My 18 month old son enjoys a shower and the fluctuating temperature made it impossible. As for customer service, they could not be bothered to answer my email - says it all really. On the Up side - the grounds are lovely, pool are is good and the staff in the restaraunt are a pleasure to meet. As

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL....GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CMKsouthDakota
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with all the things a family with children need. The birds and pond were wonderful. The location to the bay and ocean can't be beat. Great rate for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem on the shores of Mission Bay with great staff and fun birds”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catamaran Resort for 4 night for the Data Governance conference. Booked a one bedroom suite with a Mission Bay view. The suite was on the 11th floor and afforded a complete view of Mission Bay, Downtown San Diego, and the Pacific Ocean - in short an awesome complete view of the beauty of San Diego. The room has a lot of space with a sofabed, small bar area with 2 stools, table with four chairs, 2 balconies (lots of natural light as room faces south), gratis high speed internet, comfortable king bed, very roomy closet, 2 dressers, 2 flat screen TV's, 2 telephones. The kitchen is very generic and somewhat dated but perfectly functional - 4 burner stove with oven, small microwave oven, fridge/freezer combination, dishes for 6 people. The bathroom is on the small side (allowed for a bigger walk in closet) and has 3 pieces (combined shower-tub). The only specific knock I have against the room is the thin patio window and door combination. It is single pane and a little on the cheaper side of things so there is some noise in the room - I suspect the north side of the hotel (but without the nice view) is a little more quiet. The grounds are quite lush and feature winding walkways, watercourses, a small pool that is nicely heated, and lit torches at night. There are a variety of ducks, swans and koi fish in the watercourses and also exotic birds on their perches during the day that are quite beautiful and fun to interact with. There is easy walking access to a number of restaurants nearby (the hotel restaurant has great service but is pricey) and the Pacific Ocean beach is two blocks away. There is a walking trail that goes right by the property and allows you to go on a multi-mile walk connecting to the walking path (boardwalk - concrete) along the Pacific Ocean. There is also a water sports centre at the resort with kayaks, sailboats etc. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Kick the riff-raff out of the pool"”
Reviews.Author: Insur
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here with one exception. Locals from the boardwalk like to congregate in the hot tub. We arrived on a Sunday night and I thought the hot tub to be filled with stay-overs from a wedding party. A few days into our stay, and after discussions in the hot tub, it was apparent that the local 20 somethings regularly gather in the hot tub and pool after work (recognized the hostess from the sandwhich restaurant on the boardwalk) Lots of beer and lively conversation. A bit too much for my 12 year old son's impressionable ears. By the third night I was not happy that my hard earned vacation dollars were supporting a private party every night in the hot tub. I complained to the front desk but the security guard (have you seen Mall Cop?) obviously wanted no part of any confrontations. All of these party goers produce fake hotel pass cards. Total bummer - would have liked to relax in the hot tub with paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: maisy357
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Catamaran was a wonderful experience for our family. Because we are a family of five, we had to book the largest room available- the bay view suite- and could not have been happier with the view or location. The beach was literally right outside the back door, which meant less travel time and packing with our small children. I chose a bay side hotel so that we wouldn't have to worry about waves while my children played in the water, and the bay water was perfectly calm all day long. We showed up at noon (check-in isn't until 4:00), and expected to wait a few hours before we could get to our room, but they checked us in right away. The pool was clean and the staff at the front desk was very helpful. I experienced a very rude Concierge on our second day, but went back later and talked to someone else who was much more pleasant. Unfortunately, we left our room horribly messy every day, but we always came back to a perfectly tidy room with clean sheets. Just to be clear, the 'refrigerator' listed on the hotel's amenities is a mini-fridge, and there is no microwave (which most hotels have these days). Also, the restaurant at the Catamaran is far too expensive for families, so plan on eating across the street at the Eggery (for breakfast or lunch), Tony Romas, or grabbing a pizza to go at Oceanside Pizza. There are no activities here, but the beach makes up for it, if that's what your kids like to do. I was disappointed that the use of paddleboats and kayaks were $17 extra per hour, though. For nearly $300 a night, I expected that to be included, but that was my own issue. Guests at the hotel are supposed to be able to ride the Bahia Belle ferry boat for free, but it was rented out every day for business conferences. Overall, a hassle-free and a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but.....”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterChris
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms over the Easter period.My daughter and her friend arrived a day ealier but insisted on a change of rooms. Their original room overlooked a concrete multistore car park in the tower block.By the time my husband and I checked in the rooms had been changed and we were allocated rooms on the other side of the tower block facing the gardens.The rooms were huge but very very dated.They both had a tiny kitchen which has not been altered since 1960! The hotel is in such a great location but it really does need extensive updating. The waterfall in reception takes up all the space and blocks out any light. If you can put up with the 1960's decor the hotel is fine.The rooms were very clean and staff were very helpful. You can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Squeaksy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on its one beach and the sufter dudes beach over the road. The pool is good and the exotic birds are charming for children. We had a large room with kitchenette in the tower which was spacious, clean and comfortable. My only complaint would be the charge of $13 per day for parking your car ($17 if you valet). This is a complete and utter rip off and when I commented on this the reception just shrugged and said they charge it because they know the can get away with it. Scandalous! For that reason alone they are downgraded.

Reviews.Title: “conference stay”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisLou
Reviews.Content: Our entire stay was in and around the Catamaran. The location was great, easy to get to and easy to get everywhere. The rooms, staff, food, conference rooms were great. I would come back and stay for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bait and switch !”
Reviews.Author: Cusemeister
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for a King . Not told at checkin that we were being given two twins right next to garage. Had confirmed reservation just days before by telephone. After much anguish they agreed to put us up in Tower with a King- said no thanks. Location of Hotel is great. Very helpful staff except at checkin desk- very young and obviously give same spiel to all who thought they were getting a king.

Reviews.Title: “We held our annual conference here - we were very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: junglecat64
Reviews.Content: Our trade association, Associated Cities (www.associatedcities.com), held it's annual conference at the Catamaran Resort April 23-25, 2009. Our organization consists of a bunch of entrepreneurial, pigheaded and hard-to-please business owners. Given this, it is quite remarkable how satisfied the 150 attendees were. We used the executive suite on the 13th floor for cocktails parties and meetings - the view is fantastic, day and night. You see all of Mission bay and the Pacific Ocean, too. If you want food on a budget, you will get good food within a budget. If you want fancy, expensive food, they will get you that. The banquet manager Hollis Bolar was there early, late, weekdays and weekends, and most importantly: when needed. All to make sure that things got done and that our needs were met. The front-desk staff were all great and very helpful. Need to leave ten messages for ten different guests? No problem. All the staff were great: friendly, helpful and SMART. Coming from the intellectual wasteland that is my hometown, this was refreshing for me. I didn't have to explain things twice. When reviewing properties, I always look at value. This was great value, and our kind of value. It was exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Best location but pool to crowded”
Reviews.Author: sun010
Reviews.Content: First we were given a very dark room without a fridge, which we had asked for. But without any problem we were moved to a nice room overlooking the pool. Room was quite spacious and fulfilled all our needs. There was really no privacy on the balcony since people were passing right beside you all the time. This is a nice but not in any way luxury or fancy resort. Best is the location right on Mission Beach - unbeatable. Tried to relax by the pool but it was not easy - lot of people, lot of kids... Went to the beach instead, only a few minutes away. Had the Breakfast BuffÃ© and it was ok. The last night our neighbours had a loud party, not so nice since we were leaving with an early flight.... Security knocked on their door about 01.30.

Reviews.Title: “CLASSY BUT COMFORTABLE.”
Reviews.Author: ARIZONABOY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awsome. It is located right on the beach, with lush tropical gardens and ponds thru out the grounds.There are areas for adults and areas for families.The hotel and grounds are meticulous and well kept, and the service impeccable. I know I sound like I work for them , but its true. This is Californias version of an " old money" hotel.Classy but comfortable! Don Shooter Yuma Arizona

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could start my planning all over again!”
Reviews.Author: GRMChicago
Reviews.Content: To be fair: Pro: Grounds were fantastic and well maintained.... Cons: Way over priced for location. Service was terrible. The pool was staffed only on Weekend. During the week there was no service unless you called the bar and then you waited for 30+ minutes. When we asked to talk the hotel manager (at the front desk) the young lady who said she was the front desk manager, said he wasnt avalabile. When we described the issues, she was cold and defensive, looking for an arguement. The 50 minute massage was the least impressive massage Ive had in years. This hotel has no right calling itself a "resort". It is nothing close to a resort. The room was clean but out-dated and very lack luster. The small fridge made loud noises every hour or two, the bathroom sink faucet was loose and required maintenance, the tub faucet dripped most of the time and you can not lock your sliding door to the balcony. If you plan to park a car be ready to pay daily rates and to use car spaces intended for a mini-coopers, not your average cars size.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the negatives!! This place is WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: rin81
Reviews.Content: I have to say after reading other reviews on here, I was VERY skeptical about what we might find upon check in at the Catamaran. I have to say we stayed from 04-19-09 until 04-24-09 and this was a WONDERFUL experience. I will be as detailed as possible. When arriving to the resort, the valets are great and you will go in for check in. The valets are efficient and the front desk staff are friendly. The property itself looks as if you drove right off the Pacific Highway into Hawaii. It is beautiful and also inside there are tropical plants and waterfalls. The entire property is beautifully maintained with ponds with people friendly wildlife and plants. Our original reservation placed us on the top floor of the tower. I have to say if you are booked for a tower room, that is the only thing that I would change. The views from the tower were okay, but after staying in the tower one night we asked to be moved. The tower is 12 stories high and the rooms are in general not as nice as the other rooms on the property. We were moved to a first floor garden suite. This was beautiful. The room was modern and offered a refrigerator and plasma television. Double sinks in the bathroom and a private shower room. This room was considered as the same grade as the room in the tower but was almost twice as big and ten times the quality. I was a little hesitant to stay on the main floor after reading reviews speaking of the noise of people walking past. I have to say that during our 5 nights on the main floor there was absolutely no noise what so ever. It was amazingly quiet and peaceful. One thing to think about is the parking, it is 13.00 a day to park on the property. I thought it was well worth it but I can see if you are not prepared for the extra charge where it would become a problem. There is nearby street parking but I felt much safer parking in the parking garage. Also if you happen to be lucky enough to be there for a sunday brunch, do not miss it. The price is a little hefty, at 40.00 a person, but it is well worth it. They serve prime rib and fresh seafood and also champagne until 2pm. It is truly worth each penny. The bay front is not all it is cracked up to be. Although it was nice, my husband and I chose to walk across the street to Pacific Beach almost every day instead of the beach on the bay at Catamaran. The hotel has a wonderful heated pool but I will say that if you are looking for the typical resort amenities such as pool service for drinks or even beach service you will not be happy.. On the weekend there is a server in the pool area but ONLY during the weekend. Also there is never anyone serving drinks on the beach. This could be a deal breaker for some people but we were not very bothered by it since everything else was so nice. The concierge is wonderful and will offer suggestions and vip coupons and free valet slips to nearby restaurants when requested. The resort has a very safe feel to it and that means a lot. Each room has a private safe and that makes everything more comfortable when traveling. The housekeeping staff is honest and hardworking. I left products in our first room on accident and housekeeping immediately returned them to me in my new room, I have to say I have stayed at 5 star resorts where my things were "lost" but not at the Catamaran. I have to say that there are many negative reviews on here but this place must have made major improvements prior to our stay. We had a great time and we will be back anytime we are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service but rooms need a touch up”
Reviews.Author: Sushar
Reviews.Content: We made last-minute reservations for this hotel and got a Bay View Studio for around $250/-. I read the online reviews after I made the booking and started getting concerned about the condition of the rooms. I called their reservation line and voiced these concerns and the agent told me that people often misconstrued the Polynesian theme of their resort/ rooms as being outdated and assured me that we would find the accomodations more than satisfactory. That convinced me to go forward with our stay and we had a good experience overall with some caveats. Details below: Positives: 1) Great view of Mission bay/ beach with view of the fireworks at Seaworld from our Bay view studio's balcony. 2) Great location close to Mission & Pacific Beaches and around 10 min drive to Seaworld. 3) Good resort overall with well-maintained grounds. 4) Friendly and courteous staff. Negatives (Major): 1) Very bad smell in the Living Room shoes closet. Hits you hard when you enter the room from outside. Is ok once you go past the closet. 2) Kitchen not well-stocked with utensils & cleaning supplies. Negatives (Minor): 1) Bathroom shower head a little bit low which makes it inconvenient for people more than 5' 10'' tall to take a shower. 2) Shower water a little lukewarm in the mornings. 3) Small rooms with small beds. A little uncomfortable if you have more adults than children in your group. 4) Old carpets in rooms and corridors. Overall this resort would be a great place to stay if they spend some money to get the rooms updated as stated by other reviewers. Other than that this is not a bad place to stay if you don't have to shell out over $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: McFarrigle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent grounds. Tropical oasis with talking parrots, big lobby waterfall and great pool area. Room was spacious, well laid out and quiet. Front desk was friendly and helpful. The restaurant, while a little pricey, had a great breakfast outside facing the beach. Our only complaint was that there was no drink service in the pool area the first day of our two day stay, so we had to walk across the property to order drinks from an overwhelmed bartender who was also serving the patio of the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: COtraveler09
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely ffriendly. Courteous, polite, helpful. Grounds are nice. Rooms a little aged, but location and staff more than makes up for it. Great place to stay with a family. My four year old son loved the pool, the hottub and the video arcade. And, the games are free in the arcade, which is a very nice touch. The valet was probably the most helpful hotel employee I have encountered in years. He really made the stay special for me and my son.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Catamaran Resort”
Reviews.Author: jkaeea6
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, friendly staff, great location. Would definitely stay here again. Wildlife was fun to watch. Ducks, geese, fish, and the talking parrots. Landscaping makes the whole place feel very peaceful. Pool was nice. Arcade was great for the kids. Restaurant was good-recommend breakfast over dinner. Breakfast was very good and reasonably priced. Dinner was good, but spendy. Rooms were average, but fine. When I booked the room, I asked for a garden room, which I assumed would be in one of the 2 story buildings. We were given a room on the first floor of the tower , which had a patio and would have been fine, except for the constant noise of people coming and going at all hours, late night and early morning. After 2 nights of no sleep, we requested a new room, and were give a new room the next day. The new room was quiet and overlooked one of the ponds-very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Convenient Location, but customer service complaint”
Reviews.Author: MtlFam
Reviews.Content: Great convenient beautiful location. Good value! Views of Mission Bay, Pacific Ocean, Downtown, Coronado Bridge etc.. just awesome! As others have said rooms could use some updating. We had beautiful large LCD TV nice bedding adequate furniture, Even . Kitchen in room is very nice to have, appliances worked well, but rather old. We checked in on Saturday evening for an 8 night stay. On Tuesday housekeeping left 2 bottles of water in the room. After an hour they came back to place a sign on them with a price of almost $6.00. We deemed this deceptive. While we are savvy enough to know that this practice happens at many hotels, we had 3 adults and many other groceries in the room. By this time a visitor in our room had opened the bottle and started drinking the water. When I complained that this was deceptive. They refused to take my complaint, give me a voice mail, or a complaint form. They said the only person who could hear the complaint was the manager who would be back Monday. This would have been too difficult to pursue from Montreal, but left me feeling ripped off for $6.00. I promised the desk personnel that "Trip Advisor" would hear about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the grounds”
Reviews.Author: thedzoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short family vacations. My kids loved the grounds and the hawaiian theme. This was a gret place for kids and really close to belmont park. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were clean and big but nothing special. The service was outstanding and people were very friendly. Check out their live webcam. Real Close to sea world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, needs a remodel”
Reviews.Author: weezerific
Reviews.Content: My father-in-law came to visit us, and got a good rate for the Catamaran, so this review is actually about his experience there. First of all, the positives...This hotel is on a nice part of Mission Bay, right on the sand, with GORGEOUS views from the tower of the bay and the ocean. Although it is in PB/Mission Beach, which looks a little rough around the edges, it really is a good area for an affordable vacation. The grounds, as others have mentioned, are lush and landscaped beautifully, along with the pool, birds, etc. The lobby is also extremely nice, as is the restaurant and the patio area by the bay. All of the grounds and the main building seem to fit the $180/night room rates. Now, for the problems== the rooms. This has been mentioned by other reviewers, but I want to stress that this isn't just picky people who don't like the decorating...these rooms need to be remodeled! My father-in-law's first room was a "garden view" ground-floor room, which had alot of problems. Although the room was clean, it hadn't been kept up very well, and the bathroom smelled strongly of mildew. Then one morning he noticed a large ant infestation coming from the bathroom and taking over his room. Now, I can't blame the hotel too much for this, because it rained a ton and everybody gets ants when this happens, but there were so many holes he had ants coming in 3 different places. When he told the front desk, they said they would take care of it, and then later told him they would put him in a new room because the ant problem was too big for their maintenance man to handle (!!). The front desk lady was very nice and moved him to a Tower Studio room, which was a major upgrade. The view from the porch up there was awesome. The problem was, that room was also in bad shape. The handle came off the shower, the curtains were destroyed, one of the chairs in the room was broken, and there was a huge gap in the wall around the a/c that he ended up plugging with a towel to keep the wind out! For a room that is upwards of $250/night, this was not good quality! All in all, I think there are plenty of other resorts/hotels in the area that offer alot more for the price..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort and location”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl029
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights at the Catamaran before going on a cruise to the Mexican Riviera. We were overjoyed that we were upgraded to a Penthouse Suite. It was absolutely fantastic and was such a great way to start out our vacation. I have nothing but praise for this resort. Staff were very friendly and the grounds were absolutely beautiful. We ordered room service our last morning and the food was delicious and served promptly. We also visited Sea World which is very close to this resort. I would definitely recommend this resort and thank them for the wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “In Serious need of a refuirbishment”
Reviews.Author: Chris117
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel as part of a tour down the California coast and upon arrival realised we had made a big mistake. We had booked a king bedroom but allocated a queen room on arrival due to limited availability at the hotel and informed by reception that as we had booked with a travel agent and got a cheap rate they could not guarantee a king room. After much deliberation with the Duty manager they managed to allocate us a king room in the tower with a view of the bay - why this had this not been offered in the first place? The rooms are in serious need of a refurbishment and a throwback to the 1980â€™s. I certainly wouldnâ€™t recommend if youâ€™re looking for somewhere modern and within close proximity to San Diego city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: jwthere4u
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Catamaran Resort hotel. My husband and I were driving down to San Diego to see a football game so we only needed a place to spend one night. I was looking to find someplace conveniently located, but was not too expensive. The Catamaran was a perfect find. I found a great AAA price for a King bed Garden room, called the hotel directly and booked it. When they confirmed my reservation via email, they had already upgraded our room to a Bay View Tower room, which we really appreciated, since it was also a romantic get away for us. I was asked what time I wanted to check in and when I said noon, they said no problem. The grounds are beautiful, as other reviewers have stated, with ducks, parrots, koi ponds, and black swans. It is located just across the street from the Mission Beach boardwalk with all of its restaurants, and right on the Bay, which is more private. The hotel has beach chairs with umbrellas right on the bay beach. There were boats and other water toys to rent. We did not take the river cruise or eat at the restaurants. We had dinner in Old Town and it was not far at all from the hotel. Our bedroom had a nice balcony which overlooked the bay and had a side view of the ocean. It had two chairs, a small table and a foot stool outside. The King bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows. There was a flat screen TV in the room. We had a coffee maker but no fridge in our room. There was a desk and a comfy chair. We noticed the alarm clock had an IPOD docking station which we liked. The bathroom was nice-although not very big. There were nice toiletries and lots of towels. The furnishings may not have been new, but we found the room very comfortable. We could not hear any noise from the other rooms. We were overlooking the River cruise dock and there was some noise from the passengers getting off and on, but nothing that bothered us. We appreciated that the check out time is noon. That's ample time to get up, go over to Mission Beach and eat breakfast, then return and walk around the grounds for a little while. We have stayed at other locations in San Diego: the Westin and Capri by the Sea, but for the price, location, and resort offerings, we will return to the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again.”
Reviews.Author: NJResident32
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 2 yr old daughter statyed at the resort from Oct 12 until the 16th. Overall is was a very good experience. The staff were very friendly. There were just a few small negatives from our stay. The fact they charge for parking is really annoying. We only parked in their lot a day or two before we started parking around the corner from the resort for free on a residential street. It was worth saving $13.00 a day. And one thing I didn't understand was that they only put out like 8 beach chairs on the beach, and when we asked for more, they said it was first come first serve. Seemed really ridiculous considering the size of the resort, and the money we paid. Overall, the resort was in a great location. They gave us pamphlet with directions to the local attractions like Sea World (which is only like 10 minutes away). And the path by the beach lead us to a great little playground for my daughter to play. The views from the tower bay side were great. We loved that we could just walk out our door and go across the street to eat, or walk along the beach. My daughter especially liked the ducks, birds, and koi fish pond at the resort. We got a tower suite with a kitchen and separate living room, so that was great with a 2 yr old. Overall we enjoyed the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, however hotel bedrooms need complete revamp.”
Reviews.Author: courtmac62
Reviews.Content: Didn't like the room when we checked in. 3rd floor of the Tower overlooking the multistorey hotel carpark. We pre paid â‚¬1500(yes euros) for 6 nights and felt it represented poor value. We upgraded for $75 dollars per night to a Bayside 1 bedroom apartment that had no dining facilities other than a coffee maker, sink and fridge, oh yes there were the 2 mugs of course. Staff were nice, housekeeping good. Food at Morays (bar/restaurant in the resort) was better value than expected and very tasty, and the waitress was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, especially in a tower room.”
Reviews.Author: Peterphan
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a long weekend at The Catamaran the weekend of 09/18-22/08. The hotel upgraded our tower room from a Garden view to Bay View for free. The room was nice and provided a great place to retreat to everyday and truly relax after venturing out. A high floor room in the hotel is nice since it keeps you above the noise of the ducks and birds (and people) on the grounds below. Sea World fireworks were done for the season while we were there but there was a boat race this same weekend and we got to see the fireworks for that from the balcony of our room. The hotel grounds appeared to be the nicest part of the immediate area. We had a rental car and it was nice to be able to drive places (Point Loma, San Diego Zoo, Sea World, etc). Walking from the hotel around Pacific Beach at night was not as nice as we had hoped it would be. We didn't eat at the restaraunt at the hotel, and in hindsight, should have since it appeared more upscale (and low-key) than the places we went to in Pacific Beach. We opted for the self parking for $13/day and were able to get a low spot in the parking garage every day. Complimentary tickets to the Bahia Belle cruise were nice as well. The first adult cruse (10PM) where you have to be 21+ to board was packed with a group from a wedding at the hotel so we waited and just went on the next one at 11 which wasn't as crowded. Concierge was very helpful when giving us directions to the nearest mall so we could purchase a wedding gift. Overall, the Catamaran was a great place for us to stay and we would definately stay there again anytime we are in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LAStravel
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for a weekend while we went to a wedding. The location is great- it is close to everything (short drive to Balboa park and the zoo, minutes from Sea world and Old Town). The lobby is beautiful. The service and check in was great. The woman at the front desk was very knowledgeable and friendly. We called ahead and asked if we could check in early because we were flying in the day of the wedding and needed to get ready and they had the room ready as soon as we got there, and they gave us a free upgrade with an amazing view of the beach. We ate at one of the hotel restaurants the Atoll and the food was good and you get to sit outside with a view of the beach. The pool was nice, and the hotel grounds are beautiful (the parrots and koi ponds are great). You can rent kayaks, boats and paddle boats right on their beach and you can also rent segways and bikes to ride along the path by the beach. From the hotel you can walk to many restaurants and there is a great breakfast place nearby called the Mission- very yummy, but get there early because it gets crowded. The hotel has it's own parking garage and it was $13 per night. The beds were comfy and the room had a very large flat screen TV and we loved our balcony with the view of the bay. We really enjoyed our stay and definitely plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort & Spa, Close to Mission/Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: josuejulie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from spending the weekend at the beautiful Catamaran resort hotel and spa. As we arrived we were surprised to see how beautiful it was as we entered the lobby we were greeted with a beautiful waterfall, flowers, and a pond with fish. The people were extremely friendly as they explained that they had upgraded our room. As we walked down the path to find our room which was located in the tower, we enjoyed the beauful flora and fauna that surrounded us. They even had two parrots that were talking, along with more ponds with fish and ducks. The pool has a really nice area with an oversized hot tub and really nice lounge chairs. Again the area is very beautiful and has an arcade and a pool bar. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant but supposedly the food is very good, especially on Sunday when they have a Sunday Champagne brunch that costs about $40 a person, where you can sit outside above the beach which is on the bay. The hotel is in a perfect location because it sits on the bay where they have a whole bunch of things you can rent such as bikes to ocean toys and the water is a lot calmer with a more private beach. The Catamaran is located about 2 blocks away from Mission/Pacific Beach so it is perfect whether you want to go down to the hotel beach or walk over to the main Beach and surf or enjoy one of the restaurants. It also worked great for walking a few blocks down to the clubs at Pacific Beach at night. Our room itself was really nice and spacious with a small kitchen, and couch and had a nice TV. Overall we were extremely impressed and loved our stay at the Catamaran and we can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not so nice”
Reviews.Author: allwaysanangel
Reviews.Content: I too, like most reviewers, was a little nervous to stay here after reading all the reviews. Upon arrival, I was impressed with the lobby of the hotel. As soon as you walk in, you are greeted with a beautiful waterfall, pond, fish.. its so nice. We had a smooth check in.. got to our room, and again was impressed as I thought I was getting a standard king bed room. We had a suite with a couch, dining room table, full kitchen, and the bed was in a bedroom with a nice closet and bathroom. The kitchen was obviously outdated.. the applicances were 20+ years old.. good thing we were only staying for 2 nights. If I had to use this kitchen to prepare meals I would have been upset! Anyways, the bed was uncomfortable, the bedding was heavy and itchy, and the AC was in the living room, so it took HOURS of blasing the air on high to cool the bedroom. Most people complain about not being able to get hot water.. we however, could not get cold water for brushing our teeth or drinking. The floors and walls of the bathroom were a little dirty and I found a few small spiders on the floor. We were on the 4th floor in the tower so only had a partial view of the bay, but it was still something to look at. The restaurant was great.. very very pricey, but the food was awesome.. especially the breakfast buffet. Overall, this is a nice joint. I would probably not stay again as it was very expensive. If they did a little cleaing and remodeling, this place would be 5 star, for sure! :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty neat spot”
Reviews.Author: KatieKatz
Reviews.Content: What a location! Mission Bay on one side, Mission Beach on the other. We've tried other Mission Bay hotels and this location is the best. The hotel has a nifty bar with a built-in aquarium, but we were driven away by the dated "piano bar" entertainment. The trio meant well, but they should retire. Fun activities: we got free tickets on the Bahia Belle cocktail cruise departing every night at 10 with an outstanding two-person band. At night the hotel puts on a brief fireworks show on the bay. And what looks like a great luau on Friday (we didn't attend). Nice beach chair/towel service on the beach (bay side). For an older hotel that gets lots of traffic, the common areas were in decent shape. Lots of ducks and goldfish, two black swans, tropical birds on display. Not so great: Our "garden" room was in the multi-story tower, with a view of the laundry facilities and parking garage. Great: The mattress on our king-size bed was firm; the sheets of high quality. The room A/C unit was noisy, but it worked. The desk and free wi-fi allowed us to get in a day's work. Best thing about this room: a spotless, well-lit bathroom! So rare, so appreciated. The large white tiles are beautifully grouted and sealed; no dirt or sticky spots.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: krissyb111
Reviews.Content: My Mexican honeymoon was canceled at the last minute, due to the tropical storms! My husband and I wanted a relaxing beachy vacation, so we decided (within one day) to go to San Diego - guaranteed good weather, beaches, things to do during the day and night! We've been to LA and San Francisco together, and knew we liked Cali. Everyone loves San Diego, right? We contacted a friend who lives in Ocean Beach, and he suggested the Catamaran. We went online and read the reviews briefly, and decided to go....it was such a last minute trip that many hotels were sold out for Labor Day weekend...Catamaran was not. My husband contacted the hotel directly, and they gave us a fantastic rate ($143 for weekday nights, $229 weekends) which we were quite surprised to pay...booking online was considerably more money. We arrived and were wowed by the lobby and gardens...our room was not ready, so we sat behind the resort on the Mission Bay beach and relaxed. Pool was nice, and there is a pool bar, but it was filled with kids. A little noisy. We discovered that there is a ban on alcohol on all Pacific Beach (PB) beaches, including resort property beaches....we aren't alcoholics, but had been thinking about sipping drinks beachside ever since the 4 hour plane ride started...so we were disappointed. We were told by hotel officials and some servers/bartenders in the area that if you are caught drinking on the beach, you'll be ticketed on the spot. We didn't try it. We did pay $12 dollars each to rent a cheap sand chair, which seemed ridiculous...but they don't comb the beaches for seaweed, etc. in PB, so we were glad we had a chair. On Mission Bay, I suggest renting a paddle boat or kayak - the water is beautiful and very calm...so relaxing! When our room was ready, we were so disappointed. Our "partial ocean and bay view" room in the tower (26th floor - two from the top) had a view of a huge parking lot....if you strained your head over the balcony, you could see the ocean on one side and the bay on the other...our room was terribly dated - big mirrored closet door that didn't slide well at all, old carpet and sliding glass door, cheap plastic furniture on the balcony, TINY bathroom (not lying - smaller than any NYC hotel we've stayed in!) and tired furniture/linens. MUCH in need of updating. You can tell that the hotel is trying to update somewhat....there was a flat-screen TV in the room, an iPod dock, cute silver bath accessories...but the shower!!! The head was situated so low on the wall that it was comical. I'm 5'7 and it was even with my neck....my 6'5 husband literally showered on his knees!!! Shower really needed updating in general - it was old and dingy....it was clean but just tired, like the room. We were trying to make the best of our situation, so we asked for a room upgrade to the bay view side of the tower- this has a much better view if you're on the 6th floor or above....but exact same room. They moved us and also comped our valet parking for the week, which was great. We knew we had a ridiculously cheap rate, so we kept that in mind. The Catamaran is NOT luxury...the rooms that were right on the bay seemed a lot better (two story buildings) for location, but we were told by the front desk that the rooms in those buildings were not updated like the tower rooms supposedly were. Those are the rooms you see pictured on the website. After one night in the area, we realized that you get what you pay for...if you stay here, you are definitely not in San Diego - you're in "PB" as the locals call it...Pacific Beach. It is quiet and reminds me of a LA's Hermosa Beach or a Florida gulf-coast town...the surfers are everywhere, and you definitely don't feel like you're in a very touristy area...very low key. Great restaurants. Go to Gringos (Mexican restaurant) just north of the resort, about a 5-10 min. walk. It's awesome!!! We also liked "World Famous" right on the beach, for breakfast and dinner...it is a little older, but food is great. We had a great lunch at the "Pacific Beach Alehouse" - super food and awesome servers!! I would not waste your $ at the hotel's breakfast buffet - it's WAY overpriced for what it is!!! Just ok food. After two nights, we decided to go to a different hotel that was closer to San Diego. We stayed at the Coronado Marriott Resort and Spa on Coronado Island...it was beautiful. Coronado is just lovely, and we had fun at the Hotel Del, on the beaches, and at the fantastic restaurants that overlooked downtown San Diego. We took water taxis to the city at night, saw a Padres game, and sat at the luxurious pool where servers brought us lunch and drinks to our chairs! It's more expensive, but I think it's completely worth it. There were a lot of families there, too, as well as couples like us. When the hotel heard it was our honeymoon, they upgraded our room type and left champagne and choc-covered strawberries in our room!!! Nice touch. Bottom line - stay on Coronado or downtown SD - I would never stay at the Catamaran again - not until they upgrade the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a quiet spot”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcGonagall
Reviews.Content: I was in doubt as whether to give 3 or 4 stars to this hotel, because it excels in some points but may use some renovation. Arrival: the lobby is marvelous. With the cascade, foliage and lake, really nice. Coi fishes require a lot of care, so it gives you a measure of how well it has to be maintained in order for the fishes to grow, and they seemed in good shape. The girls at the reception and all other services were extremely friendly and all of our small issues were well attended. A+ Room: The room was facing the garden, basically it faced a palm tree but it was ok, it provided good shade and kept the place cooler. All amenities were available in the room. Bathroom was ok. But we had to move some furniture (my little one tends to fall from the bed so we always need to create some barriers around his side of the bed) and we noticed that behind furniture the vacuum cleaner had not been used in quite a while. Daily cleaning was done, but from time to time you have to dust behind the beds too!! That took some points off. Also rooms start being worn out a bit, although this is not a big issue in my opinion. Premises: very nice. We did not use the pool as kids liked the beach (see previous review for details), it was clean and calm (at least in the morning). Overall it is all well kept and clean. We had breakfast at the restaurant and it was fine. We were away most of the day so you may want to refer to other reviews for local activities. I have to add that it is well located, in 15 minutes (driving) you can reach almost anything, which was the main reason of picking this hotel instead of the Coronado Loews. We did not regret the choice. It is placed in a friendly neighborhood too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location....needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Steph1452000
Reviews.Content: Loved the location..we stayed in a ground floor room with direct access to the beach. Lovely grounds with lush plantlife and lots of birds and ducks. It was also very quiet. Didn't love the restaurant.......slow service and very pricey, luckily there is a lot of great food within walking distance. The only real downer was how our room looked, very outdated and shabby and not worth $400 plus dollars a night. It also had what we think was black mold on the air vents and that is really scary because mold can be very dangerous to your health. I actually came down with pneumonia(in July!!!) two weeks later...coincidence or not? The room really could use a thorough cleaning top to bottom. Overall, we had a nice time but wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad -Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Jake2000
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one week stay at the Catamaran. The loaction is good, grounds are very well maintained but the rooms are in need of considerable updating. We booked a studio as we wanted a kitchen with appliances in order to prepare breakfasts and some lunches. The original room they provided was nothing like the picture we saw on their web site (it was much smaller with no sitting area and pull out sofa) so we asked for a room change. The staff was very accomodating and promptly gave us a larger room. The room itself was dated but relatively clean (although there was some mold in the bathtub). The kitchen appliances are at least 20 years old and are not in the greatest condition. This is a good family spot but I would not recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway. To be fair, this is a 3 star hotel and not the Del Coronado, but unless you get a discounted price off of their posted rates, you will be overpaying for what you get. Overall ratings: Staff: A Accomodations: C- Cleanliness (rooms): C- Beach Area: A

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: rolli
Reviews.Content: Nice place!... better than I expected. For a 3 star hotel it was great! Location was good. Lots to do and see. The hotel it self had a tropical feel to it. With ducks and ponds all around and parrots to look at. Mission beach is right there. It's a nice, calm, peaceful beach... perfect for little kids. There also is the pacific ocean about a 2 block walk from the hotel.. big waves there. The kids walked it just fine and we were able to find a nice restaurant overlooking the ocean. People are always walking around there... it was fun to people watch. The hotel's free arcarde was a hit with the kids and they enjoyed the pool. The pool is nothing special, but they still had a good time in it. We had our morning breakfast at Atoll's at the hotel. It was really good and prices weren't too bad for hotel eating! The restuarant staff could have been friendlier; all other hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room was nice and spacious with a mini frig in the room. Although the room had been updated, the tub was not. It was looking worn and full of scratches, probably from sand and sea shells from the beach. The free Bahia ferry ride the hotel has to offer was a nice touch. We did the last family trip out and was able to enjoy fireworks from seawold on the bay. It gave us something to do and it was free! Next time we will rent bikes to ride around. They have bike rental available at the hotel and many people do this. We will come again. It's a nice place for a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved everything about the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: DennyCDublin
Reviews.Content: I drove myself absolutely demented from reading all the trip advisor reviews on this hotel and almost changed my booking as a result. Thank God i didn't! I loved everything about this hotel, the location, the atmosphere, the staff, the food. We (myself and my husband) were in the tower building on the 9th floor facing Mission Bay- view was fabulous!! I would highly recommend these rooms if you can get the view of the Bay. The hotel room decor was a little dated but clean and spacious with a lovely balcony. I would give up a well decorated room any day for a hotel that's buzzing and the Catamaran definietly had a great buzz about the place. The pool area was lovely, can be busy but again that just added to the fun atmosphere of the place. I really wouldn't let any of the bad reviews put you off this place, it's perfect for families or couples. We travelled all around San Diego and for a beach holiday in an upbeat area with lots to do, loads of places to eat and good night life, this is the perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not special for the price”
Reviews.Author: Leest
Reviews.Content: Great location. Lot of family fun in San Diego! Sheets were clean and, view was good. The parrots were nice. Personel could give the client more attention for that price. One example: during dinner I had to wait and eventually walk to the kitchen to get a fork to eat my expensive main course. etc. Check out the Ocean side for the sun set and the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: taysfa
Reviews.Content: We booked this place for my husband and I and I have to say I was a bit worried from all the negative reviews. However, we found the staff very friendly. Our room was not ready when we arrived so they upgraded us if we were able to wait 1 hour to go into our room. We were put in the tower on the 11th floor. It had a great view and the room was very nice and clean. The beds were hard, but they were not as bad a past reviews mentioned. The grounds were kept up nice. We did not go to the pool becuase there were a lot of children in it and we wanted to enjoy the beach. This is a old hotel and you can tell. The lobby had a horrible smell and it was a bit musty throughout the hotel. I found that it was the perfect location though. All we had to do was walk across the street to get to Mission Beach. We did not even need the rental car we got. Plenty of great restaurants were in walking distance to us. I enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful oasis!”
Reviews.Author: sexymexi
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at the Catamaran for our family vacation in the San Diego area. We chose the hotel because we wanted to be close to the beaches and not in downtown SD. The location was perfect! Right across the street from the beach and near lots of restaurants and shopping. There is a bit of a party atmosphere in the area (especially on the beach) but the Catamaran seems worlds away from it. The grounds are beautiful and the staff is friendly. At check in they wanted to give us a room on the ground floor in the tower, which we didn't want. I told them I would prefer a room on the second floor in one of the bungalows, which they were happy to give us. It did require a bit of a wait though, so we went down to Mission Bay. There are lots of water toys to rent, and the beach area was almost deserted. Nice for small children to splash in, but we preferred the ocean. Our room was clean and large enough for our family of 4. The bar area with refrigerator was perfect for our snacks. The balcony overlooked a pond with ducks, perfect for sitting outside with our morning coffee. Our only complaint with the room is that the mattresses were old and the sheets seemed too small for the beds and were usually completely undone by morning. The pool area was great. The pool seemed a bit small for the size of the hotel, but it never seemed crowded. My son loved the free game room, which is right off the pool. We only ate one meal at the hotel, breakfast. It was fine, nothing spectacular, with good service. We skipped the luau that is offered on Friday nights, but we did venture down to the cafe off the lawn area where the luau was held and enjoyed the show from there while having coffee and dessert. Tips Don't miss the bird show or a ride on the paddle wheeler. Take the last family cruise of the day at 9:00 and you'll see the fireworks from Sea World right over your heads. Rent the bikes from the hotel and take the path around Mission Bay. Its less crowded than the boardwalk on the beach and takes you through some nice parks. Great place, great location. Easy in and out to Sea World, the interstate, downtown SD and La Jolla. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “okay stay”
Reviews.Author: TracyCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of June . The hotel was family friendly. I liked the free Hawaiin show at night and the free arcade for the kids. The grounds were well maintained and had a tropical feel. The hotel seems like it tries hard to be a resort, but something is lacking. The pool is small and the bay is boring. The rooms are older and spacious. They, too, appear clean and well maintained. We found it odd that when we walked into our room for the first time a cell phone was lying on the floor. Didn't housekeeping notice that, when they cleaned the room? We walked down and turned it into the front desk. None of the soda machines that we tried to use were in working order, during the three days we were there. The Pacific Ocean is within walking distance, however, the area looked very rundown and with lots of locals drinking along the beach boardwalk. I am from Connecticut and it was my first time in San Diego. I don't think I would ever return to this hotel, but I might recommend this hotel to families with children who were visiting Sea World, if the price was reasonable ( we paid $159 for the first two nights and $199 for the last night of our stay ,plus a parking fee). Looking back, I wish we only stayed only two nights. If I ever returned to San Diego, I would probably stay in La Jolla. Not much to do there, but the area and the beach are beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous fun at the Catamaran!!”
Reviews.Author: MJgolfer
Reviews.Content: I was delegated to plan a family reunion for 16 people and decided upon the Catamaran Hotel in San Diego after visiting other sites. Of course, as the event grew nearer,some of the negative reviews concerned me. You needn't worry. From the location of the rooms(we were on the upper tower floors where one could see the Bay and the ocean, and impeccable service,(thank you to Rosanna in catering and her fabulous staff), to the front desk and the housekeepers,and the beach crew, we were(all 16 if you can beleieve it), extremely satisfied. We decided this is where we will meet as a family every summer. In fact my sister, who has stayed in very high end resorts in Newport and Laguna beach, stated that the service surpassed those other resorts. I also want to commend the manager at World Famous restaurant(Daniel) for being so accomodating. Thanks again to the Catamaran for helping us make this trip a real "memory maker!" Michelle J.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: michealjean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from 27th June to 5th July 2008 on the 10th floor of the Tower Block. The room was clean, large and had a kitchenette containing fridge freezer, microwave, coffee machine, saucepans, sink, crockery and cutlery. The view over Mission Bay towards downtown San Diego was wonderful. Yes paying for the parking was a bit tough but the location of the hotel was very good. Toes in the warm bay water or just across the street onto the beach and into the cold water of the sea. Definately a family hotel and everyone seemed very nice. The service in the restaurant was slow but with so many eating places around you didn't need to eat there. We were there on 4th July and the fireworks were very special. However what annoyed us was that the hotel insisted on issuing 'bracelets' for the hotel residents to wear so that we could 'access all areas of the hotel' however they did not enforce the wearing of them and subsequently anybody could have walked into the hotel from the beach. They also had a bar-b-q that evening and again the wearing of a different colour bracelet to signal that we had paid to eat from the buffet. However again it was not enforced and people did walk in off the beach, help themselves to food and then walk away!!! Despite this we will consider staying there again, simply for the position and the views.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a resort”
Reviews.Author: travelerforfun49
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by the recent comments I read about the Catamaran. We stayed for 2 nights in July and had a great time. The rooms were a little dated, but the furniture was ornate wood and the bed was comfortable. We paid a pretty hefty room rate for a ground floor bay front room, but it was a great location and the resort had so much to do that we felt like we almost got our money's worth. We loved stepping right out to the bay and the fact that the ocean was only a couple of blocks away. There are people walking by the resort all the time because of it's location on a sidewalk around the bay, but we had no problems with anyone. We loved the birds at the hotel and the grounds were beautiful. The Bahia Belle was fun to go on and we saw Sea World fireworks both nights. The torch lighting ceremony was cool and the resort always had something going on to keep us entertained. It felt like a tropical paradise. We have already been recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: iamjawd
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room at the Catamaran for 4 nights and we liked it so much we extended a night. Our room was the "Studio" room with a garden view. We were on the second floor facing a beautiful tropical garden and enjoyed watching the ducks and ducklings from our balcony. After reading another reviewers tip we requested to be on the side of the building that does not face the parking structure and the hotel was able to accommodate that request. The hotel has a lot of little extras on the property that the kids really liked including a free video arcade with newer games, mad science program and the exotic bird show was fantastic. You can ride the Bahia Bell for free and we loved the 9:00 cruise. It parked in the middle of the bay so we could enjoy the fireworks from Sea World. The beach in front of the hotel is a great place to play in the sand and down the way a bit there is a nice playground and beach to play on. The kids loved playing in the tree in the grass area just above the beach of the Catamaran and the Polynesian entertainment (hula dancers and torch spinner) was a nightly treat for us. This hotel really had a lot to offer not to mention the awesome location! Just 2 blocks from the beach and the best Lobster Bisque ever (little restaurant in Pacific Beach called World Famous). Sea World was just around the way... We stayed Sunday-Friday and the hotel was consistently quiet from 11pm - 6 am... all other hours plan on some noise coming from either the ducks, other rooms, Sea World firework show or other guests walking the grounds. It was not excessive but if you are a light sleeper with a goal of sleeping in... that probably wont happen. The kids and hubby slept right through all of it though. The only thing that was bad was having to pay to park in the hotels parking structure... just seems silly to me. I also wish the two beds were queens and a little less firm. Also the customer service here was way above average... This stay was way better than we expected!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelandgo
Reviews.Content: All I'm going to say to my fellow Tripadvisors is this: stay somewhere else. After a wonderful two week trip with family touring California and Hawaii on the Big Island, we had the most horrible room for what they call a first floor bayfront suite. We are sick because of the money we paid out for two suites. If you like the smell of mold and urine and no airconditioning in the "bedroom" than this is your place. It's very old and they are trying to disguise the rooms with little upgrades i.e. coffee pot, flat screen t.v. but little else. Unfortunately, I used tripadvisor comments some time ago to book this place for our grandchildren. People saying "great for the kids" and on the bay and "pool is great "and a half block from beach and on & on. This is one time it misfired for me on tripadvisor and I love tripadvisor. Also, the area wasn't so great at least at night. Alot of strange people walking the streets and also at the hotel! I ended up checking out only after one night (a very expensive night) and went to Lowes on Coronado, which was great and half the price of the "bayfront first floor suite". We travel quite alot and I really regret booking this place. So be warned.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: martin1982
Reviews.Content: stayed at the catamaran for 1 night as part of our honeymoon. Stayed in the a tower suite with nice views over the bay. Large rooms with lounge and kitchenand two balconies, Flat screen tv`s in the room also.The bed was very firm and not to my liking. Decor of the room was average and could do with a refurb.The gardens were very impressive.We went to the restaurant for breakfast and were promptly seated,but we then waited 20 minutes for the staff to come and take our order,but nobody came ,so we got up and went elsewhere. free internet access and bahia bay boat ride were good. probably would not stay here again though for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a makover, but very kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Azabu2000
Reviews.Content: Searched high and low for a hotel in San Diego and decided on the Catamaran, due to it's location and the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were promptly and courteously checked in and given a room in the Tower on the 12th floor. The room was right next to the elevator, which I thought would be a problem, but as long as we kept the closet door and bathroom door closed, the noise was minimal. Beware though that the room next to the elevator tends to shake a bit. The room was a bit shabby. We had just come from The Resort At Squaw Creek, where the rooms are pretty amazing, so to walk in to this room, which was large for sure, was a bit disappointing. We were given a room with a small kitchen, which was a nice bonus, but the cupboards were pretty beat up and the utensil supply was minimal. The coffee makers are very small, as are the coffee cups. The room was decorated with a pseudo Polynesian theme. The view was pretty darn amazing, and we were afforded two good size balconies with this room. I have to agree with a previous reviewers thoughts on the bed covers, as they were abnormally heavy. A huge walk in closet was nice. If they spent some dough redoing these rooms, they would be pretty amazing. We went down to visit some friends staying at Lowes Coronado and were very impressed with the conditions of the rooms down there. The resort was a great place for our two kids, ages 7 and 11. The arcade room, where all the games are free (much to dad's delight) was a great place for them to go hang out in. The pool was nice, very well maintained. I think if we ever stayed there again, which is unlikely, we would book a room on the ground floor, maybe one that butts up to the bay. Those rooms, with their easy access to grassy areas and the bay, look to be a bit more kid friendly. The staff was always cheerful. We did not eat at the restaurant, seemed a bit stuffy. Never had a problem parking. All in all, an ok place for our first trip to San Diego. After driving around the city and exploring new neighborhoods, we think we may try Coronado next time. Mission Beach is a bit too young for us old fogies.

Reviews.Title: “kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Shi Hu
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran is definitely "kid friendly" and since we were there with a kid, the several days we spent there were OK. It must be a challange to keep a "resort" hotel in satifactory functioning condition when 2 year olds amuse themselves by opening and closing the screen door to the balcony as our grandson did. The staff does seems to stay on top of this effort. The pool and hot tub area was well-maintained, as were the grounds and the beach generally. There are "amusements" for the kids - parrots, swans and ducks. There's a paved walkway along the beach for strollers and joggers. The restaurant welcomed small kids with their Cheerios and the staff was friendly, very courteous and prompt in service. I give them high marks. Our rooms, however, were somewhat worn and dark. The bed cover was very physically heavy, ponderously so. This is not a luxury establishment, a bit shabby not chic. I thought it was rather expensive for the value but since I didn't make the reservation, I didn't compare rates. It was quite satisfactory to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: VIC57262
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, we decided to go with the Catamaran Hotel and we were very pleased with our choice. The hotel staff that we interacted with was extremely nice and helpful. When we asked where something was or located, they just did not tell you where it was, they actually took the time to physically show you. Very impressed! We had a Bay Front Suite\Balcony room. We had requested if a patio suite was available but they were all full. Our room was just the right size for the three of us. The really nice part about the room was that it overlooked the Bay and at night we could see the fireworks from Sea world. The only complaint that we had was that the air conditioner did not seem to be working. We called the front desk and within a few minutes, maintenance had fixed the problem. It was nice to have a room close to the Bay and the Ocean. Morayâ€™s Lounge had a nice aquarium behind the bar and the food was very good. We suggest the Catamaran Burger, the Buffalo Chicken Pizza and the Quesadillas. We also suggest the Sunday Buffet at the Atoll Restaurant. There were many selections to choose from. We took in the beautiful grounds and the birds. In the afternoon when we tried to take in a short nap, sometimes the birds did get to be, a bit noisy. We enjoyed the pool. However, we would suggest building another pool for the smaller children. The three of us decided that we would not rent a car for this trip. It was nice that the Hotel had a car service and would take you to and from anywhere in San Diego. They would drive you to Sea World for a $15.00 charge. When you where ready to go home, they would asked that you call them about 20 to 30 minutes prior and they would be waiting for you where they had dropped you off earlier and take you back to the Catamaran for the same amount. This saved us a lot of money from renting a car. Walking distance from the hotel where several nice eating restaurants. We would recommend Tony Romaâ€™s and the World Famous. We really enjoyed our stay at the Catamaran and would like to come back for another trip in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing retreat”
Reviews.Author: greencrvgirl
Reviews.Content: For booking through hotwire I was pleasantly surprised to be staying there and have it live up to its star rating. Some reviews didn't sound promising and I was a bit concerned. When I checked in, desk clerk assigned me a room and based on the map (no balcony, major walkway) I wasn't too pleased. I asked if there was anything else and he offered me a room in the 200 building that had a shaded garden view of the pool. I was a little concerned with the pool noise (kids really use this pool during the day) but it wasn't too bad. Staff was attentive and offered to relocate me the following day if I didn't like the room. The first night I discovered that the air conditioning didn't work and it was sweltering. I could open the sliding doors to let in air but the screen door didn't lock so there was some trepidation about security. Staff quickly attended to it the following day and the A/C was fine (although its fan is rather loud). Only criticisms other than this was there seemed to be a bit of an ant problem (but nothing that really concerned me), and the bed was a bit hard for my liking. Also paying for parking is a drag but seems to be common place nowadays. Perks: no significant neighbor noise; HDTV; free wireless internet; iHome clock that let me play and charge my iPod (I loved it so much I bought one later); water pressure was excellent; vanity was convenient and a nice touch; ROOM SERVICE was awesome and food came from Atoll restaurant which was good; on-site spa; and lush grounds with bay beach just steps away. TIPS: 1) If you are booking with hotwire, know that your room is going to be a standard garden room and that you may need to check it out to see if it meets your standards. 2) The bayview front rooms seem awesome as their porches step right onto the baywalk. If you can swing it, it seems worth the extra $. 3) Book spa treatments well in advance as they seem to book up. 4) Many attractions within 15 minutes' drive: zoo, Sea World, Balboa park, Old Town. 5) If you want to save a little $ on food, some nearby restaurants are good - I enjoyed Piccolo Mondo (within walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: GordyNic
Reviews.Content: Some mixed reviews had left me a wee bit nervous especially as this was the location we were staying longest at on our honeymoon. HOWEVER from the minute we arrived we were treated to excellent service and enjoyed every minute of our stay. Very helpful staff and a fantastic location, 1 min from the beach, shops, bars and restaurants AND 1 minute in the other direction to the bay side beach! Totally spolit for choice when comes to local restaurants. Amazing, just amazing to see so many wild birds wandering / flying around! The Catamaran is brilliant, just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: CindyHawaii
Reviews.Content: I booked our reservation at the hotel website in advance. The site said we would receive a free upgrade to a garden view studio room @ $143.00. I arrived late at night and went to my room and noticed my garden view was in fact the many storied parking garage, no garden in sight. I went back to the front desk to tell them I did not like the room and did not want to look directly into a garage that was well lit and had traffic all night long. The front desk clerk actually snickered and replied.. "Don't you like the garage view?" He suggested that I could upgrade for an additional $35.00 a night and be on a higher floor and have a bay view. I went for it because I was tired and just wanted to get it done but I felt totally set-up. The room was nothing great. It was small, very outdated and dreary. The air-conditioning was very loud but we had to use it because the sliding glass doors did not have screen door. We did have a small kitchen but there was nothing in it,. not even a toaster. The room was never serviced until very late in the afternoon and then when I tried to communicate to the maid that I just wanted towels, she did not speak a word of English. When I checked out, I again brought up the "garden view" issue and told them that I thought it was a set-up.. kind of a bait and switch. They then agreed to refund me half of the upgrade charge. I would never consider staying here again. It is way, way overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNNQNS
Reviews.Content: I spent only two days at the Cataraman with my kids and I can tell you we all had a blast. We stayed in a suite (got upgraded for free) overlooking the beach.....beautiful...... I didnt think the place was too spacious, but it was fine. Very clean, and well maintained. The walk to our room was kind of long but scenic, there were ducks wandering around and parrots. We were able to rent bikes w/ toddler chairs attached for a great rate, even went paddleboating for a small fee. I was dissapointed with the fact the room didnt have a microwave, and the beds were real small. But there were 2 plasma tv's in our suite which was great. Room service was a bit expensive as well. Water was $5.00 (vending machine on the grounds werent working that night) But waking up and looking out on the beach was wonderful. I wouldnt hesitate to go back .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: BWM&LJM
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old and I stayed for five nights over spring break. Not sure where all the negative reviews are coming from, but the Catamaran is very nice place....
