The grounds are gorgeously maintained and the location is perfect for seeing the San Diego area. Our room was in the tower and was spotless. Brand new HD tv and the beds were very comfortable. I think some of the other travelers that have written reviews need to relax and enjoy their vacations. We had no problems and found all staff members very helpful. There was plenty on dining choices along the beach. We enjoyed watching the sun go down at PB Beach Club most evenings (the people watching was great...). I definitley would stay here again if in the San Diego area. If you have an extra day to drive up the coast, do it. Awesome scenery. Laguana Beach, La Jolla Shores and the Torry Pines areas are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoClassyChick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under rated! The ambiance, floral and fauna abound! Our room was over the pool, private, and not noisey at all - during Easter! The tv was a brand new HD flat screen! Bathrooms were fine, along w/bedding and double sinks with a large counter top for our stuff (2 adults, 2 teenage girls). The grounds are absolutely beautiful - stayed at the beach on Mission Bay, spent last day at pool (there were a lot of little kids but tollerable). We loved going to Pacific Beach in the a.m. for coffee and a walk, then breakfast at The Green Flash - a favorite. The beach is full of colorful characters, surfer dudes, little restaurants, etc. Walking distance to shopping. We parked on the side street in the back. Did not visit spa - thought it was overpriced compared to Chicago! Visited Zoo (go in a.m. when the animals are hungry and not too hot - we went in the afternoon and it was a "buzz kill" as polar bears and pandas were sleeping in the heat of the afternoon and we couldn't see their faces! Saw USS MIDWAY, had lunch in Gaslight Dist., great seafood dinner in Cardiff, drove thru LaJolla. Went to Coronado, saw great hotel, view from bridge was awesome and a bit scary.

Reviews.Title: “older property but still very nice”
Reviews.Author: cuddlyelephant
Reviews.Content: this was our last stop on our honeymoon down the coast of california. Our room was in the tower, and it is an older property, however, it was still clean, comfortable and we had a lovery view of the bay. You do notice that generally, this buliding is showing its age a bit but the room itself was fine. My only real complaint was that the multi storrey car park for the hotel was quite a long way , up and down several steps from the reception area and our room and that isnt fun after a long drive and lugging a big suitcase with you ! But this is just logistics. The hotel has some really lovely features- there are lots of waterfalls, lagoons, ducks and swans, plants and garden walkways which are all nice to see. The grounds are kept up to a very high standard. we didnt feel that this area of san diego was particularly the best to stay in as it would have been better to stay at the marina/waterfront area and we also felt this was a slightley 'seedier' part of san diego, but we still felt very safe walking about and its still a nice area. the pool area is nice for relaxing in, lovely big pool and whirpool There is a tony romas restaurant just across from the hotel where we had 2 nice meals overall, a good stay here. If they update the rooms and improve the car parking facilities, it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT experience”
Reviews.Author: mariamac
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about our stay at the Catamaran after reading the reviews on this site. When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The grounds were nicely kept. We stayed in the 700 building right in front of a little pond. We were on the bottom floor and the ducks came right up to our patio window in the morning. The first time I used the shower I froze. We called the front desk and they sent a maintence man out to fix the problem - and he did. The beds are not too comfortable but overall we were happy with the room. Oh, when we arrived the safe was already locked so the hotel sent security to open it for us. When he arrived I asked if all the rooms were the same and he said they weren't. Which might account for the varying reviews of the resort. Once we had those two problems taken care of the rest of our stay was wonderful. The location is perfect. Wireless internet is great. Flatscreen tv made me feel at home. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You people are nuts who give this place bad ratings, EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: minntwins5
Reviews.Content: How can you leave a bad rating for this place? INCREDIBLE place. Just got back from the Catamaran, great place. I stayed in a Studio room on the Penthouse floor (14th floor in the Tower) Room was great, spacious, and had a nice little kitchen. Great view of the Pacific Beach area and the Ocean. The hotel is in a great location and the grounds are beautiful with birds, ducks, parrots, and fish in the ponds. The pool area is pretty large and is very nice. The hotel and the area around the Catamaran is very safe. Def worth checking this place out. I will be back. SEE MY TIP!!!!!!!! USE THE BUS! SAFE AND CHEAP! If you want to go ANYWHERE in San Diego, use the bus. It's very very safe, and very cheap - 5.00 for a day pass! If you want to go downtown San Diego, take the #8 or9 bus (stops right outside the hotel) and this will take you to old town, then get on bus #30 and that will take you downtown. Also if you want to go to the zoo take #8 to #30 then to #7- very very easy. Do not spend 50.00 on a luxury car or cab! USE THE BUS! La Jolla, Downtown or anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort A+++++”
Reviews.Author: Nordy1
Reviews.Content: This place was above our expectations. Highly recommend the stay. Wonderful for children. Very tropical feeling in a very relaxed atmosphere. Employees are above and beyond helpful and friendly. The view from the tower is beyond words can say. This is a class A place. I will be staying here now everytime I will be visiting San Diego. Bravo to the Catamaran. Thank You Chicago Family

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: Stempsko
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference at a neighboring hotel. I can't say that I would recommend this place. The beds were not comfortable, the extra blanket was dirty, and when I called the front desk to complain, they said they'd send someone up with a new blanket, but they never did. Additionally, after the concierge set us up with a towncar ride to downtown for $30, the driver charged us $35, and demanded a higher tip. I don't like feeling ripped off, and this was just the tip of the iceberg. Other than the stained blanket, the room was clean. The wireless internet works very well.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed at best”
Reviews.Author: jmk73
Reviews.Content: We didnt know what to expect when we booked our room at the Catamaran. We read through numerous reviews which were mixed at best. All in all it turned out to be a just that...mixed. Here are our pros and cons from our stay. Pros: -The location is great. Its right on the bay and the ocean is right across the street. - The grounds on the resort were very nice and well maintained. - It was a good sized room. Cons: - Our hairdryer didnt work. - The water in the shower was inconsisent at best. Going from very hot to cold in a matter of seconds! - The $13 a night parking was just outrageous cause there is more than enough parking in the area to have to charge for parking! - The TV was fuzzy on most stations. - The thing that made the worst impression on us was that our cell phone charger went missing during our stay. We are sure it was the housekeeper who had to unplug it to vacuum our room cause it was the in the only unused outlet in the room. I guess if you plug something into their outlets than they get to keep it! So if you like location and are willing to overlook some inconveniences than I would say give the Catamaran a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money!”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravlrChicago
Reviews.Content: High prices; unsafe, dirty rooms. I travel a lot and this is the first time I have been motivated to write a review for a hotel. First, the automatic sliding entry doors to the Tower seem to be constantly open. I was given a room on the ground floor next to an exit door that does not close, let alone lock (I'm a female, staying alone). There are no extra locks on the door - just the turn deadbolt. There were workers directly outside my sliding glass door around 9am. The comforter on the bed had white stains on it. The room service arrived with two knives and one spoon, no forks. In all, for the price I paid for this room, the service was shoddy, the safety suspect and the cleanliness poor.

Reviews.Title: “Hit & Miss”
Reviews.Author: chefesita
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I was worried! We booked the room at a huge discount onlineand thought "how bad could it be"? The good: -Everyone was nice and friendly -High speed wireless internet worked like a charm -Excellent room service, fast & delicious. -Garden View roomhad nice view of thelovely hotel grounds. -Birds, swans & parrots were beautiful, nice tropical landscape -Jacuzzi is large & hot! - Very close proximity to Mission & Pacific Beaches,lots of great restaurants & nightlife, the beach. -My husband is into aquariums and they have a great one at the lobby bar. The not so good: -We think it's true that this hotel banks on its location. We payed about 40% less than the usual cost for our room and still felt it was barely worth it. Great location but in need of a facelift! -The bed was not very comfy. -It'strue, no water pressure in the shower and my husband had to jump out once when the water became cold suddenly. -You have to park pretty far away and then they charge you $13 a day, and it turns out that our room keys wouldnt raise the parking arm ever, so they would just buzz anyone in and out. We could have just said we didnt have a car with us.... -We had problems withthe tv from the beginning. One day, we returned to our room to find it blaring and no matter what we couldnt turn it down, change the channel or turn it off. We called the front desk and they said theyd send someone up. 15 minutes later we finally moved the credenza out from the wall and just unplugged the sucker. They finally sent an "engineer" up who told us if it happened again to change the batteries in the remote. Geez. -The arcade is nice but needs repair, many of the games dont work. We were dissapointed that thepool table was missing several balls. - On the night we used the jacuzzi, a security guard came about 20 minutes before the pool closed and sat there watching us and waiting for us to leave, practically tapping his foot. Not very romantic. I'm not sure I reccomend this hotel. I would normally think we just had a bad experience but it seems to be the same issues others have had. We are not picky either, we have stayed in every star hotel immaginable happily.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: denisenyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catamaran from 1/31 through 2/5 for some r&r. We booked our trip through Continental vacations and got a good deal which included airfare, hotel and car. We upgraded to a tower room for an extra $35/nite and it was well worth it. We were on the Penthouse (14th) floor and had a view of both La Jolla and the ocean. The room had a king-sized bed and the entire floor had recently had the carpet replaced. It was very comfortable and the view was stunning. The grounds are lovely with ducks, parrots, tiki torches, etc. We had drinks most nights at the bar--they have a happy hour until 7pm. We were walking distance to many nice restaurants including Nick's at the Beach and two which had ocean views---World Famous (wonderful) and the Green Flash (good for breakfast). Rented bikes from a place next to the hotel and rode through Pacific Beach, Mission Beach and Mission Bay. Rooted for the NY Giants in the Super Bowl at Miller's Field which was walking distance from the hotel and great fun. We enjoyed our trip to Mission Beach and would definitely stay at the Catamaran again.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran ok”
Reviews.Author: xscreamsuk
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the catamaran as a part business trip/ part vacation for 5 nights mid december. we arrived v late from LAX and got parked ok in the garage and took our own cases to the room. It was a garden view room, check in was fine and efficient. the room was quite cold, and we had to have the heater running all night. When we came to shower in the morning the water was liuke warm at best. We mentioned it at reception on the way to breakfast. Service was good at breakfast, and the food perfectly ok, my wife then went to the spa and I went to explore Mission Beach and the locale in general. The room had warmed up a little by now, but we still needed the fan blowing all the time. The water was still chilly. Next day the water was warm so we were able to properly shower at last. We chose to eat out in the local area and that was fine. Room was a little dated, maid sometimes didn't come until mid afternoon, but always did a good job. We had one meal in the restaurant, we were the only people in there, so little atmosphere although the food was fine. Nothing special just ok. Cab from the hotel downtown was $30 in a town car which the concierge arranged. Would stop there again on a similar type of trip. We needed to be north of San Diego as we had business to do north of the city so it made the commute easier. I'm sure the experience would be different in the summer. It was really quiet in general in december, downtown was dead on a Saturday. It was a nice location, certainly better than the ones we saw on Hotel circle, and the beaches both oceanside and bayside were lovely. Some lively bars just up the road as well.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vgchao
Reviews.Content: As my post title states, this is a family hotel, If you want to stay near the beach in San Diego with kids, this is your hotel. The rooms are big but just barely average. The beds are hard and I wasn't thrilled about the sheets/bedding. Upside for vacationers: walking distance from the Beach and Bay and Restaurants. There's a pool and decent gym. Wireless works well in the rooms. Its January and the off season so there is a lot of repairs and updates being done to the grounds and facilities. I was in San Diego for work and the Cat was the most convenient to my work location, but otherwise I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Skubi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel as a final rest after the holidaze, and before school started again. It was a perfect place to be. This hotel is truely an oasis and has everything you need to make a great vacation. The hotel is located directly on Mission Bay in the middle of Pacific Beach and all that has to offer. The ocean is 2 blocks away. I find that in this area the ocean beach is a bit crazier- people wise- than the bay beach, so with kids, the bay is a better place to be. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the pool and hot tub are great. There is a full video arcade for the kids that is free to guests (no quarters required!!!). There is a place on the bay to rent boats, kayaks, etc., and a place in the hotel to rent bikes. The water in the bay is very calm, so there are no worries with the kids playing in it. Our suite was a bay front one and we were able to sit on our balcony and watch the kids play below. Our room was nice as well. The only objection we had was that the temperature of the room was hard to control, and the temperature of the shower was hard to control. If the hotel could fix these two things, perfection would be theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Stop Moaning - Beautiful hotel and fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: katielinda
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon, great hotel and fab location right on mission bay. Yes the rooms are old fashioned but who cares!,the hotel is beaufiful, everyone is friendly and San Diego is just fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Now a favorite”
Reviews.Author: rayray61
Reviews.Content: We and another couple spent a week at the Catamaran in October. I must say it was a wondeful experience for the four of us. Prior to arrival, I called ahead to see if our rooms could at least be in the same building. I was told by the front desk person that she would block off two rooms for us. When checked in, our rooms were ajoining in a building that had a beatiful pond setting wth a lot of waterfowl. The grounds of the hotel are truly very attractive with Mission Bay on one side with the Pacific Ocean only a short block away. The food in the resturaunt was a little pricey, but very good in quality. The Sunday Brunch was the BEST we ever had. Again, pricey but would do it again in a heart beat. Outstanding!!! The hotel is a little worn, but that did not matter with all else being great. The entire staff I delt with during our stay was superior, expertly taking care of all that was asked, I will stay again, just as soon as I can as the location is very close to all attractions and major highways. Go for it!!! You will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KgBlue18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for a week as part of our honeymoon and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a studio room in the 'Tower' and being on the 12th floor had great views of the bay and beach. The room was a generous size with a kitchenette and full size fridge. Staff at the hotel were always helpful and pleasant to deal with. Pacific Beach was a great location as it was quiet and relaxing but with restaurants and shops within walking distance. I would advise hiring a car to be able to get around easily and see all the nearby sights.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Dump”
Reviews.Author: tbernthal
Reviews.Content: It's a great location, but the rooms are dirty and in need of renovation. Flies everywhere, things don't work, staff unknowledgeable. If it were $100 or so per night, it would be reasonable, but way overpriced for things to be in terrible condition and have unconcerned management.

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms,Great Location,Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: PVmomontherun
Reviews.Content: We are currently at the Catamaran Resort & spa Hotel. Our room is a bayview studio suite on the 8th floor (Room 853)with amazing views of the bay and of the Ocean. We booked the room for 4 nights and I have to say that although I am normally very picky about hotel rooms, the view from our room far outweighed my displeasure at how dated the room is. The carpet is a little bit worn and the bathroom and kitchen tiny, but the beddings are clean and the maid comes in to clean our room and wash our dishes each day. I think the best part of Catamaran is location,location,location... My husband and kids are having a ball sufing,kayaking and sailing from the watersport facility at the hotel and surfing right across the road on Pacific beach . Despite the dated rooms we would come back again and book a bayview studio suite as we are having a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “catamaran well suits the pacific beach area”
Reviews.Author: KatieBrooke
Reviews.Content: Our party of three stayed at the Catamaran Sept.21-26, 2007. We were on the 9th floor of the tower with a bay view room. We had only signed up for a garden view room, so were happy for the complimentary upgrade. The view out of the patio was wonderful. Our room was a "standard" room with 2 beds, and small bathroom. The room also included an area with kitchen space..coffee maker, refrig, microwave, counter space, cupboards,...and also a stove which we didn't use. The beds were fine for us, but I know that they would be "too small" for some adults. (not queen size)-- Same with bathroom and room, they were small, but adequate. The beds themselves were comfortable and not dowdy in how they were made up. The room worked for us, we didn't feel like we were on top of each other, for such a long stay. It was really nice to have the patio, microwave, refrigerator, coffee make, and *counter space. The room also included 2 bar stools, table, chairs, and patio furniture...which were handy. You could see a lot from our room: the mountains in the distance to the left, then downtown, directly in front was the bay, and to the right the Pacific. It was a really nice view. Our sliding glass door worked OK for the patio. We didn't have any issues with: noise, the elevator being slow, the water pressure, or the water temperature in the bathroom. We had good house keeping service..(I tipped daily) and we had enough plug ins for 3 cell phones, etc. The lighting and tv were OK. Check in and out and bell-hops went well. The main thing I noticed about the Catamaran is how well it is suited to the Pacific Beach area. It is not a ritzy glamorous area, so the hotel fits right into its locale. The location of the hotel itself in the Pacific Beach area is excellent., with good proximity to the bay, the beach, Starbucks, Ralph's, the boardwalk, the Pacific Beach area, eating, shops, bus stops, etc. Pacific Beach is really nice, and I personally liked it better than La Jolla, which is odd...La Jolla, is more the cliffs, rocks, caves, and drama, while Pacific Beach is more the wide sand beach. The sand and beach area were very clean and well maintained. Both locations are excellent, but in different kinds of ways. The homeless weren't a problem, and I wouldn't have even noticed them, if they hadn't been pointed out to me. They seem to have their own protocol. People tend to donate their recycle items to them, and they keep the beach area clean. So, it seemed like the locals thought it was a win- win situation. We didn't eat at the hotel resturant, or use room service. We did use the spa one day and had a massage service which was good. The swimming pool and whirlpool were good. The grounds were really nice, and they had 2 outdoor flat screen tv's and fire pits in the court yard for sporting events on tv in the evenings, etc...a real nice set up. All in all the Catamaran was a good place to stay, in an interesting area, real close to the ocean/Pacific Beach. I stayed at the Catamaran with fear and trepidation after reading so many negative reviews, so hopefully, this additional review, will assist others who may be considering a stay at the Catamaran. FYI ...try Nick's flat iron steak...Yum! and the eggs benedict at The Eggery!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation in the perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: denacvb
Reviews.Content: We were at the Catmaran and loved every minute of our stay from August 8 through August 13. The concierge and front desk were constantly helpful. The waitstaff in the restaurant catered to my six year old as though he were a king. And the bartenders in the tiny bar were awesome and fun. As for the area, I would hardly consider it seedy. It is Pacific Beach, right in the heart of a surfer area, which we loved. Everyone in the area was nice, and we never felt unwelcome or touristy. We felt right at home. Upon arrival our reserved garden room was not ready. WE were early, so it was not the fault of the hotel. However, they immediatly offered us an upgrade room with a kitchen in the tower. Talk about a view! We felt perfectly at ease walking down the boardwalk and on Mission Blvd. at night after 11 p.m. with our six year old. This area is far from seedy. It saddens me that people are disappointed with the Catamaran because it is truly an awesome family spot. I could go on and on about our teriffic west coast vacation. I guess I knew I was staying in a beach hotel, and didn't expect it to be the Bellagio. It was clean, it was nice, it was comfortable, but most importantly we were treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RobinGoette
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from a 5 day stay in San Diego to celebrate our anniversary. We had the most romantic, wonderful time and decided it was even better than our honeymoon. We stayed at the Catamaran Resort and Spa on Mission Bay. It is beautiful! The hotel grounds are immaculate - everyone is nice - the food is delicious - and the location is perfect. Our room had just been re-carpeted the day we arrived so everything was neat and clean beyond belief. Our room looked out over the bay. It was quiet and relaxing - we never heard our neighbors once. There is a free ferry for guests that comes on Friday and Saturday nights and takes trips around the bay back and forth between another hotel. There was live music on the ferry - some people even danced which was fun to watch. There was a bar on the ferry too which as we learned attracts many younger people. We ended up getting off the boat even though we would have liked to stay longer, simply because it ended up being like we were in a bar. We ate at a great restaurant in the GasLamp Quarter - the Brazilian Steakhouse. It was awesome!!!! Excellent food, excellent service - expensive but worth it. I would highly recommend this. We also toured the aircraft carrier that is in the bay which was a neat experience. We now have an even greater appreciation for our military. Overall, we found San Diego to be easy to drive in - we never experienced anything negative the entire time we were there. We will definitely go back and we look very forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: knig
Reviews.Content: I would firstly like to say that we had high hope for this hotel. On check in we were advised our room wouldn't be ready until after 4PM - this seems bit late to me but my fault because I didn't check first. After we had waited around we were given room 355 - do NOT stay in this room carpet was bare in places, it was dark and dingy, smelt revolting, the furniture was chipped, kitchen shabby and the shower didn't work. When I called reception I was told the hotel was full and we were unable to be moved I was furious but tired so I didn't pursue this. The following evening at 8.30 we were disturbed by what seemed to be hammering and drilling I called reception again and they apologised for the disturbance. The following morning I called again as there was still hammering and complained again I was then told that they were refurbishing the floor below us and this would take place for the duration of our stay. I am a travel agent and for this not to be disclosed at time of booking or when we checked in is shocking but can happen to us too! I called the front of house manager immediatley and advised this was totally unacceptable. We were offer to be moved almost straight away to a room on the 12th floor with city and ocean view as the room was exactly the same I was not keen we were eventually offered an upgrade to a bayfront room but as this did not have a kitchenette we declined the offer and moved up - this was MUCH better. Grounds and reception are lovely, pool was clean, evening strolls around the bay were lovely. I didn't think much of the beach and surrounding area it seemed to be full of college kids drinking and clearly taking drugs with total disregard for anyone around - definatley not my kind of area I do not go to the beach to be constantly worrying about my son. The restaurant is overpriced in my opinion. Service was bad and food not great. For local eating check out The Boardwalk Cafe (come out of the hotel and turn left or walk along the bay about 10 mins on the beach side of the main road) great for breakfast we didn't go there any other time of day also The Mission just before the Boardwalk also great open only for breakfast. We also ate at the steakhouse opposite the hotel I can't remember the name Jo something - this was ok for casual eating but it gets quite busy. My advice would be to spend your money elsewhere. It is overpriced and in desperate need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Room could e mod”
Reviews.Author: jimcarson_com
Reviews.Content: The primary reason I booked a room here was a free upgrade to a "Studio Suite" room with two full size beds and a kitchen. The mid-week price ($139) was reasonable (for the area) and included the usual tourist discounts when tickets were purchased with the room. (For example, adding tickets to the Wild Animal Park was another $4. Yes, four bucks.) Towards the weekend, the room price shoots up to well over $200/night. Parking was $12/night additional for self-park. The room was comfortable, but could use updating. For example, the floor had an odd hump that I kept tripping over. It felt a little tight with four people (two young children). The kitchenette had a fridge, oven, range, microwave and coffee maker, but there were very few utensils and only one pan. (A cookie sheet and spatula would have done wonders.) We were on the ground level, and did not have to deal with the slow elevators. The facility is pretty, with access to the cove -- think quiet stroll at night. I frequented the pool area and the free arcade. I didn't partake in the spa or restaurant. The reception desk and staff were all helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Catamran Resort”
Reviews.Author: minkKC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catamaran Resort for 3 nights in August 2007. It was expensive, especially since I was staying there alone (about 300 per night average - no single room discount as is common with most US hotels) but the location was ideal - right on Mission Bay, and just a block away from the ocean/Mission Beach. I booked a deluxe king, but was upgraded to a bayview suite. Room was nice but not over-the-top luxurious, clean, bed was very comfortable, had a balcony (2nd story) overlooking bay. Breakfast isn't normally included in price, but I booked the bed and breakfast special that included breakfast in the restaurant. It was very good - had choice of buffet or could order off the menu. The grounds were wonderful - loved the ponds and the parrots, pool looked nice but didn't take advantage of it - spent my time at the bay or the beach instead. Took advantage of a free yoga class, but didn't use the fitness center. Rented a kayak and a bike - was about $10 per hour for each - would have been nice if room included vouchers for an hour or two of rental time for something, considering the price. They did give out vouchers for a cruise on the Bahia Belle. Had a massage and a facial at the Spa - they were about $100 per hour for each - more expensive than I usually pay - but the massage was the best I have ever had. Spa was newer than the resort and very nice - had a steam room, sauna, shower facilities, etc. I didn't have a car while staying at the Catamaran - I had stayed with a friend for a few days prior and did all sorts of sight-seeing on those days - Tijuana, La Jolla, the zoo, Coronado - and then spent most of my time at the Catamaran at the bay or beach. I did take a cab to Sea World while I was there - about $15 each way. Then I booked the airport shuttle that the hotel recommended, was about $12. I would definitely stay there again, but had I not stayed with a friend for a few days prior, I would have probably stayed somewhere less expensive for the sight-seeing days, then only stayed at the Catamaran when the intention was to hang out around the ocean and/or bay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Beach Location”
Reviews.Author: margio1224
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran Resort over Labor Day weekend for 4 nights. As we have lived in San Diego before, we knew the location and wanted to be near the beach so we didn't have to bother with driving and parking at the beach over the busy weekend. The Catamaran is a little piece of Hawaii in San Diego, it has a very relaxing, tropical atmosphere when you walk into their lobby and around the gardens. We paid for a garden room with a free upgrade to a suite in the tower. I think we would have preferred to be in the garden location as the elevators were slow, one was out of order all day on Saturday. For a resort hotel I would have expected the rooms to be a bit more upscale, such as having queen beds instead of doubles, a double bed is quite small for a couple, especially when you're used to sleeping in a king. The air conditioner was right next to one of the beds and it was very noisy, it kept me awake most of the night we were there as my husband had it turned on high due to the heatwave we experienced there, it was very humid. The bathroom is quite small, the bath needs a good scrub as there was mold growing on the tile around the faucets, and the drain was plugging up while running the shower. There needs to be another mirror in the bedroom, instead of a picture hanging over the desk the only decent mirror was in the bathroom, or the mirrored closet doors but if you have another hairdryer you need to have a plug handy, a little inconvenient when 2 people are trying to dry hair at same time. We didn't get a chance to use the pool, but it looked very nice with lots of lounge chairs, a snack bar and a video arcade, even live music during the day. The bay at the hotel is very quiet and relaxing, great for water activities i.e. kayaking, canoeing, parasailing etc. They even offer a bay cruise free of charge to the hotel guests. A great place for couples and families, a perfect location for beach goers or just anybody that wants to be in the middle of the beach action in San Diego, lots of restaurants and bars in walking distance. If we were to stay there again, I'd try the garden location or bay side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Tropical Feel, But A Bit Outdated”
Reviews.Author: aperio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for 3 nights in mid-August (mid-week). Check-in was no problem and our room was in the Tower (3rd floor). Overall the room was clean and everything worked ok. The carpet was in bad shape in a number of places and the sliding door to the balcony was in dire need of repair. The door would open but the sides of the door would wobble badly when the door was opened. The balcony was nice but very dusty. We think the maids would dump the dirt/dust from the rooms above and it landed on the balcony of the lower rooms. This meant that each evening everything that was left on the balcony (towels) was covered with a fine layer of dirt and dust. Our travel agent had told us the room would have two queen beds, in reality all the double rooms (according to the front desk) had double beds, and not queens. Not a big deal unless youâ€™re expecting to get 2 people to bed -- the smaller beds made for very uncomfortable sleeping. Lesson learned â€“ check with the hotel about the rooms if you have any doubts. We ended up having one of the kids sleep on a fold-out-bed, not comfortable but better than the previous night. We went to the family BBQ that was on Wednesday night on the beach at the hotel, the food was ok. A bit pricey for BBQ, but we enjoyed it. We went on the free cruise around the bay. Is you time it right you can take the cruise during the Sea World fireworks â€“ the kids enjoyed that but were mostly bored by the cruise (not much to see or do for kids). We had heard the beach right across the street from the hotel had a more rowdy crowd so we decided to go to La Jolla for the beach. La Jolla was an easy, quick drive and the beaches were beautiful. We ate dinner most nights at the hotels restaurant. The food and service were fine, except for one night. One night we went to the restaurant and along with everyone else in our section ended up waiting 30 to 40 minutes for menus and to even see our waiter for the first time. I made a number of trips to talk with the manager, who said the waiter was on their way, but again we waited. Normally we would have left but we were going on the cruise that night and didnâ€™t want to waste any more time driving somewhere. Eventually a waiter was sent, he offered a lame excuse (they were very busy and understaffed) and apology and that was it â€“ we expected maybe a free drink or appetizer but we but got nothing for the wait. The restaurant manager never even stopped by to say anything to us, or the 3 other tables that also waited. The pool area was nice and the bar made it easy to get a quick drink. The game room is located by the pool and all games are free - the kids loved that. Although the hotel is badly in need of an upgrade we did enjoy the tropical feel of the resort. Unless the hotel gets upgraded soon we probably would consider other resorts before the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: VickiBSouthampton
Reviews.Content: The front drive of the Catamaran looks as impressive as the pictures on the internet. Sadly, I couldn't say the same for the rest of the hotel. It could certainly do with a make over. It's not awful, just a bit more dated than we were expecting. The reception desk was very helpful. We didn't like the first room they gave us (ground floor next to the elevator and very noisey) so they quickly changed our room to a better spot. The room was great, spacious, clean, nice patio and a good sized bathroom. The beach was nice, although the sun loungers were in short supply. You had to be at the beach by 9.30am to get one! As it is on the bay rather than the ocean it is particually good for kids. Each day there were different events, BBQ, dinner cruise etc which were excellent. You can also go tot he sister hotel, the Bahia. The location on mission beach is good. Bars, restaurants and shops all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: tamsha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from August 19-22. The grounds and pool area is impressive and the staff very friendly. Nice to have free arcade for the kids. We had a tower room on the 11th floor - view was beautiful. The 2 elevators were horribly slow. The room itself was very large and the beds comfortable. The duvet on the bed was made of a horrible material - kind of like a burlap sack - very uncomfortable. The bathroom needs updated - grout, tile, tub dirty looking. Actually, the entire tower needs a makeover. The food in the restaurant was very expensive so we ate out as much as we could. The area catered more to the young surfer/party crowd not for families and was kind of sketchy in some places - not many family friendly restaurants in the area. You definitely need a vehicle to get around. Would I stay here again? Probably not. We paid $180 a night and thought that was high nevermind the $350 rate that others were paying.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review - Mostly Positive”
Reviews.Author: shoverdk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catamaran with my teenage daughter and her friend for three days. We loved the short walk to the beautiful Pacific beach and that is where we spent most of our time. We did not realize that there are areas of the beach designated for surfing and areas designated for swimming. This was not a problem for us, but if you have smaller children, the swimming beach is a longer walk, or even drive to get to. The hotel grounds, lobby, and pool area are very beautiful and well-maintained, and the location of the hotel couldn't be better! The back of the hotel is right on Mission Bay, and we took the ferry (complimentary to guests) out on the Bay for an hour and saw the great fireworks show at Seaworld. The staff was very accomodating and when there was a problem at check-in with our room availability, they immediately comped my parking fee ($12 per day) for us having to wait while they took care of the problem. We stayed in the Towers with a city view, and our room was above average and roomy enough for the three of us. The room had a kitchenette with a refrigerator, stove and microwave and was more than adequate for our needs. The beds were very comfortable and we could see the ocean from our balcony. My only complaint was that the price of the room was $330 per night, and I believe that was primarily for the location, not that you are checking into a 4 or 5 star hotel. Overall the resort was average and some areas above average, but the carpet in the hallways in the Tower needs to be replaced, and some areas need to be updated. However, I checked into the price, location, and accomodations for several other properties while we were there, and it seems that if you want to be right on the beach, you will pay a premium to be there. If I could get a better deal on the room rate, we would definitely return. I thought the staff was very good and friendly, and they were informative and accomodating for anything that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran Sorely In Need of an Update”
Reviews.Author: travelmom68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran Resort Hotel one night-- we were supposed to be there for four but left as soon as we possibly could. Hotel is dingy, REALLY in need of a MAJOR facelift and very noisy. Our room smelled dank and the carpet was coming up in many spots. All this for some $525 a night for one room! Granted, it is on Mission Bay and across the street from the Pacific Ocean but the area is very seedy-- we saw four arrests in the 20 hours we were there. We felt like we were in an episode of COPS. The staff was very nice and the birds are cute for the kids but those pluses pale in comparison to the the minuses.

Reviews.Title: “Place was OK...”
Reviews.Author: stacytford
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes regarding this hotel. I went with my son, who is 4 and my mom. THe room wasn't ready when we arrived which was after the check in time which was irritating, but the lady that checked us in was very nice. An hour later when the room was ready we checked in. The hotel is definitely old and dated. Dingy hallways with bad lighting. The room was nice though. Nice comforters and very clean. We had a kitchen which was nice. If you stay here though don't plan on doing much cooking in the kitchen. 3 of the burners on the electric stove where broken and the stove was very old. But it was nice to have a microwave and a refrigerator. The hotel was very loud. Many kids running around. We could here everything our neighbors did upstairs and people outside of our room. The location was great. Right on the bay and across the street from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but ridiculously overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: MsRobynG
Reviews.Content: The part of San Diego where this hotel is located is very much the "spring-breaky" part of San Diego with tons of young people and partying. The Catamaran is definitely the nicest hotel in the area. There are some nice things about the Catamaran, i.e. the beautiful grounds when you arrive, but the rooms are pretty mediocre in terms of amenitites, and the corridors leading to your rooms are pretty shabby. I would probably leave this hotel a pretty good review, were it not for the fact that the rooms were c. $400 per night!! At that price, I would expect excellence, and the Catamaran certainly does not deliver excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!!! Catamaran has it all!”
Reviews.Author: tadala
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Catamaran and could not wait to share the great reviews. I am a travel professional of 14 years and I must say this resort was absolutely a home run!. From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out, it was fabulous. I would recommend the tower on the upper floors for a perfect view of the ocean. It does not matter which side you face because of the way it's positioned. The Catamaran screams Hawaii but who needs Hawaii when beautiful San Diego is right outside you door. The check in area is relaxed, parking is so easy and safe and not far to walk to, it's also free. The pool is really nice. The water may be a little too warm, my guess would be 85 degrees at least. The arcade had free games 24 hours which is really nice if you travel with children. We had a room with 2 beds and a mini kitchen with a pull out sofa. The room was very large and service was excellent. The bay is also right outside the resort towards the back end of the property where there is plenty to do and breath taking to view. The resort could use some updating but it really matches what's going on in the area. This part of San Diego is so relaxed, it fits perfectly with the surroundings. If you decide to stay on the grounds, you could swear that you are in Hawaii, it's so relaxing at night and everyone is so happy. Great places to have fun are the Wavehouse (1 mile South) and Whiskey Girl (Gaslamp district) these are awesome hangouts with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service to Match the Scenery”
Reviews.Author: JJazman
Reviews.Content: My Wife, two year old Son and I just returned from a one night stay at the Catamaran. It was our first time to the San Diego area and the Catamaran hotel. I made the reservation from the Hotel web site after shopping for the rate on-line. The hotel clerk on the phone started things out right when he honored the lower rate that was advertised on the web. He willingly took my special requests (early check-in, Sea world ticket pick-up, and room upgrade if possible) and had a good attitude. They offered Sea world discount tickets that saved us $7 each. When we arrived the front desk clerk (Kristen) was awesome. She told me that they were able to upgrade to the bay front view, and she spent time reviewing the hotel offerings. Upgrades are not always possible and we appreciated the effort. The grounds were clean and well kept. The tropical theme added to the comfort and relaxing atmosphere. Hotel location was great and made for a quick trip to Sea World. The firework show is visible from the bay-side beach. Rooms were adequate size, all have patios, and decently furnished. Rooms do need updating but it was not a major factor on our visit. Most time was spent elsewhere on the grounds or traveling around the city. Concierge was informative and offered an appetizer coupon at the locat restraunt. Hotel has tons of things to offer for recreation including bay boat cruise, water toys, nice pool, talking parrot birds, and excellent atmosphere. We'll return again.

Reviews.Title: “Enloyed the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: Perewinkle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for 5 days in July. This is an older resort on Mission Bay Blvd. The grounds are beautiful. The pool is average sized and has a hot tub as well. There is also an arcade room next to the pool. We stayed in the Bayview suite in the Towers. This is a two room suite facing the Bay. There is a king sized bed in one room and a pull out couch in the other. Each room has a patio. The Bay side beach is great for families with young children. You can also rent paddle boats,kayaks and bicycles and there is a snack bar that opens early in the morning. Across the street is Misson beach. My boys loved to body board there. We took a free paddleboat ride in the evening and saw the Seaworld fireworks. This is an older resort in a beach area. The staff is polite and professional. The rooms are neat and clean. Families will like this hotel because it has something for everyone and the beach is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: cksdenver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Catamaran in late-June 2007 while our teenage sons attended a baseball camp at SDSU. We stayed in Room #605, a second story bay-front room. As to the basics, the room was quite large with two sinks in the bathroom, and a door separated the shower/toilet area. There was a 27â€� TV housed in cabinet that had three drawers below for clothing storage. There was a separate closet which I believe had drawers below for more storage. There was a separate sink, standard coffee maker, and mini-fridge in the bedroom area, which also included a table and two chairs. The balcony spanned the entire length of the room, and there was one standard and one lounge chair on the balcony. The air conditioning was an â€œin-wallâ€� unit. Standard TV channels were offered, in addition to pay-per-view first-run, family, and adult movies. Free HBO. The air conditioning unit was more than adequate/rarely needed. Note: It gets quite cool at evening being near the ocean. The view from the room was as promised and as described on the web site: right on Mission Bay. The room was very clean and the bedding was quite comfortable. The noise level between the rooms was more than OK. I know. On our last night, there was a bachelorette party in the room right next to us!! They partied until at least 2:00 am. The only time we heard them was when they were quite loud on their balcony. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Indeed, the staff accommodated a parking request for several members of the baseball group at SDSU who wanted to visit the beach. My kudos to the staff at the Catamaran. Our favorite activity: rent bikes (located on-site) and cruise the cement walkway on the ocean and the cement path that (seemingly) surrounds Mission Bay. We ate dinner at the Atoll Restaurant. Good food but very $$$$$. SD has many better dining options. Having read most if not all of the TA reviews of this property, I offer the following â€“ This is an expensive hotel, but it is the location of the property that demands the big price. That being said, however, we were more than pleased with our stay and suggest the Catamaran is worthy of the (relatively) expensive price. Our room was not five-star quality. For example, the doors hiding the mini-fridge did not close completely, and the mini-fridge itself seemed quite old. A minor point, but not of five-star quality. The grounds, however, do live up to billing. They are immaculately maintained and indeed the Catamaran IS an oasis given the surrounding area. The pool area, while somewhat small for a resort of this size, was adequate for us. We were surprised by the number of families (and thus small kids) staying at this property. As a result, during our stay, there were quite a few kids at the pool. Free towels are provided at the pool, and each day at the pool they had a band playing, with a full service bar and grill area. The hot tub is located next to the pool. The ocean is indeed across Mission Boulevard from the property. The beach is very expansive, nice, and clean. However, on the weekend, we found the beach to be body-to-body people; very crowded. Perhaps it was the time of our visit, on the weekend before the 4th of July, but perhaps not. There were lots and lots of 20-somethings populating the beach and (I was 20-something once) they like to drink and have fun. Lots of kegs on the beach on the weekend we were there. On weekdays: no. On the weekends: yes. And, scary/worry: no. Crowded: yes. All in all, we should be returning next year for the same SDSU baseball camp. Will we return to the Catamaran: YES! Sorry to ramble but hope this helps. CS

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with nice perks”
Reviews.Author: vandy12
Reviews.Content: I won a 3-night stay at the Catamaran through a charity auction and the pamphlet made the hotel look really promising. The hotel itself has plenty of interesting additions that add to the property. The restaurant there made amazing food (award-winning I might add). They had birds and ducks waddling around the property (a plus in my book). Their swimming pool was adequate. However, I place a large emphasis on a hotel's actual room. After all, you'll spend 80-90% of your time at the hotel in your room. I found the room to be an extreme letdown, given the ambience of the lobby and the rest of the premises. Noise reduction was certainly not the best, the room felt small, and the bathroom was adequate. I'd rate the actual room 2 stars out of 5, using the scale that AAA and other traveling sites tend to use. It was slightly better than a motel room. The outside premises were definitely a 4-star rating, which made the actual room quality even more of a shock. Lastly, you have to pay for daily parking, and that is always a minus in my book. Hotels should factor parking into the cost of their rooms and provide it for "free". It's more professional that way and guests don't feel like they're being nickled and dimed at every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kjdavitt
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is in a lovely locastion, but aside from that, I wasn't very pleased. The room was small, dated and dimly lit. The surrounding area is a bit sketchy. It was definitely not a family crowd...lots of tatoos, motorcycles...I really felt out of place with my 3 and 5 year old boys. The pool is small and aside from tiny steps, there's no shallow spot for young kids to play. I did like the fact that we could walk directly out to the beach (on the bay side) from our room....definitely the way to go. I could not imagine staying in the tower and going up and down the elevator all day. One more thing...the exotic birds and lobby were nice , but there are ducks everywhere and lots of duck poop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jakenm
Reviews.Content: We picked the Catamaran based mainly on location. And its location is perfect - right on Mission Blvd and a block from the boardwalk and beach. It took us only 10 minutes to get to Sea World by car, and we walked everywhere else. Parking was an extra $12/day (for non-valet), and the parking garage offered convenient access to the tower and other buildings. We stayed in the tower (third floor). The room was clean, and we had no problems. The room could have used updating, but we felt it was a pretty decent value considering the hotel's location and the price we paid (approx $250/night). The walls seemed thin, as we could hear a lot of noise; however, once we turned the wall a/c unit on, we couldn't hear any external noise. We did not use any of the hotel's amenities, so I can't comment on that. The spa and restaurant looked nice from the outside. The hotel staff was always courteous, but we didn't have a whole lot of interaction with them, as we were out and about most of the weekend. If you stay here and want a great breakfast, head about 1/2 mile south on Mission Blvd to "The Mission". We had a spectacular meal there, and will definitely return next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The Catamaran is beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: bharr2000
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran is a beautiful place to stay. It's a series of small buildings (also has a tower.....don't know that I'd want to stay in it) surrounded by beautiful grounds with a huge variety of tropical plants. So instead of walking through a stuffy hotel hallway to get to your room, you get to wind along a path with beautiful plants, ponds, ducks and, yes, parrots :-) They light the path with tiki torches at night..... so nice :) The room was very tastefully decorated, good shower pressure, and I believe all rooms except the tower have a balcony/porch with chairs. I will agree with complaints about the lighting, but if you open the curtains to the patio you really don't need the inside lights much. Also, I thought the pool was very nice.....not sure why some people complained about it. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is b/c the food at my husband's meetings and the luau there was just not that impressive. Also, while the Catamaran is very peaceful, it's in Pacific Beach, which is FULL of college students and has a spring break sort of atmosphere. Something to take into consideration when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: adap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and couldn't have had a better experience. We booked this using our airline miles through American Airlines. I was quite worried after reading some of the negative reviews. I contacted the Catamaran's customer service and on several occassions received superior service from an employee by the name of Kathryn Causee. She totally set my mind at ease. We had a Garden Suite in the Tower (room 357). Upon arriving the hotel was BEAUTIFUL! Our 2 small boys were in awe of the waterfalls, koi fish, amazon parrots and tiki torches. My husband and I were impressed with the lush grounds, nice room and superior service. The entire staff went out of their way to be helpful. They even sent up 2 employees to our room with a srcewdriver so we could put batteries in the new toy trains we bought our sons at the Train Museum. Our room and dishes were cleaned throughly every day. And our 2 & 5 year old tracked in A LOT of sand and spilled A LOT of Cheerios! It was quiet and close to everything. We could see the fireworks from Sea World from our room. My boys (and husband) LOVED the free video arcade. The pool was warm and they barbequed right next to it. We were disappointed that their ferry wasn't going to be in operation until July. And their beach right by the water was more mud, so we crossed the street to the Pacific Beach. The valet was super friendly. They even managed to pack all our stuff into our small VW trunk. Which was no small feat! I know the nearby hotels were much cheaper. But just driving by them you saw the young crowds partying on their balconies. This was our family vacation and it was worth every penny (mile). We also took advantage of their special rates for tickets. I couldn't find a lower rate for the 3 in 1 park pass anywhere online. We had such a nice time we ended up staying another day. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: suharbottle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for 6 days and absolutely loved it!! We upgraded to the Bayview Suite which had a great view. The room was clean and the decoration was up to date. The grounds are unbelievable and kids will love the parrots and koi ponds. The pool is fine and was not too busy at all when we were there. It truly made our stay in San Diego. The breakfast at the Atoll restaurant was wonderful and the location overlooking the Bay was terrific. The staff was also super friendly. Note, one issue that did occur was that we booked a run of the house room and at the hotel and you only get the garden view room unless you pay for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; could use some freshening up”
Reviews.Author: GoldenBears
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran is at a great location on Mission Bay, a short walk from the ocean. The facilities are nice, but showing their age. The lighting in thre rooms is poor; the air conditioning loud, and the sheets don't seem to fit the bed. There is no wireless internet service and the land line would not work with my laptop. I think the place is due for an upgrade. The bay front rooms open onto the beach, but some of the rooms in the tower have lousy views (Hooters, anyone?) I have stayed there three times in the last year but may look for other options when visiiting San Diego. If you book there, try their website first. It has some pretty good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great property but...”
Reviews.Author: dquansmom
Reviews.Content: My husband was in San Diego at a conference for Valentines' Day so as a surprise I booked us a room at the Catamaran for a little R&R before returning to the real world. While making reservations I requested a room with a bay view and early check in. We arrived at about 12:00pm and the place was beautiful. We walked up to the desk to check in and was told that our room was not ready and wouldn't be for at least an hour. We checked our luggage with the bell captain and went to get something to eat. We went back at about 1:15pm and was told not only was our room not ready, but it was still occupied! The desk clerk said to come back in another hour and we should be golden. We went to a little bike shop on the premises and rented two bikes and rode from the ocean to the bay which took us a good hour and a half. We went back and the room still wasn't ready. The best they could do we were told was to give us a key to the pool and we could wait there. We waited there for a while and I went back to see what was going on. The concierge apologized that our garden room still wasn't ready, but offered us an "upgrade" to a suite. We thought fine. However, when we got to our upgraded suite, we had a lovely view of the parking garage...not. I called downstairs and requested a refund as the bill was paid in advance. In the 90 seconds it took for us to get back to the lobby, we had an absolutely gorgeous garden room waiting for us. Staff reception was a little chilli toward us the rest of the weekend. It's a very lovely place, but next time, I think we'll stay at the Days Inn across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: MYPRITI
Reviews.Content: I would have given the Catamaran more than a 3 rating if the room were a bit more than average. The bed was not very comfortable but of course on 2 days during our stay we noticed new mattresses piled up for delivery. I'm sure the guests staying in our room after we departed received a new mattress! Oh well. However, most importantly, the room was immaculate. It also had a refrigerator which is always useful. The grounds were very lush, lots of exotic plants, flowers and trees from all around the world. There were ducks walking around which I also find to be a nice touch, and ponds with fish. A local bartender we chatted with at a restaurant on Pacific Beach called it an oasis and said that that is where he refers his visiting friends. I loved the location of the hotel. It was in the middle of the places we were visiting, the zoo, La Jolla, etc. I must say that after a day of being out and about I liked coming "home" to a nice tranquil hotel. It was also nice to sit on our patio and look at all of the beautiful plantlife while ducks walked right past our room. However, I do not think the cost of the room is on par with the room itself. I would have liked a nicer room for what we were paying. I didn't use the heated pool but I did visit the free arcade in the pool area. We rented a car during our stay and had to pay $12 per night for self parking ($16 per night for valet). We were lucky that our room was on the side housing the parking garage. However, my husband pointed out to me that we could have parked right outside the hotel on the street for free b/c there were always spots available. This hotel is located on Mission Bay and one block from Pacific Beach. We appreciated this a lot and spent a lot of time walking along the bay as well as the beach. The bar inside the hotel hosted an excellent happy hour that we found accidentally. For some reason the hotel does not advertise this. There was a "guest appreciation night" in which there was a wine tasting with cheeses and fresh fruit. That was a nice touch as well. I would return to this hotel but I probably would research a cheaper option first since this is not a typical resort vacation. All in all, a very pleasant stay at the Catamaran.

Reviews.Title: “good location, so-so accommodations”
Reviews.Author: lamfam
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 parents, 4 kids age 10 - 14, stayed in a Tower room for 3 nights. Cramped double beds of our studio room not worth the nearly $300/night, but kitchenette was adequate. Tower certainly showing its age. Our room's slider door barely closed much less locked. Maybe the bungalows are better. The staff was kind, restaurant was good (only ate 1 dinner there - decent kids' buffet, excellent fish entrees), grounds were lovely, pool was fine. Easy walk to beach and other water activities as well as some restaurants and shopping. The main reason to choose this hotel would be the Mission Bay/Pacific Beach location because the room was certainly nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “WOWWW!! We love the Catamaran Resort Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMelanie
Reviews.Content: We stay at lots of hotels for business and travel and must say that this is a truly AMAZING hotel. It was booked through [--] last year and we were ecstatic upon arrival. The lobby is outstanding with high ceilings, waterfalls and massive koi fish. The front desk staff treated us like royalty. We stayed for 8 days of sheer heaven. It was classy, laidback, and safe with a lovely unique atmosphere/environment. Every staff person goes over the top for you. From the gift shop clerk, to bike rentals, to snack shack staff, concierges, bellmen, security guards, room maids, restaurant staff - everyone was there to make our stay outstanding. Our suite was gorgeous and overlooked the quiet and beautiful Mission Bay. Everything was highend and modern. The suite consisted of a large balconey overlooking the water, generous livingroom with dining table, tv, fridge, complimentary coffee station, next was a semi-separate closet and make-up area with mirror, table, toiletries, make-up mirror etc. A large bathroom separated the livingroom area from a quiet back bedroom with another tv and two beds. The view was unobstructed with just a lawn, walkway/bikeway and sandy beach out front. We rented bikes outside our front door and rode for hours. The jogging paths at Mission Bay join up regularly through alleys to the Pacific Beach walkways. The snack shack outside at the beach was awesome for early morning coffee. You could rent any kind of beach chair, boat, or water apparatus there as well. There were free Pilates and Yoga classes for hotel guests on the beach. My daughter and I did it together. There were daily activities and a very helpful full concierge staff ready with recommendations and maps at a moment's notice. They even helped me locate a store I very much wanted to visit. We enjoyed the wonderful onsite family friendly restaurant. We had breakfast there each day and room service once. The fresh decaf coffee and mountains of freshly sliced papaya, mangos, pineapples and strawberries were a hit. Everything was delicious. Eating at outside tables each morning (almost on the sand) was pretty special. We loved the warm pool and large jacuzzi. The pool bar staff were very helpful. Pina Coladas were a hit. Adjoined the pool, the free pool tables, hockey game, and arcade/games room were a bonus for the kids. It was never too busy. Because parking is set-up outside of the core resort grounds, it was always tranquil and peaceful. You had that feeling of being on an oasis far away from the stresses of day-to-day life. There were cool pathways, ponds, palm trees, beautiful exotic birds and parrots to keep you company during your strolls. The hotel is close to everything. The concierge recommended Gringos for great Mexican food with flair. He was right. We walked there and loved the fun atmosphere and fantastic food. Food markets, drug stores, bars, restaurants were all within easy walking distance. The drive to La Jolla was about 6-7 minutes from our hotel. We stayed from March 1st to March 8th and had sunny skies and highs of over 70 degrees each day. Sunny everyday! Our day trips to the Zoo, Wild Animal Kingdom, Seaworld, Belmont Park, Whale Watching, Tijuana Tour, Downtown San Diego, Gaslamp Quarter, Horton Plaza were all enhanced because of the help and guidance of the front desk staff. We know we were high maintenance and you were always so nice to us. The well managed business centre and spa were bonuses too. Thank you so much Catmaran Resort Hotel for making our first trip to San Diego such a wonderful experience for everyone. We will be back and promise to highly recommend your property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: HockeyMomNJ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Catamaran. Lovely room overlooking the gardens. Grounds are well maintained. Room service is prompt and food was fine. (Bit pricey though) Hotel needs to upgrade their plumbing, though. Shower sometimes went from hot to cold to hot again on a moment's notice. Not enough of a problem to not be able to shower but annoying nonetheless. The pool was cold but the whirlpool was very nice. Our kids liked the free arcade. Can't beat the location. Short drive to a lot of San Diego attractions. On one side of resort is Mission Bay. Nice calm beach and pretty scenery. On the other side of the resort, cross the street and a half block away is the ocean. Enjoyed walking along the boardwalk in the morning and watching the surfers. Ate breakfast at Lhanina Beach House -- mostly a surfer bar but great omlettes and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice business meeting, nice location, rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: andrew_branham
Reviews.Content: I just conducted a region meeting for a major CPG company at the Catamaran in Jan of 2007. The good aspects of the hotel: --The service and sales department were very friendly, nice, and helpful --All of the guests commented about how wonderful the spa was. A+ --The food was very good (from breakfast to dinner all food was great --The grounds were very well landscaped, well maintained, and very nice. The location is perfect --We had a Luau at the beach with a Steel Drum band. The event was perfect and all guests agreed that the food was wonderful Needs improvement: --The rooms! Point blank.... the rooms are old and dated. The heat did not work in most rooms and the hot water was hit or miss. The rooms need updated! --Bed linens are old and cheap Overall, a nice value for the price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: GaryMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week in october for a USMC boot camp graduation. We booked through NWA world vacations and just happened to book this place for the location..Worked out GREAT! Parking is 11.00 a day, but parking is awful everywhere in San Diego, and you get a card key to come and go from the ramp when you want. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and quiet, look out for the ducks at night. Stayed in one of the 2 level rooms back in the corner. Location is great as ocean and boardwalk is across the street to the west. Plenty of area places to eat; from Denny's, Hooters, Tony Roma's. Great sunsets from the boardwalk. Easy to get to Sea World and make sure you spend an afternoon at Point Loma (Great Pictures of the Naval Air Station). Also the USS Midway and shopping area next to it was a great time too. Hotel employees were great on directions and helpful at check out time. Special thanks to the security guard that woke us up after we slept thru the wake up call the last day!! Gary & Deb, LP Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Ran Out Of Hot Water!”
Reviews.Author: GoFamilyGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and the facility ran out of hot water on a Saturday morning! No hot water for showers! At least 5 other families that we spoke with that same day also experienced no hot water for showers in the morning. I have never stayed at a resort where this has happened. Obviously, this older hotel needs to upgrade their plumbing system. Our room was tired and did not smell very fresh. We also had sand in our sheets which was experienced by other families as well. All I can say is that the location is great-close to the beach. Also, the grounds are beautiful and lush. Free plays in the video arcade made our boys happy. But, this did not make up for the lack of a shower in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cat!”
Reviews.Author: Adam18
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, loved everything about it! Great beach, great service, great food and a huge room. We were upgraded to a room with a kitchenette which meant we were able to cook snacks if we felt like it. The hotel's grounds are great-they're done in a sort of jungle style. Lots of ducks, huge fish, and even parrots live in the gardens-yes parrots! Breakfast is buffet style but quite expensive-when we were there (in June 2006) it cost us $15 each. I would stay at the Catamaran again definitely however overall it was quite expensive. For two weeks it cost five of us over $20,000 which included flights and room only. This meant we had to pay seperately for breakfast, lunch and dinner. If you've got the cash then definitely give this hotel a go!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, close to the beach / ocean”
Reviews.Author: Hemel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week holiday in California. We spent five nights at this hotel. On arrival the Valet staff parked our car and were very courteous The trick is to book a garden room and not one in the tower. Our room was a good size, clean and in good decorative order; it had a fridge which was very useful. The reception staff were a bit miserable and certainly not as friendly as any of the other hotels we stayed at; it was as if they had been told not to fraternise with the guests. On the other hand the valets and porters were extremely friendly. The hotel is in a good location in walking distance to the beach and ocean a few bars and restaurants. We arrived on a Friday went to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo both of which were highly enjoyable even for two adults with no kids. If you drive into San Diego park in the Horton Plaza where you can validate your ticket by purchasing a small item in return for 3 hours free parking. Visit USS Midway an enjoyable tour! Coronado Island is also nice. To be honest we have been to San Francisco; Monterey, Santa Barbara, Santa Monica, Newport, Los Vegas, and Palm Springs this year and can say that San Diego comes a close second to San Francisco; its charming and makes you want to go back. We could of stayed for a month. Donâ€™t miss the sunset with all the surfers.

Reviews.Title: “OK But not great”
Reviews.Author: JosephL
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed 3 nights in late August in a tower room with 2 doubles and a pull out couch. Most of the reviews are accurate. What drives the price of the rooms is the location-very convenient to the ocean and a nice beach on the bay. We looked very hard at most properties in this area and this one had the best location, would put 5 in a room and was not over the top in terms of price. The property itself is fine. Pool was closed one whole day-reason unknown but since we were ocean people it didn't disappoint us. We only ventured to the resturant for breakfast-buffet was nothing special-probably should be avoided because there many nice little breakfast places on the ocean. Concerige was helpful and available. Room was acceptable-great view of the beach/ocean. Summay-level set your expectations regarding what your money will buy on the beach. This place is acceptable. I would return under the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Expectations”
Reviews.Author: OwlClub
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five day stay at the Catamaran. I would say that based on the $159 per night rate I was pleased with the hotel amenities. I had a garden view room, and I must say that the garden, pool, and beach areas are well maintained. However, I don't believe the hotels warrants the $300 per night peak season rates. The rooms are average hotel fair at best and with plenty of other quality beach hotels in La Jolla and Del Mar you should weigh your options. Beware the so called double beds are no bigger than a large twin.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good Enough, Not Safe Enough”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2013
Reviews.Content: If you read the postings on this site, you can believe all the good and the bad that has been written. Everything that I chose the Catamaran for was true: good location, fabulous access to mission bay and watersports, lots of on site activities, near Pacific Beach, free arcade, etc. HOWEVER, all the bad is true too. There was the minor stuff like the valet who watched as my husband unloaded our car, the too small parking spaces, the damp, dark, depressing smelly room. The rooms are well below the level of a Residence Inn. However, the security problems were very real. The pool area is too small to accomodate the number of guests. THere is a bar and a free arcade right off of it that is also popular with both guests, and apparently non-guests. The pool area has the appearance of being safe since you need an access card to enter the area. However, my preteen daughter was scammed by a nonguest in the arcade. When we advised the front desk about the security breach they told us that the arcade was free to anyone and they dont enforce any security. In the tower too, there were young men running through the hall with beer and lit cigarettes. Anyone vacationing in the area can use the rentals at the Bay. It is a very public, loud hotel. I just dont think that it is a safe place to vacation with children.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: boltfan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Catamaran many times previous to our purchase of a condo just around the bay. With each and every stay the staff has been extremely curtious and helpful. The food has always been wonderful and the grounds are too beautiful to discribe. The view and use of the bay along with the activities the hotel offers keep you busy all day. Now we take a quick bike ride to the hotel and the staff treats us like we are their guests. We enjoy the bar, resturant and might I add the spa. The spa is the best I've been to and I've been to many in Las Vegas, Maui and Jamaica. We would recomend the Catamaran to anyone visiting San Diego. Your close to Sea World, Bellmont Park, the ocean (a block away) and many cool places to stop and shop or have a refreshing drink.

Reviews.Title: “Average aging hotel: small pool, great spa, great staff, poor food”
Reviews.Author: ImperftMe
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending a weekend at the Catamaran for a friend's wedding and I must say it met all my expectations but I did not have particularly high ones going in. This hotel dates back to the early 70's/late 60's and unfortunately the rooms suffer for it. They have done a nice face lift to the lobby adding a rock sculpture and koi pond but the rooms are a bit on the shabby side with the original kitchenette appliances. My friend and I shared a room on the 11th floor of the tower, which was great since we had a view of both the bay and the ocean from our balcony. This included a peek at Sea World's nightly 9:30 fireworks from across the bay. However the sliding glass door was off the track and the lock was broken, neither of which inspired a lot of confidence. Both bedside reading lamps were broken as well. Engineering was able to fix the lamps and the door, but not the lock. The showerhead position was permanently fixed to the wall, something difficult to deal with when you are tall and the original installer was not, plus it was green with corrosion. I had a hard time finding extra outlets to charge my cell phone, etc. and the decor could use some updating. The food served at the wedding was truly appalling. I've had better entrees on airplanes. However the wedding was beautiful as it was on the lawn with the bay as a backdrop and of course ultimately you don't go to weddings for the meal. The banquet rooms were nice and the staff was very well-organized. I did not see any problems or delays which I'm sure was a relief for the brides. I did not use the pool since it was August and not necessary but it struck me as very crowded with many families and small children packed into it every day. I think a hotel of that size could do with a larger pool, or at least a second one. The spa however was fantastic as it is only a year old. Both of the women that did my treatments were well-trained and friendly and I felt like a new person after I'd finished. The only complaint is that the spa is hard to find as you must walk through the breakfast area and find an unmarked door. A very kind valet parking attendent walked me all the way back there though.
