Overall the staff was excellent, very helpful and friendly which made getting around San Diego much easier. The parking was $14/day for valet and $11/day for self-parking so it almost made as much sense to use the valet as it did to park yourself. There was little or no street parking available in August. Overall I would not rush to book another trip here but if you are able to get a good discount through AAA or some other organization it might be worth it with children. I think you'd get a similar experience in a nicer setting at one of the B&B's along the bay, or by renting a vacation home for a week. The hotel reminded me of an aging surfer of 45+yrs still wearing Jams and trying a little too hard to be youthful. Sort of fun, but kind of not.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks...WONT be back again...!”
Reviews.Author: dgrn
Reviews.Content: On a scale from Motel 6 to the Four Seasons (and I have stayed in them and everything in between!)...the service at the Catamaran falls off the scale...deplorable...from the moment we pulled up to the Valet station and were greeted with, "Move your car its in the way"...by the Hotel staff...through the check in with the annoyed desk clerk...(sorry to bother just wanted to check in) who told us "Give me your credit card, but you will have to go find something to do for the next few hours - your room is not ready" there was terrible service through out our stay. To get to our room which was finally ready in the late afternoon, we walked past trash bags and dirty laundry piled throughout the halls...nice touch...we called housekeeping to have the trash and linens removed and they got to it...the next day...we ate the Sunday Brunch at the hotel and the staff who weren't standing around chatting were busy ignoring guests and checking with each other "How much time before we close down the buffet?" ...uh excuse me can my kid have a waffle please...? The line chef picked it up with his bare hands and flipped it on a plate... (Donâ€™t eat that one son!)...What else what else to say about the horrible service...oh careful with the valet service...after waiting around for our car we finally got fed up when no valet surfaced...hey no problem, all of the keys we right there in the cabinet unlocked for the taking...we found our key and as we approached our car we found the valet wandering aimlessly around the parking lot...."Here is the ticket for our car...but I think I will keep the tip..." and then the Valet started to chastise us and lecture us about how it "works" at the Catamaran..."You aren't allowed to get the keys from the cabinet that I didn't lock...only car thieves are."... There was more about I think you get the picture, a hotel/resort has only a few opportunities to impress and mostly it is about the service...the place is in need of repair, the food is marginal the location is ok ...but the service was deplorabel... My wife and I have done a lot of traveling in our time but the Catamaran will definitely be off from now on....!

Reviews.Title: “Classy & fun”
Reviews.Author: maineman2
Reviews.Content: My family recently completed a two week stay at the tropical, charming Catamaran Resort in San Diego, California. Any staff we encountered(Front Desk, Bar, pool, restaurant, gift shop) were all friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. Our children enjoyed the Mad Science program, visiting with the exotic birds, the pool and just playing on the beach. My wife and I were pleased with the entertainment at the pool and at the bar. The whole family was wowed by the Friday night luau...wonderful entertainment and fabulous food. I must also note our sense of feeling safe because the Catamaran's blue-uniformed officers always seemed to be around anywhere we went. We will definitely recommend this place to friends and family and we will return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds!”
Reviews.Author: Rocket06
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week at the Catamaran. We actually picked it because of TripAdvisor feedback. Initially booked for only 2 nights not knowing how it would be once we got there. I had some reservations based on some of the negative comments. Found it to be everything we wanted and stayed for another 5 nights. Hotel - Not sure about others who complain the rooms are outdated. We stayed on the top floor of the two storey buildings, not in the tower. The room was lovely and Clean! While we didnt' have a view of the bay, we did overlook the gardens but truthfully we spent very little time in the room therefore this wasn't a huge consideration. There were no musty smells, the air conditioning worked great, the bathrooms were great with two sinks! But most importantly for us, we didn't hear a peep out of the room next door. Often we've had problems where the walls are paper thin. This was not an issue at the Catamaran. The room also has a small fridge so you can store some drinks, etc. The colour of the bedspread isn't something we care too much about. Clean, spacious, nicely appointed. That's all there. Staff - Lots of friendly helpful staff. Restaurant - didn't eat there as we prefer to explore and there's tons of choice within walking distance to the hotel. It looked nice however and received a good review. Grounds - The grounds are lovely and reminded me of a scaled down version of many of the all inclusives we've stayed at in both Mexico and the Dominican. Location - We loved this location. If you wanted quiet beach, there's the bay area for sun bathing or for the kids to play in the sand. We didn't go in this water to swim. The pool is a more lively area however the pool was like a bathtub. We would have liked it to be a little cooler given the heat outside but if it was cooler I think the warmth would be wonderful. Loved going to the ocean to body surf. The Pacific is magnificent and great for swimming. You have to be a good swimmer however to go too far because of the waves. We loved starting off the day with a walk along the bay looking at all the lovely homes along the way then we'd go directly to the boardwalk on Mission Beach and walked back to the hotel. Rented bikes directly from the hotel which was wonderful. We made it almost to La Jolla. Rented a car for the last half of the trip in order to explore. Found the Catamaran to be well situated to everything. Went to La Jolla and checked out a couple of hotels there. We liked where we stayed more and because it's not directly on the beach, I think you avoid some of the mouldy, mildew smells that I did smell in a room I checked out. Loved dining in La Jolla. Fun to walk around after dinner. Enjoyed having lunch and dinner on Mission Beach (The green flash) while watching the sunset. Nick's was also good. The weekends are a little too crazy on the Mission Beach strip filled with young people drinking beer and playing volleyball. If you're over 21 you'll feel old but it is fun to people watch. By Monday the beach had a totally different feel. If you have a car you can avoid Mission Beach on the weekend and check out some of the beautful beaches including the beach at Torrey Pines, the beach at Coronado island and the beach in La Jolla. Catamaran allows for the best of both worlds. We enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “The Catamaran is beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: GusGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Catamaran Resort in San Diego, CA. It was beautiful. When you first arrive in the lobby, you immediately notice the large waterfall, and the big Koi fish. It puts you in an island feel right away. The front desk people were very nice and helpful. We wandered around the grounds of the hotel after our arrival. It carries the island/paradise theme throughout. There are wandering ponds, along with ducks to go with it. There are beautiful flowers and trees, and tropical birds that are put out everyday to be enjoyed by the guests. The surroundings are just gorgeous. Our hotel room was nice. We had a studio room that included a kitchen area, couch and two beds. It was very spacious, the slept four people very easily. We had a balcony over looking the ocean- which is just across the street. We saw some beautiful sunsets. We also tried the restaurant The Atoll at the hotel. It was wonderful the two times we ate there. We had made reservations for the Sunday Brunch- It was amazing- so much good food. It was a little pricey, but worth every cent. The hotel is located right on Mission Bay, which is a calm bay that has many sailboats. It is a very relaxed setting. It puts you in the mood to enjoy your vacation. I would recommend the Catamaran Resort to anyone traveling to San Diego, and looking for a tropical oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but large rooms and impressive grounds”
Reviews.Author: Michigander94
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catamaran in May, 2006 with my family, including 2 young children, in the main tower. The room was large with kitchenette (great for feeding kids) but somewhat dated. Also, my room did not have a internet connection as advertised. Talking birds were cool and grounds were fun to explore for the little ones. Valet parking was a needless expense--for most guests, you are closer to your room in the parking garage than by the front desk. Interactions with staff were inconsistent but some were very nice. My "garden view" actually looked out on the arking garage (see pic)! Overall, neat but not worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “nice grounds, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the grounds are nice with lots of trees, grass, ponds, and birds. the food was good we ate at the restaurant twice but a little high in price with small portions, we stayed in a garden room near the pool and the office, the pond was at our balcony so you could watch the ducks and other birds walk on your balkcony , the room is a little out dated . we stayed with other family members who had two other rooms in the same building with the same view, the a/c did not work in one of the rooms they did fix it but it took several hours . the beds are the WORST ! ! ! i have ever slept in, if you like bed springs in your back all night then it wont matter to you, these are possibly the cheapest beds you can buy, bring a pad if you want to have a good night sleep. the parking was 12 dollars a day but you can park on the street if you dont mind walking a few more steps, the hotel tried to charge me for parking on check out. the water pressure was also the worst i have every seen trying to take a shower was a challenge ,we might as well took a shower in the sink. you are close to the beach and bay witch is the reason we stayed here , the beach is nice and accross the street ,the bay is nice too it is clean and seems to be well kept but we had to ask for chairs twice to sit out on the bay. if you can deal with those things than this is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: theadams
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay here. Had a tower suite on the fifth floor facing away from the Bay. Yes we looked at the parking garage but beyond that we could see Pacific Beach. This is a great hotel. I don't know what all the negative reviews are about. The lobby and gardens were fantastic. Our room was a bit dated, but who cares? It was clean and we found the beds comfortable. We had a kitchenette which we enjoyed. (could have used a toaster!) The staff were exceptionally helpful. Even though we didn't have a car we enjoyed many chats with the very friendly valet out front. We also met up several times with a very friendly room service waiter (even though we never had room service) he was just so friendly every time we passed him. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but it looked like a nice menu. The fitness center was fantastic. I loved the cardio machines outside overlooking the bay. The locker rooms were unbelievable. Everything supplied and so upscale. One block away is a beautiful promenade along Pacific Beach. It was fun to walk along and watch the surfers.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: nss1958
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Catamaran. Loved everything about it!!! Large,clean room, great service,beautiful grounds and location. Walking distance to great resturaunts, and shops, close to the zoo,and sea world. will be going back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran is a destination”
Reviews.Author: hughseattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran for our Spring Break vacation. The negative comments on Trip Advisor gave me room for concern; I was ready to walk away if the problems were real. But most of the negative feedback turned out to be overstated. Our room was in nice condition; the carpets weren't worn. The mattress was very firm (too firm). We had a tower $uite with kitchen and as stated in some reviews, some noise came through the walls, especially plumbing sounds. All hallway activity noise was transmitted under the room door. We ate at the Atoll only once and the service was just as described in one review -- sort of loopy. But our server was well intended and corrected the things we prompted him for; the food was good. We ate out rather than use the very popular appearing room service; there are plenty of nearby places to eat or dine at. And there's a nearby Ralph's market. The landscaping is notable and extremely well maintained; the rooms are not at the aesthetic level of the landscaping. I've read complaints about how dark the grounds are at night. They are, but the lighting seemed okay to me. Security came out when we complained about kids throwing stuff from upper balconies. Our pre-teen kids enjoyed free arcade games, the pool, the sandy beach, the dock (the sting ray's eyes glow in the beam of a flashlight at night), the bird show (very non-corporate), the live-in ducks & geese, bike rentals and boat rentals. The parking garage spaces were indeed tight, mostly compact size. Across the board, the staff was always friendly. But none of the special requests for our reservation were met. And nobody I asked gave me accurate info on handicapped parking. We're glad we stayed here, but we'll try other places before we go back to Catamaran for the price; they were full for Spring Break and won't miss us. Except for parking, I never had a sense of being crowded. As for the homeless and the Pacific Beach location, we did encounter some homeless looking people on the bike path and around town. Pacific Beach struck me as a typical California beach town; no, it isn't Marina del Rey or La Jolla. Besides Belmont Park, SeaWorld, Balboa Park, and the Wild Animal Park, we happily spent most of our time at Catamaran. But Pacific Beach had numerous other interesting looking hotels and lots of vacation home rentals.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran Resort on a trip to visit our daughter and were really impressed. The hotel is conveniently located to all of the San Diego attractions (walking distance to the beach) and the views of the ocean and bay are very nice. There is an excellent exercise trail and all of the amenities, e.g., jacuzzi, etc. are really enjoyable. Staff were very courteous, polite and responsive. Room was clean and comfortable and the tropical feel of the grounds with a meandering stream and tropical flora really added to the visual experience. We would highly recommend the Catamaran on your next trip to the San Diego area. Our stay was a very relaxing and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed for three days at the resort. It was fantastic! We could walk out to the bay from our room. The place was kepted clean and orderly. The secruity people were extremely nice and professional with everyone. It really makes it a nice enviroment when you know that people are around to take care of anything. The staff treated us very well. It was a wonderful trip

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: MudPaws
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite in the tower in late March. 2 adults and 2 kids (4 and 6 years). The beach access is excellent. The kids loved having the bay beach right there, and the ocean beach just a short walk away. I thought the kids would enjoy the Bay beach more, but it turns out that it's kind of mucky and jellyfishy when the tide is out. So they actually preferred the ocean beach. But the Catamaran has nice lounges and umbrellas on the Bay beach, so the adults preferred that. The pool was warmer than I expected it to be. Nice, even on a cloudy not-so-warm day! The pool was plenty big enough for all the families there for Spring Break (no sign of the rowdy young adult crowd). Plentiful lounge chairs and towels. Nice large hot tub. The landscaping is very nice and gives a tropical feel. The building exteriors are aging, and could use a little sprucing up. The interior is dated, as many have mentioned. It's not super luxurious. But everything was clean and in good shape. Certainly not the dump that many reviews have made it out to be. The "kitchenette" is the smallest "kitchenette" I've ever seen. And very sparsely stocked. 4 spoons, 4 cups, etc. And there was no real eating area -- just a counter top with two bar stools, and your standard hotel table with two chairs. So really not much of a "suite". But if all you really need is a refrigerator for your milk, a bowl and spoon for your cereal, and a microwave for your popcorn, it's fine. We had a top-floor room of the tower, on the side away from the bay. It was a nice view from there. We could see the ocean, down to the Crystal Pier. But a lower room on the same side of the tower would have a view of the parking garage. If you're heading for the tower, ask for an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “IIt was nice!”
Reviews.Author: wildjflippin
Reviews.Content: I don't know why some people on here are rating this hotel so low. First of all, it is in a nice location, right across the street from the boardwalk of Pacific Beach and within walking distance of many restaurants. Our room was very clean, nice and the bed and bedding superior. Our room opened out onto the greenbelt area next to the bay- very nice view. The lobby was gorgeous with a waterfall and koi fish in the pond. The grounds were also lovely, duck and swans in the water areas of the hotel. Pool and jacuzzi great. We also had a couples massage in the spa there. Spa experience terrific. I'd say either the people on here went to resort a long time ago or are awful picky. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Catamaran!!!”
Reviews.Author: SATSanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: Went for our honeymoon - loved the room, incredible view, beautiful grounds, fantastic service and food, would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “this is a very nice place”
Reviews.Author: lar63
Reviews.Content: my family of four stayed here booking a room thru hotels.com and we loved it.we had a room just outside the pool and it was quiet, clean,and well maintained, we thought the facility was kept up well and all the staff was very nice. we got a great price and it is accross the street from mission beach and they have their own lagoon beach and pool complex. iim glad we didnt stay on the beach cuz its alot noiser across the street and at nite the beach isnt suitable for little kids, although it was safe.the parking situation was great too: reasonable and in&out whenever you want. id like to stay in lajolla or somplace else if i go back, but id recommend this place to anyone who has a family or is looking for above avg reasonably priced accommadations.

Reviews.Title: “Increadible weather”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Catamaran over Pres weekend. It felt like summer the rates were very good off season rates. We visit the property a lot 'cause it's our little Hawaii. The weather was incredable!!! My son and I took some more surf lessons and the wife spent a bundle at the new spa. Fitness Center is a bomb. The Cardio machines are outside on a patio over looking the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “No way”
Reviews.Author: mermaidontop
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing I expected. It looks like the 70's, and they tried to make it look nicer or cover it up with lots of plants and trees. Shabby rooms and the ice machine is outside in the center of the grounds for everyone to use, it's a hike. The rooms overlooking the bay looked nice, but a lot more pricey. I will not return. I feel I overpaid for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update!”
Reviews.Author: keevygz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran during Christmas vacation of 2005 and over New Year's. We arrived at midnight and at first found the place very dark and uninviting. The next day was surprised to see the lovely gardens and tropical setting. Our room was on the third floor of the tower and I felt that the room was way overpriced! We paid $210 a night for a musty room that included a refrigerator, microwave, and I think stove. (we didn't use it) The room definitely needs an update. We booked through Travelocity and were suppose to get our choice of 2 FREE excursions. (including Sea World because I had called the hotel) However, due to a lack of tickets given to them by Travelocity we were not able to get them which would have saved us $110! So I asked to speak to the manager and she asked me what they could do for us now to make it good. I also noticed another special where it included FREE breakfasts and so I told her we all three had to eat and so was offered 12 FREE breakfast coupons in the dining room which we all enjoyed during our stay. It saved us about $120 I figured. Enjoyed the early morning walks on the bay and afternoon across the street on the oceanfront. I would probably choose something over on the ocean next time like the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Theft at the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: Annabananabaloo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the tower and it was an average room. The complex was lovely though, with access onto Mission beach which we loved, and very close to Pacific Beach (where we got engaged) and loved the whole of San Diego. One thing ruined our stay here though - $100 was stolen from our room, I can only assume by housekeeping, as they were just finishing off our room when we returned after stepping out for a couple of hours. Security took an age to arrive, filled in a form, then nothing... after reading some of the other reviews on this site, this now does not seem suprising.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed holidays there”
Reviews.Author: BostonwalkerBoston
Reviews.Content: It was really a pleasant experience for us. We spent $110/night on a bay view studio room (now they have microwave!)the key is to book a bay view room, otherwise you have a good chance to view a parking lot. Parking on the street would have been easy and free during Xmas, but since we were not famililar with the neighborhood, we managed to park inside. Will recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed Catamaran resort”
Reviews.Author: faience
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 11 night stay at the Catamaran Resort, Mission Beach. We had to quickly change our holiday plans due to Hurricaine Wilma. I must admit that I was rather apprehensive after reading the reviews. I need not have worried however. We had a lovely suite on the fifth floor overlooking the bay and we had wonderful views of the bay, sea and the downtown area of San Diego. The room was comfortably furnished in well made dark wood furniture which was a refreshing change from the blandness of some hotel fittings. I found the beds very comfortable and staff were always helpful. The hotel is well located close to both the beach but also shops and restaurants and bars. There is also good public transportation if one did not want to drive. We only ate in the Atoll restaurant once as I agree it is over priced especially as there are lots of dining opportunites close by. I only saw the odd homeless person, no more than one would see in other areas and they posed no problem at all. The hotel gardens with the ducks, ponds and macaws were lovely. My only criticisms would be that the ground are very dark at night especially the front of the hotel and it would be easy to stumble if on foot. I also cannot understand why one has to pay for parking in a hotel when one is resident. $9 per day to self park seems ridiculous to me. I would not hestitate to go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Think carefully before booking”
Reviews.Author: Tolly1
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself booked into this room for the final 3 nights and were very disappointed. We had booked a room in the 'Tower' and it was not very clean, smelt damp and had a balcony overlooking a multi storey car park. The room was also very small and had very little facilities. We compleained about the room and were told that all they had available was rooms on one of the higher floors for an additional USD50-75 per night. After consideration we decided to upgrade but to be told that they had a mistake and there were no other rooms available in the complex - somewhat difficult to believe. They suggested we stay in our room whilst they continue to search and when we advised that we wanted to go out and could they ring on our mobile phone they basically said no. Staff were unhelpful, food unimpressive and you had to pay for so many extras - car parking, beach beds..... We will not return

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Nice grounds, nice view”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here October, 2005. Positives: Convenient location with lots of restaurants (seafood, Thai, Sushi, fast food, Mexican) all within easy walking distance. We had a roomy suite with a nice view of the Bay on the 5th floor of the Tower Building. The room was very quiet. Bathroom shower had good pressure and water temperature. The fitness center was free and the equipment was new and in good working order. Nice walking path around the Bay. Lots of parking (self-park was $9 per day). The staff was helpful with giving driving directions and restaurant recommendations. The grounds are pretty and well maintained. Negative: The beds were not firm at all. The spa was expensive. A 50-minute massage was $110 and some of the other procedures cost as much as $185. As for the neighborhood...yes, we did see some homeless people, but in my experience that is not uncommon in Southern California. We felt safe walking to and from restaurants in the dark for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “BIG disappointment! Don't touch this place!”
Reviews.Author: Kaygee
Reviews.Content: My family and I were looking forward to a relaxing break in San Diego after the fast pace of Las Vegas. I had reserved the rooms in June, two garden view rooms on a high floor at $189 per night for 4 nights, one room for me and my husband and the other for my Mum and Dad. When we checked in my husband and I was given a room on the fifth floor of the tower, apparently this was a garden room. As soon as I walked into the room I could smell that damp foist smell that comes from somewhere or something getting wet and then being allowed to dry... it was nasty! Then to make matters worse the 'garden view' was really the view of the concrete multi level car park of the hotel... doesn't mention that on the website! My parents room was exactly the same, still the fifth floor of the tower but their room came with less of a smell, it did still smell, but not as bad as the first and it also came with that lovely view of the car park. So it was back to reception and two more room keys were issued, this time in the two storey buildings next to the reception. The first room was fine (room 100 - literally next to reception) - clean, tidy and a nice little veranda with two seats and a table, and on the ground floor... and facing the gardens and the ducks! This was perfect for my Mum and Dad, so they were happy to settle with that room. My husband and me then went around to the next room (221 I think). It was supposed to be a non-smoking room and if this was non-smoking I am the Queen of Sheba! If we had stayed there our clothes would stink within an hour of hanging them in the wardrobe! So back to the receptionist! They had nothing else to offer us apparently unless we 'upgraded' to a suite for another $35 per night. So with Mum and Dad settled in their room we opted to pay the extra. The suite was on the 3rd floor of the tower facing the gardens and not the car park thankfully. Apparently all of the suites are the room right next door to the lifts, which was a worry at first but we didn't really hear it. The rooms were all dated but they were clean enough - but they needed to have some serious tender loving care. The air con unit was so loud we didn't dare turn it on for fear of waking the neighbours! The bathroom was small but clean and plenty of towels. We all thought that things were all settled and we could enjoy the rest of our time in San Diego.....WE WERE SO WRONG!!! Mum and Dad were sat watching TV on the second night and heard a gurgling noise and thought that it was just the pipes from the room upstairs. They had heard them before and gave it no second thought, then Dad went to make a coffee, which was next to the bathroom, only to discover that it was the pipes all right, but the water from the shower upstairs was pumping out of my Mum and Dad's bathroom sink, and the second hand water mixed with dirt and old hair was now all over the floor in the bathroom as well as the dressing table area... and my God did it smell bad! Reception didn't react very fast considering they were right next door and sent the TV repair man at first...Then the plumber, who recommended to Dad that he contact house keeping to clean the mess up.... they really did expect my Mum and Dad to stay there with soaking carpets, broken sink, no drainage and the most disgusting smell! So it was back to reception... they offered another smelly room at first and then decided to give them a large room in the tower, just along from my husband and me. The hotel did make amends by giving us all a free dinner at the Atoll restaurant (drinks not included) and waving the extra cost for the suite that my husband and me were paying... We noticed that someone else was in room 100 the next night - poor people... hope that had no sense of smell! By the way â€“ the bar next to reception has a pianist â€“ he is good if you like modern jazz or pretty tuneless tinkling â€“ but he is very LOUDâ€¦ in fact he spoiled a quiet drink. Think about going somewhere else if you want to be able to talk to people without the need for shouting! The last few days at the hotel went fine - except the evening we returned from Sea World (this place is brilliant!) to find that there were no parking spaces at the hotel as they were all being used by attendees for a convention! They were turning away paying guests from using their own car park that they were charged $9 a night to use and allowing convention guests to park! UNBELIEVABLE! We checked out very early on our last dayâ€¦ in all honesty we couldnâ€™t wait to leave. The Catamaran had been a disaster for us and we will not return, they seemed to care more for their convention guests than the room guests. I have no dispute that the gardens were lovely and the pool was great, but that does not make up for poor service and awful rooms that cost a packetâ€¦ I wish we had stayed in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “welcome relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: Ttrainerboy
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from the catamaran,and i must say that i was abit dissapointed when we first arrived,as it looked abit dark as we were going to our room.But what a surprise in the day light.Its a beautiful resort set in lovely surroundings.The beach at the back of the hotel was a lovely setting for many weddings that took place while we were there.The pool area was great,plenty of sunbeds,towels,lovely and clean,and never crowded,which was lovely for relaxing.The hot tub was great if you could stand the heat of the water 103 degrees.We visited seaworld,the gaslamp quarter,and the shopping malls,and also went over the border to mexico.The hotel staff were very helpful with maps and bus times etc.Also with confirming onward flights which thet did for us.There are some lovely seafood restaurants nearby,one which we liked was Nicks.I would advise anyone not to go onto the bay over the main road at night as there are a few beggars about which i found to be a bit scary,but my husband wasn`t abit bothered.We would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran just OK”
Reviews.Author: cdeliso
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catamaran Oct 9-12th, drove in from AZ. Arrived about 3pm, checking quick. First impression - Older hotel, darker wood, open air lobby with koi pond. Was ok, nothing special. We stayed in the tower, floor 3. There was some 'construction' or at least I hoped so, as there were holes in the walls of the building entry way. The door to the building was never shut, and it seemed anyone could walk in off the street, so not as secure as I would have expected (would have expected keyed entry, since there is no reception area staffed in this building) We had 2 double beds and a sofa. Was very roomy. The bathroom was Tiny, only 1 sink. There was a mini-kitchen, we did not use. The beds seemed to be made out of all large springs and no stuffing. Were not very comfortable. The furnishings otherwise ok. Parking $9/day in garage. Area surrounding hotel somewhat scary for little ones. The pacific beach and Mission beach area full of homeless, and most folks drinking alcohol. We walked along the beach a few times, twice AM, twice PM. The boardwalk was clean of trash, but there were homeless folks sleeeping, drinking, etc. My kids were scared and did not want to go back out. The pool was heated, and towels plentiful. We did get room service, the food was reasonably priced and tasted fine. Sea World was an easy 5-10 min drive, legoland less than 30 minutes. Next time I would consider staying at Coronado or La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant to come here after reading the wide range of reviews, but thought we'd give it a try. They booked us in one of the Section 400 rooms. We had a spacious room, comfortable king-sized bed, two sinks, shower/bath, frig, coffee-maker, couch, desk, free Internet connection for our laptop, and, on top of all that, a deck directly adjacent to a large koi pond with palm trees, swans, and ducks! We just opened out sliding glass door and enjoyed the tropical nature right outside! The facility has over 100 different kinds of palms, several macaw and parrots that are fun to watch, and Mission Bay is right outside the gate. If the ocean is your preference, Pacific Beach is only a two-minute walk away. The staff was friendly and courteous, the bed was comfortable, the price online was $99 a night (plus $9 per day for parking). We called, and they said the price was $189, but then I told them the Internet rate, and they said they would match it. Yes, there were some cracks in the bathroom counter, but everything was clean and comfortable. The Pacific Beach area is not an upper-class neighborhood, but is more older middle class-type. It is about 2 miles from the freeway, so it takes a little time to get to downtown San Diego, but only about 15 minutes. This was a real bargain, and we wished we could have stayed longer. If you like nature, the tropical plants, birds, and fish add a wonderful attraction to your stay here. We definitely plan to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Catamaran - You'll Regret It”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Lucas_Brice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Catamaran for our Honeymoon. This was a big mistake. We arrived in our room, which was on the second floor of the two storey building. First, one of the lights in the room had a short in it, and I had to call the front desk to get someone on there to fix it before it started a fire. Then I noticed that the phone didn't work because there was a short in the cord, and that had to be replaced. The carpet had brown threadbare patches. We opened the door to the patio and realized that our room was next to the bar and restaurant area and there was a large screen TV outside with a football game blasting. In addition to that, people were smoking at the outdoor tables and the cigarette smoke blew into our faces. We went to the front desk to complain about the situation and we were told that the game would be over at 7PM. We figured that we would simply put up with it as it would be over in a bit. Well, they lied, it was a doubleheader game and it went on until about 9PM. We complained again and we were offered another room in the tower, but one that had a garden view, which I suspect meant that it faced the street. We paid for a room that faced the bay, so we decided to wait until it was all over and we could enjoy the room the next day. Wrong. The next day, when we looked out of the balcony, we noticed they were setting up tables and chairs on the grass right outside of our room. They had a convention eating lunch outside the room, so we couldn't enjoy the view then either. Fine, we figured they would be finished by dinner and we could have dinner out on the balcony. Wrong again. They set up the tables and chairs again, but this time, in addition to having a full complement of diners outside our window, they also had blasting live reggae music. We were upset, and called the front desk again. They offered to give us another room in the same building, facing the beach, just a little farther away from the room we had. We asked them if the music would be lower in the new room and they said, "Probably not." They also told us, "No one else has complained about it." So we said that we didn't want to have to move rooms for little change. They then asked us if we wanted to leave. I thought about it but realized that if I left and drove back to Orange County, I'd arrive home at 9:30 PM and would have to send our friend home, who was watching our dog. They couldn't comp me a room as I'd paid with an online reservation service, but they removed the charge from the extras: dinner at the restaurant, parking, and room service. Other problems: the grounds and the stairs are really dark at night, the hotel is in a marginal neighborhood that doesn't quite feel safe (we saw several scary homeless people), the restaurant food was really good but really expensive (we had three appetizers and two side salads plus two sodas and the bill was over $70), we ordered room service and put our tray and dishes outside the room...five hours later, the dishes were still out there and we had to call for them to remove them. The bottom line is that the hotel doesn't really seem to care about their guests. They seem more interested in their convention business, which is probably where they make their money. There isn't the kind of attention to detail that good hotels pay attention to, and for the price, I expect this. We expected that on our honeymoon, we would be able to relax in and around our room, but we weren't able to do that. I got about $100 back from the hotel, but they're never going to be able to give me my honeymoon back. Don't stay at this hotel. There are nicer places to stay at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: PlainCrazy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Catamaran from September 13 -17th. I am inclined to post this review only to help anyone who might have doubts on this hotel because of a few of the negative post immediately below.... First of all. When we drove down from Anaheim last Tuesday we were immediately impressed with the hotels grounds. Very nicely landscaped around the parking lot, plenty of palm trees and lush vegetation. Our first reception was by the car valet. Nicely opened my wife and daughter's doors and welcomed us to the hotel. We were checking in early and he offerred to park our rental while we went to the front desk. As we were checking in early the front desk staff told us our room was unoccupied but needed a couple of hours to be cleaned. No problem with me as it was only 1:00 at the time. They invited us to use the gym or the pool. We chose to walk a hundred feet past the parking lot to the ocean. A bit of advise - the Mission and Ocean Beach promenades are a bit gritty. The odd homeless person, etc. At no time did I ever feel unsafe but I know some people get freaked out. Not me. Once we were able to get into our room - one hour early I might add - we found our bags already there a brief note from the bellman and valet explaining how to retrieve our vehicle when required. This was a nice touch and I had to make sure to drop a tip for the guys who were doing such a great job of taking care of us. On to the swimming pool. Awesome. Plenty of chairs and loungers. It looked like the towels had been all used up and were promptly replenished by housekeeping before I even thought to call. Hot tub is amazing. So big you could swim in it. We used the pool area every day. Never crowded - always clean. The grounds are magical. Rare and beautiful birds waddle about the various pools and jungle like gardens. Big hit with my kids. The restuarant was great. We only used it for breakfast so I can't comment past that. The service was very friendly but I'll admit was a little slower than most resturants I'm used to. I am pretty forgiving of slower service while on holiday. I am in no big rush ever while away. All in all the room we had was nice. Two big beds and a nice sofa with a couple of comfy chairs. The view from our balcony was impressive. Full south exposure of Mission Bay and the Ocean. With the slider left open we could hear the waves crashing on the beach at night. Realistically I don't think it could be better for the money we paid. Average rate of $235/night. I think people making comparisons to Four Seasons or Westin Hotels should re-address what they should expect in this price range. I would rank the Catamaran as a three star that some might find expensive but it is right on the Bay with commanding views of the ocean and really nice ammenities. You will always pay for that location. We will be back for sure. Good job Catamaran!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Catamaran Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say we had a wonderful time, My husband and I were really impressed, the grounds were beautiful and the service was awesome from the bell person to the front desk, everyone was great! Great for families we had our daughter and her friend whom both are 16 years old and our two year old son. They had a great time walking right across to the beach, swimming and the free arcades are a plus. We all had a great time, we wish we would have stayed one more day. I asked for a upgrade because the room we were given had a parking lot view. So beware of that room. But as soon as i asked to move the front desk was more then willing to accomodate us and we moved to a partial bay view room on the 4th floor....very nice! Next time we go we may want to try a room right on the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed My Stay at the Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: jakkie
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at the Catamaran after reading the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor. Suffice to say, I was pleasantly surprised! Both my boyfriend and I loved the Catarmaran. The service was excellent and so was our suite. Upon check-in we found out that we had been upgraded to large suite with a view of the bay and the ocean. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast at the hotel restaurant was good and we enjoyed the pool and beach. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the advice of a friend. He recommended it as a boutique-ey hotel with a lot of character and atmosphere and a great location. Sounded good. I checked their website and it looked fairly nice, and I figured for a little more money than a typical family style hotel (Saturday nights - $359) we would give it a try. I did see some less than complimentary comments on TripAdvisor, but I chalked them up to fussy, nit-picky people who are impossible to please. Boy, was I wrong. When we drove up to the place, both my wife and daughter said, "This isn't it, is it?" Even at first glance, it was apparent that it was old, and a little beat-up. First impressions aside, we checked in and hoped for the best. We were put in the tower on the 10th floor which was fine with us. The first thing that caught my attention was the tacky decor. The Polynesian theme is fine - we have stayed in some Polynesian themed hotels before that were beautiful. The Maui Prince (In Maui, HI) comes to mind. But this was the 1970's all over again. The dark woodgrain doors and the faux bamboo reminded me of a bad rumpus room. The elevator to the 10th floor was creaky and groany and my wife made the comment that it was scarier than the Tower of Terror ride we were just on at Disneyland. We got to our room and the first thing that struck us was the musty, mildewy smell throughout. The kitchen was scary. The appliances were circa 1979 and falling apart, and the cupboards and sink and fixtures were right out of the Bates Motel. I went to check out the balcony, and after using all my strength to force the door open, it fell of the rails. I fortunately caught it before it fell 10 floors and killed somebody. My daughter immediately commented that the bedspread she was sitting on felt greasy. Then there was the bathroom. What caught my wife's eye immediately was the black hair stuck on the wall. What caught my eye were the shower curtain brackets that were completely rusted out and the black mildew between the tiles around the tub. Those brackets would cost them $1.49 to replace, and a bottle of bathroom tile cleaner about the same. That is what brings me to my point about this place. They seem to fancy themselves as a high-end resort hotel. We got a huge laugh out of the room service menu. They were charging Four Seasons prices - I don't remember them all, but I do remember $10.00 for a pot of coffee, and $75.00 for a bottle of liquor. In the Four Seasons I would pay that kind of money, but not in this place. My suggestion would be that if they want to be a 4 star resort, they completeley renovate, which I suspect would cost millions of dollars, or they instead prescribe to "truth in advertising", and market it like it really is - a great place for surfers or college kids to come on Spring Break, where they can come and crash after partying all night and hang their towels on the balcony (if they can get the door open) and grind sand into the old carpet. But for us, a family that will spend a few extra dollars for modern, clean accomodations - it was a huge disappointment, and we left the next day. By the way, I have seen the oohs and aahs on this site about the beautiful grounds here. We spent 10 days in southern California - there are LOTS of palm trees in this entire area, folks! If you want to see impressive landscaping and immaculately kept grounds, go to the Mandalay Bay hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here(wife and 9 yr old girl) Aug 15-18 and had a great time. The grounds were gorgeous and it made you feel like you were in a tropical location. They had lots of family activities including a movie night on the bay and hands on science projects for the kids at the pool. The location is the best in the area. The hotel is right on the bay with its calm waters and beach for relaxing or enjoying the the watersports right on the property. In addition if you like the open ocean for surfing or boogie bording just walk across the street from the main entrance and your there. Upon our arrival they said our room was'nt ready and they had upgraded us to a suite. We stayed in the tower and had a bedroom with a king sized bed and a living room with a king size sofa bed and a full kitchen. The room was large and clean although it did seem slightly dated. But as nice as the surroundings are ,you would hardly want to stay in your room. I would highly reccomend this hotel to any one who wanted a super family beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Miss121
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 2 sons ages 9 and 5 stayed at the Catamaran hotel July 24th-July 30th. This is our 4th visit I would not stay anyware else. When we booked this hotel thur them because we were returing guest we received an extra 10% off our hotel room. We book a tower room with a kitchen since we were in town for a week. We got in town at 11:00 and tried to check in early but the lobby was very busy. We decided to go down to the beach for a walk and lunch. We returned to the hotel about 2 and were checked in and escorted to our room. I thought it was strange that the kitchen did no have a microwave so I called down to housekeeping and they brough up a microwave, and pillows I requested within 5 minutes. My chidren enjoyed the pool and the gameroom. When my sons found out all the games were free they did not want to go swimming again. On Tuesday night they had a movie on the beach with popcorn and pop(free) and we watched "Finding Nemo" The people at the hotel were great and brought out towels for us to sit on. We love the grounds and love this hotel but it does need updating. My husband will not stay anyware else in San Diego. If you want to be close to the beach this hotel is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ccjdw
Reviews.Content: This is a near perfect place to take your family for a vacation, if you like to be on the beach. The key is to pay more money to stay in a junior suite located right on the beach of Mission Bay. (Pictures of beach were taken right from our room patio.) The suite had a separate bedroom with a door, so my son could watch TV movies later at night without disturbing us. Our sons (9 and 14 years old) had plenty to keep them occupied. Jet ski's were a short walk to rent. My 9 year old loved the talking birds and the ducks that roamed the grounds the best. (They were not noisy or dirty.) We were there the week of July 4th, so that day the beach was more crowded and wild, which my older boy loved. We had perfect views of several firework shows. The staff did a good job fencing off the area right outside our room to keep the public away. The staff was excellent and went out of their way to help us, especially at the restaurant and the birds. There were many local restaurants within walking distance. We recommend Saska' (sushi, steak, seafood) and The Eggery (breakfast and coffee). The was a great grocery store - Ralph's - close by to stalk up on beverages and snacks. The location was a short distance from Sea World and Midway Magic airplane carrier, and a short drive to about everything else. We stayed for 6 days and did not have enough time to do everything we would have liked - Point is that there is lots to do. Negatives: 1) They did would not make the virgin coladas/daiquari's for the kids. My kids were so disappointed. When I requested one, since I couldn't have alcohol, one lady had to call for special permission and an other time I was just refused until I complained. The reason was that they didn't order enough mix??? 2) The hotel was older (The roof was dirty looking.) and in a questionable neighborhood. We felt safe, but did not go to the ocean side at night or let the kids go off the property by themselves. Go to the ocean side to get your souvenior T-shirts cheap from the beach vendors. I would definately stay here again in the suites, not in the towers. (One guest booked late and got a view on the parking lot.)

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star resort, but was great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My spouse and 2 teenagers spent a long weekend at the Catamaran. The grounds were beautiful with the foliage, fowl and waterfall. The pool was nice with food and bar service. The arcade nearby was entertaining to my 13 year old son. The watersports offerings on the beach were fantastic and reasonalbly priced. We had anticipated doing some surfing which is offered across the street at the main beach. We did that for about an hour, but it was a little rough for beginners. The beach was a place for older teens - twenty somethings and the partying was everywhere. The Catamaran offered a secluded escape from that with plenty of fun on the bay. We enjoyed the paddle boat ride and the dance music party that was offered. The hotel also had Hawaiian night, which featured food and entertainment, it was great. The Atoll restaurant was pricey (not outrageous), but the food was great, so it was well worth it. The hotel offers 2- 2 story buildings with rooms that have ocean view. When I return again, I will be sure to book one of these rooms which I'm sure go fast. The tower where we stayed offers ocean views on higher levels and garden views. We did have garden view on the 1st floor which was fine except when we opened the drapes to the sliding glass doors, we were on display like fish in a fish bowl. The room was big with a kitchenette and sitting area. It was ok, but really needs updating. It was clean so that is all that matters. With all the activities, the room was just a place to sleep. The service was very good including the people managing the watersports. Compared to the other hotels in the area, it is the most luxury that you will find. I would visit the Catamaran again.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced for their services”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay right on Mission Bay and had heard that the Catamaran was great. It was my aunt and I with our three small children (all under the age of 5). We felt that $319 a night was a little pricey, but it was a special vacation with our kids and we were having girl time.First of all, the umbrellas on the beach on the bay side, the hotel says they are for the guests with no charge. A lady came by and told us that they were $10 for half a day or $20 for the entire day. So, there's $10 extra! At lunch time, around 1:00p.m. We decided to go the Oasis snack shack on the beach, It was closed. Everyone in the hotel directed us to the Oasis snack shack, not realizing that it was closed. WE finally got our lunch in the bar and took it to the beach. But, nobody at the hotel knew why the snack shack was closed! That night we go to get on the Bahia Belle and it breaks down! Thinking that they might get it fixed, we stayed on the boat for an hour. It was never repaired, and our kids were REALLY looking forward to this. While on the boat a lady informed us that she only paid $169 for her room! We also called the Catamaran that night to see if rooms were going for that cheap! We could have booked the exact same room for $205, if we would have called the hotel direct. The management did say that they would work with the internet company and get some of our Money refunded. But, needless to say they did not! They did however take $70 of incidental charges off of our room (Overpriced parking, Lunch from the bar and breakfast, that was really good) The room was avaerage, but the view was great! It seemed as if the staff just really did not know what was going on! I will definetly not refer anyone to this "resort."

Reviews.Title: “nice grounds, but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful, and the Atoll resturant very nice, but the service at the hotel left some things to be desired. It took three days to get a pillow for the extra bed, they didn't give us enough towels to the number of guests and we ran out of TP. There was a small pool and a decent arcade which the kids loved. All in all it was okay but it could have been great.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catamaran Resort for 6 nights and we were uniformly pleased with the hotel, grounds, staff and amenities. We were in room 804 (a garden facing room with 2 beds), it was quiet, clean and suprisingly roomy. We are a family of four ( 2 adults and 2 children). We found pleasant surprises around every corner. In the lobby, the beautiful waterfall leads down to a duck pond that streams throughout a good deal of the grounds. The ducks and swans on the pond were fun to watch (especially the newly hatched ducklings). The exotic birds were displayed in a non-caged outdoor display. Bird handlers walk around the grounds and allow guests to ask questions and view the birds up close. We were happy to notice that groundskeepers clean all bird droppings promptly from the sidewalks. Our kids loved the pool, it was warm and clean. The beach area was also well kept and there were lots of options if you wanted to rent water sports items. We saw many people just beach combing or sunning on towels. We enjoyed a free movie night on the beach. The hotel set up 2 TV's, a sound system and staff passed out free drinks and popcorn as we watched Shrek 2. We were also happily surprised to be entertained by Hawaiian singers and dancers on the beach, and a live Reggae band was played at the pool periodically. The Catamaran's main restaurant, The Atoll was pricey, but good. For less fancy, inexpensive meals, you could get small plates at the Morays Bar, or the pool grill, or the Snack Shop at the beach, which is steps away from the hotel. All in all, we were thrilled with our stay. It was a very good value, great location, the parking garage was well lit and easy to get in and out of. The management clearly goes beyond the call of duty in providing a clean, safe entertaining hotel, I was surprised to read other negative reviews of the Catamaran Resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Catamaran is an okay place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed at the Catamaran for a 5-day trip to San Diego. The location of the hotel was great with lots of neat places to eat nearby and it was so close to the beach. Our first room was very small, outdated and dingy. I asked the front desk if they'd be willing to relocate us and they did to a bigger room with a duck pond right off the balcony. The room was bigger and had a better layout, but still felt dirty and muggy. The carpets and bedspreads didn't look clean. The rooms need to be renovated. The front desk was very friendly. The pool was great. The restaurant was overpriced, so we did not dine there. All in all, for the price, I think that there are better places in San Diego to stay. If we go back to San Diego, we will check out a different place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JenP75
Reviews.Content: I agree that the grounds were ok but the rooms were disgusting. It smelled horrible, everything was dusty and unkempt, and the toilet kept leaking. My neighbors were smoking in their room and the paper thin wallls let all of the smoke through to my room. For the price, I would assume the rooms would be better. I was supposed to stay longer but left because I was so horrified.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dewalters
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed at. I can't understand the negative or even neutral reviews of this hotel. The grounds are very beautiful and tropical and very well maintained. There is a stream running through the lobby and the grounds with ducks and fish swimming. The pool is very large and heated. The spa is the size of a small pool and kept at a perfect temperature. We had a bay-view suite in the 2-story building which was very nice and had a nice balcony. My only complaint about the room was that the door was very hard to close so we had to slam it, which was loud. Other than that, we loved being at this hotel. Great areas to take a leisurely walk or go eat and there is a grocery store within walking distance. We're looking forward to staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but”
Reviews.Author: tabasco3
Reviews.Content: the rooms could of been cleaner. My family stayed there in April and we loved the location of the hotel at the bay. It was a wonderful place to stay that offered beautiful walks, jogging,and bike riding in the morning. The pool was great and the hot tub was actually hot. The only dissapointment was the room seemed dirty. The rug seemed like a million people have walked on it before and it just seemed dirty. The bedspreads seemed that same way. I just think it needs a renovation. Other wise great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently had a chance to stay at the Catamaran resort and loved it. Was in town on a weekend and decided to stay in the mission beach area. When looking for hotels, I knew I wanted to stay at one of the nicer hotels by the beach because some parts of the area can be a little intimidating. Then I heard about the Catamaran from a friend, looked at their website and booked it at a very reasonable price for that type of hotel. When I arrived at the hotel I decided to valet my car and the guy who took my car was very friendly. Upon entering the lobby, you immidietly notice the giant koi pond and waterfall. The lady at the front desk was extremly helpful, pointing out all of the ammenties on the grounds and offered to have a bellman take my bags up to my room. When I got to my room, on the ninth floor of the tower, I was surprised to see that I had a kitchen in my room. The view from the balcony was absolutly amazing. I had what they call a city view of the pacific beach area and it was outstanding, you can even see the pacific ocean and watch the sunset from your room. The actual room was exactly what you would expect from a hotel room, A bed, closet, bathroom and tv. Nothing to exciting and nothing to really write about but staying in the room was not what I was in town for. I wanted to be close to the beach and from what I hear, the Catamaran is the only hotel in the mission beach area that you can acctually walk to from the hotel. The reastraunt was a little expensive for the area but having stayed at resorts around the world, I would say the "Atoll" reastruant was excellent and right on par for the price. As far as other reviews claiming that the shower and water presure was horrible, I dont know what they were talking about. I took a 10 minute shower and so did my girlfriend, and neither of us thought the water presure was bad. The temperature of the water statyed the same througout the whole shower. All and all this stay was excellent and would recomend this hotel if you are in the mission beach area for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviews that the grounds are beautiful and good location. I even found the staff to be OK. They were friendly and came quickly when my daughter had an accident at night. We enjoyed the beach, the pool, and the walking path. However, the actual hotel room was horrible. Our 2 bed suite was so small, we did not even have room to open our suitcases. When we got up every morning to take a shower, so did our neighbors. This resulted in us getting scorched by hot water, which did not make it easy to give our children a shower. So, if you are going to Catamaran to visit the grounds you will enjoy yourself but don't stay in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “The Catamaran was AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beansielove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the catamaran for four nights this past week. It was outstanding and well worth the money we paid. The property itself is georgeous. Their website photos do not do justice. Every room, unless you get a bayfront room, has a beautiful garden view. The interior of the property is a wonderful garden area with waterways, exotic plants and lush gardens. There are several types of bird, ducks, parrots and what not that call the Catamaran home. At night, they light bamboo torches which adds a nice touch. The pool area is great as well. Very nice with a bar in the spring/summer months. Large hot tub and a nice big heated pool. Our room was superb. We stayed in room 601, a bay front room which was great. It had a bayview, the room was clean and nicely decorated. Nice touches, furniture, an actual closet, bug bathroom which was clean. Note: We were attending a wedding and when we visited the bride in her bay front suite, which was located on the bottom floor-it was a little musty smelling. Other then that- nice as well. Room service and restaurant were great. Good service, good value and excellent food. Try the four cheese pizza-yummmm! All in all- it was excellent. Would highly recommend the Catamaran and will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but no sleep whatsoever.”
Reviews.Author: Stacki
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I ventured to San Diego last weekend for one night and decided to hole up near the beach. The Catamaran looked like a decent hotel, so we booked it and headed down. When we first pulled up, it looked as we had thought it would, but upon walking into the lobby it appeared to be much more posh than expected. There were koi ponds with waterfalls, beautiful tile floors and dark wood trim and palms everywhere. There are several courtyards with great landscaping and more ponds and I kind of got lost in the first five minutes, but then found my way. The room was clean and had a small kitchen with stove and fridge, which was a pleasant suprise. There was also a couch and a big balcony. At this point things are looking up. So we went about our business in San Diego, turning in after a few drinks around 3am. At about 7am the noise began to our head's dismay. The walls must be made out of paper because I could hear a child as if they were actually in our room, screaming and running around. And everytime he jumped or anything, it sounded like a bulldozer coming through the wall. Finally they left for SeaWorld (as heard through their convo) and bam! Apparently construction was needed at 9am. It sounded like a jackhammer, though I never actually looked, but it lasted until 12pm, which was about the time we checked out. It was horrible. Like I said, it was a nice hotel, but I will never stay there again due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Only Average”
Reviews.Author: Richiewoodhouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK but not great. The staff were OK but the reception staff gave the impression that they were half asleep and couldn't really be bothered. The garden area with the ducks and parrots is very good. The pool area was nice. Luckily most of the hotel seemed to be occupied by business travellers so there was plenty of room at the pool. I think it would be too small if the hotel had more tourist clients. The rooms and beds were the smallest out of the 5 hotels we stopped in during our trip to California. Also the bathroom had no hair drier. The plumbing in the hotel was terrible. The next room's shower woke me up every morning at 6.30am. From the bedroom it made more noise than our own shower. We didn't use the restaurant as this is very expensive for the area. The steaks were twice the price of the nearby restaurants. We went to Taylor's restaurant and brewery (with my wife and two kids) and had lovely food, great beer and an excellant view of the Pacific from the roof top area.

Reviews.Title: “Wow good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! The view from our room was fanastic. The room was clean and well maintained. The staff was very attentive and friendly. This stay was on a whim returning from a two week stay in Cabos San Lucas. My wife and I thought we would lay over in San Diego and explore. We certainly picked the right hotel. The Catamaran was located near everything we what to see and do. Great choice will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: agac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days. We had a great time. We had a room facing the garden and pond in the 800 section. The room was large, with a table and chairs. The room was very clean, but expect your room to be cleaned late in the day (3-4 pm). The section we were in was only 2 stories. We were happy that we were not staying in the tower. The front desk staff was friendly as were the numerous staff in the resort. The hotel is in a great location- backing on Mission Bay which is very calm and relaxed and accross the street from the more vibrant Pacific Beach. There are lots of restaurants in the area. My biggest criticism is that the resort charges for parking ($9/day), and the rates are a little bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “RE: Nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel and would recommend it for families. We stayed for 5 days with our two kids, ages 9 and 4, and it was a great place for them. The room had a beautiful view of the Bay, and was clean and fairly spacious. I thought the waitstaff at the hotel restaurant were pleasant and accomodating of kid-friendly requests. The grounds are lovely and it was a pleasure just to walk around. It is extremely convenient to Sea World and has some nice little amenities, like printed directions to most major tourist sites from the hotel, free (to guests) cruises of the Bay on the Bahia Belle, and kayak/pedalboat/windsurf rentals on the beach right outside the hotel doors. Lots of little shops and places to eat within walking distance (terrific little burrito shack right around the corner that we would have walked right by were it not for a tip from hotel staff) and of course the ocean is just a block away. It was a low-key, hassle free visit. I would rate it excellent except that it was fairly expensive. Still, I feel we got what we paid for and that is worth a lot on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good night stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: CRS61
Reviews.Content: After travelling from the UK via Los Angeles, I was very pleased to arrive at this hotel. The room was of a good size with all the things we have come to expect on our travels. The bar in the hotel was also very friendly and had entertainment laid on as well. The next morning we walked out the back to be greeted by the fantastic bay front location , prior to having a hearty breakfast. We enjoyed our 1 night stay after travelling for 15 hrs and would go back again. Well done Catamaran, I hope to come back one day. Thanks San Diego what a great City. Also the people here are so friendly..

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Delight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but great views of the ocean or bay (Sea World fireworks can be seen from room). Very clean, bright, airy room with kitchen and sofa bed. All areas of hotel were very clean. Parrots wre fun. Pool, hot tub, beach areas were great. Ate breakfast and lunch outside at the Atole Restaurant. Very good , fresh food, although service was a bit erratic each time. The free cruise was fun. Although not quite excellent, this hotel is way above average.

Reviews.Title: “brit recent visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: catamaran a good hotel but has service issues. stayed 3 days after cruise,booked hotel because good reviews but found slight differences. one of the reasons i booked, bahia bell cruises round bay with drinks and music, in dry dock no cruises but still on web site only told when in hotel.had to carry our cases up to and from rooms, even though porters were there.booked taxi to airport with them, but not told when taxi arrived, had to go out to find 10 mins after it arrived. also good local transport, very cheap, but told, must get taxis. training needs at front door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location- Poor quality rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: amuzed2death
Reviews.Content: Catamaran is located by the bay, and within walking distance to Ocean. However, the rooms need major renovation. Do not expect the kind of service you normally get from major brand hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL_9999
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Catamaran Resort for one nite over the Christmas 2004 holiday. We had a nice stay. Our room was quiet, large and clean with a balcony overlooking the gardens (we were in the tower). The kitchen appliances were a little old, but functional- our kids especially liked the full-sized refrig to store their sodas and snacks- not the 'mini bar' that you see in hotels so often. As other reviewers have mentioned, the grounds are beautiful and our kids loved the tropical birds. We had a great breakfast on the beach at the hotel's restaurant. We ordered off the regular menu since we thought the Sunday buffet was very pricey at $32.95. Great, friendly service. The kids menu was an especially good value. A great place to have a hot cup of coffee in the winter. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids and beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: kidfree
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Catamaran ( myself, my husband, two boys ages 10 and 8 and my mother). We had two rooms next to one another, but not adjoining. The staff was very accomodating and the rooms were nice. The grounds were gorgeous and my sons loved watching the ducks from the patio each morning. The hot tub and pool were nice and since the weather wasn't so great while we were there, they were never crowded. We walked to breakfast at the Eggery across the street and were either a short walk or a short drive to everywhere we wanted to eat like Joes Crab Shack . We loved being near the beach and the bay. The Sunday brunch was EXCELLENT and the restaurant, even the bar, had a good kids menu. We payed $129 a night and we were in buiding 7 which was very quiet. It was not the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in, but for the price and the location and with the kids it was wonderful and I would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretika's first choice.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I though this resort was very classy and I can't wait to visit the resort again. My stay was very comfortable. One particular reason I have for enjoying my stay there would be because of the great hotel staff. I especially thought the handsome, and of course gorgeous gentlemen behind the concierge desk was very helpful. His name was Joshua. Well that is my review and I hope to visit again most likely within 6 months. Love, Pamela Pretika Shankar

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lynachka
Reviews.Content: Ok..Where do I begin. After careful research and after reading 100's of reviews on Trip Advisor..i finally picked Catamaran Resort in San Diego. I wanted to plan a romantic vacation for my boyfriend and I. Both of us wanted to be on the beach and this resort was absolutely everything we could ask for. As soon as we walked in. we saw a beautiful waterfall inside the lobby. we arrived early and were given a room with a beautiful garden view within 5 minutes. The room was perfectly clean. no mildew or smell. everything seemed new. Lots of towels. The maid cleaned our room every morning. The location is unbelieavble. exotik trees, birds and ducks, fish everywhere. my boyfriend and I felt we were in paradise compared to the dirt we are used to in NYC. The beach (private) was 2 seconds away from our door and quiet. The water sports are tons of fun.. There is a million things to do within the area. I would recommend this resort to anyone. Its not a cheap place so dont expect to get anything for free. But i do not regret the $240 i paid per night. It was totally worth it. You can drive to La Jolla which is 10 mins away. Downtown city San Diego is 10 mins away. the Wild ANimal Park was amazing. All in all. we have absolutely no complaints and would most definately return to the Catamaran. If you have any questions, please email me. Id love to help.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel had some water problems....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend on a company function and as far a group facilites go, the accomodations are fantastic. The banquet room was beautifully decorated, and the food exquisite. The bartenders were a bit rude and did not seem to enjoy their job though.... We got a room with a king sized bed. This is 'just' a hotel room and not really worth the money spent on it. There was no fridge, or microwave and no fan in the bathroom. The water in the shower was just warm enough, but if you like a hot shower, forget it. The room was very clean but the air conditioner leaked all over the carpeted floor inside the door. Water splashed all over the patio door and into the room from the air conditioner on the floor above also. The whole weekend saw the hotel employees riding up and down the elevator with the wet vac, apparently vacuuming up water in many rooms from the same problem. The view was not too great if you got the rooms looking over the parking garage. I would highly recommend asking for a 'bay view' if you want to wake up to something other than employees arriving for work... In spite of the small problems, the hotel is beautiful and the location is fantastic! Although an older hotel, it is still maintained well. The grounds are impeccable and the exotic birds are an added plus. We would definitely go back in the future for more company functions. There is so much to see and do, all within a few miles for the entire family. One weekend simply isn't enough time....

Reviews.Title: “Ups (location) and downs (elevators) at Catamaran”
Reviews.Author: kerrible
Reviews.Content: Just back from 6 nights (8/28-9/4) at Catamaran and have to agree that the Tower is showing its age -- e.g., leaky air conditioners that drip on the outdoor deck, which could use a serious paint job, and two (just 2 for everyone, service included) agonizingly slow elevators (we were on 10th floor). But the beautiful grounds are impeccably kept and though the rooms were cleaned late-ish, they were cleaned well (and we tipped well for it, but not in advance, so they were great without $$ incentive). There were a ton of kids there, and the inevitable games of Marco Polo in the pool (it was not THAT cold) can be unnerving for the kid-less. The Bahia Belle sternwheeler is lovely at night, and all the birds and fish are charming. However: We had no kitchen, no fridge, no grace notes, just a room, and felt no real personal touch about the place. Seems the property is undergoing a change in direction -- more family-oriented, though I heard rumors that the video arcade (formerly a rock 'n' roll club) is turning into a spa. Good idea. Location is primo, even with the occasional beach bum sleeping near the ocean; Mission Beach has lots of character and plenty of great restaurants to sub for the Catamaran's tasty but pricey Atoll. Have to agree that the younger staff were relatively clueless, but all were pleasant. We'd go back, but we would not pay top dollar. Three stars is about right, except an extra star for animal lovers like me, who love seeing koi and cockatoos in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room was fair”
Reviews.Author: JulieMI54
