Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in August (16-19). Older hotel and the rooms & hallways showed it. No 'fridge in room as expected; vending & ice machines in the 14-floor tower were only on two floors. Private beach was a plus; public beach crowded and dirty. The concierge went above & beyond for us in resolving an issue with a hot air balloon company and seemed to go out of his way to ensure all guests were taken care of in a respectful manner. We were originally given a room right across from the elavator on the 7th floor and after looking at the room, asked for a different location. The desk staff had no problem in finding us a different room on the 10th floor. This room was the last one on the floor and housekeeping never seemed to clean it before 3 pm which caused a few problems. We'd leave for the day around 9am and returned in the afternoon to a dirty room. We ate breakfast at the resturant and the service and food were outstanding. I don't think I'd stay out on Mission Bay again; LaJolla was nicer and quieter and I would recommend staying there if possible, and if you're a couple with no children. Even thought the pool area was nice and large; THE WATER WAS FREEZING!!!!! So most everyone laid around the pool, but no one was swimming. A few brave kids were in the water, but not long. Had to pay for parking in their ramp, but at least the car was secure. Steps out of the ramp were a problem for luggage; no ramps available to roll suitcase to and from the hotel grounds. Pretty decent place in all; I'd give it a B.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jlbigguy
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Catamaran. I am surprised at the number of negative comments. We spent 6 nights in the tower (facing the parking lot) and our room was pristine. Very clean, no odors, no mold, and no outside noise. The beds were firm, and the room furniture had no visible wear. Plenty of hot water, too hot, as one could scauld themselves too easily. The room was very large, and being an early riser I could turn on a lamp at the couch and read without waking up the family. The kitchen has a full size refrigerator, full size oven (who's cooking on vacation?), but was missing a microwave (need hot popcorn for movies!). The grounds are lovely, and the wildlife dresses it up even more. We did not see any areas of the resort that looked worn or in disrepair. The beach on the bay is clean and quiet. Be sure to bring beach towels, as the hotel does not supply them. Just a little unnerving knowing that anyone can be watching you on the webcam. The beach on the Pacific Ocean is only a short block away, but is very busy, and has quite a few homeless spending the evening there (made early morning walks on the beach uncomfortable). The Atoll restaurant has very good service (but is pricey), and it is the only choice at the hotel. Fortunetely, there are plenty of restauraunts nearby. Plenty of entertainment right at the hotel, from the parrots, nightly torch lighting, Tuesday night family movie on the bay, murder mystery cruise, the bahia bell, and the Friday night luau. Plenty of watersports available at reasonable prices. My son had a great time in the Arcade, which is the best I have seen in any hotel, and the price cannot be beat (all day for $10), and you can get free 2 hour coupons at the front desk by just asking. Was it perfect? No place is. We had purchased the 3 in 1 package for Sea World, the Zoo, and Wild Animal Kingdom in advance from the Hotel. Upon arrival, the front desk told us to go to the gift shop to pick them up. The gift shop told us to go to the front desk. No one knew where the tickets were, but they did know that we paid for them. It took 30 minutes to find the tickets. That bit of aggrivation should have been avoided. The lodgenet in room movies was not working in our room the first night. However, it was promptly repaired once we reported it. All in all, we enjoyed our stay. The location is great, having both the bay and the beach, and major attractions (Sea World, the Zoo, and Downtown) are just minutes away. Should we return to San Diego in the future, we will stay at the Catamaran again.

Reviews.Title: “Fully Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were happy with the hotel and had a wonderful time. Was the hotel perfect? No. If you're going to dwell on the occasional mishap & ruin your vacation, you're a fool. The best points of the hotel were: 1. A nice, uncrowded stretch of Mission Bay Beach right behind the hotel; 2. a nice, uncrowded, wide, well kept stretch of ocean beach one block away; 3. the parrots; 4. the video arcade, with a 2 hour free trial for kids; 5. good food at the hotel; 6. lots of nearby resteraunts; 7. nice pool & hot tub; 8. in-room movies; 9. in-room refrigerator; 10. pretty grounds; and 11. complimentary boat ride. As an added bennefit, there is a Hooter's resteraunt nearby that had the best service I've ever received at a resteraunt. Hooter's has a bad reputation in my town, but I serously suggest you give it a try anyway. These were really friendly waitresses. As an example, one waitress spent 15 minutes playing with a couple's baby so they could enjoy their meal. My very fussy daughter ate her entire meal; and my husband was tickled that I took him there. Seriously, ladies, give it a try. Back to the Catamaran, here is it's only flaw: the hotel staff were competent but not outstanding. They work by the rules management have given them & only have so much leeway around that. As an example, the worst clerks I've encountered are borred college students, who don't know their merchandise & don't care. The best I've ever encountered was a McDonnald's manager who gave away free small fries coupons when people complained; they always walked away happy. The Catamaran hotel staff fall some where in the middle ground, as do most service personel. If you read the complaints of other reviewers, most fall into this category: the staff did what they could to address the issue, usually competently but not always to the guest's satisfaction. That was my experience, as well. The combined access of Mission Bay & the Pacific Ocean make this nice hotel a wonderful choice for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not worth four stars”
Reviews.Author: carlag
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Catamaran. I have to agree that this hotel is not worth four stars. Much of it is in disrepair. The room they put us in when we first got there was run down, and had wet carpet as a result of a leak. In was in the tower facing the parking lot. It had a small kitchen which was nice, and was large, but other than that, I was not impressed. As we went to bed, we heard "drip, drip" as the leak fell on the air conditioning unit, and my husband thought he saw mold which we didn't want to breathe in, so we requested another room. This room was nicer, had a pull-out sofa and was even larger, but still not worthy of four stars. The grounds were okay, but coming from Phoenix where there are many beautiful five star resorts, again, I was not that impressed. What I did like was walking around the area - the bay side behind the hotel is very pretty, and across the street is Mission Beach which was a bit dirty, but nice. The last night at the Catamaran, I was laying in bed and put my hand up on the pillow and felt something sharp (my infant son was sleeping right below this pillow). In the morning I checked it out, and it was a maid's name tag under the pillowcase. The needle was sticking straight up. I showed this to the manager and they gladly comped most of our bill. I was happy with how they handled the situation (they apologized and contacted numerous departments of the hotel to discuss it), but sheesh! I most likely will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel needs face lift”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 week holiday in California. We stayed in the Catamaran for 10 days. We had requested a non smoking king size room and we were disappointed to be given a room with 2 beds which was really dark and reeked of smoke. Luckily the friendly Irish receptionist was able to move us to another room. This was a bit brighter and had a king size bed. It was unfortunately in the tower just across from the elevator and had a connecting door to another room. The noise was dreadful. The hotel definitely needs a major face-lift. The location is perfect but the hotel looks grubby both outside and inside. For the price we paid I definitely expected a bit more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “7 nights in beautiful San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catamaran for 7 nights in July. Great location since you have a choice of going to the ocean or bay. Room was very clean but the air conditioning could have been colder. Complimentary admission to arcade in Cannibal Bar - lots of video games for my nine year old to enjoy. Very clean pool. Some of negatives - the temperature of water in shower constantly changed. They should have a more toned down menu for families if they choose to eat at the hotel, but there are places close enough to make up for it, especially the Eggery for breakfast. Finding parking in the lot was a bit of a hassle since they were open to the paying public & did not block spots for their hotel guests (even though we had to pay as well). Overall, we had a great time & it is definitely in a great location, convienent to all. If we ever go back to SD, I would definitely stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family of 4”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Catamaran was a perfect place for our family of 4. Our twin 3 year olds loved the ducks in the pond. The room was nice and service was good. Nothing fancy but the location was perfect and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “All in All, a Pretty Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Catamaran, and overall was pleased with it. The Polynesian atmosphere is nice and the grounds are well-kept. The staff was friendly in every area of the hotel. Rooms were slightly worn, but were clean and neat. Location is good, being right on Mission Bay and one block from the ocean, although that part of the beach (Pacific Beach) looked like it gets a lot of use and can be a little rough around the edges after nightfall. If you're looking for a more secluded beach you'll need to travel elsewhere. There are many restaurants nearby, and The Atoll restaurant in the hotel was also good -- tasty, with fairly reasonable resort prices. I wouldn't want to pay exorbitant rates to stay here, but at the right price it's a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not very friendly or professional”
Reviews.Author: bhappy2day
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Catamaran after a 4 nights stay @ 245.00 per night. I feel this hotel is way over priced. The grounds were beautiful but the room was just okay. Also, I felt the staff could have cared less if they helped you or not (very unprofessional). Woke up one morning only to find a couple homeless individuals sleeping in front of our room on the beach. Did not feel completely safe here. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent options for familes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. I can't say enough good things about it. We had a bayview studio and the view was incredibly of the bay and the ocean. The grounds are very nice and my 3 year old loved the ducks and parrots. Wished the bar had been open by the bay but is was not as of yet.

HotelInfo.Name: Catamaran Resort Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 3999 Mission Blvd., San Diego, CA 92109
